1.content:
Poptropica is a world parallel to earth, consisting of islands from different time periods and timelines. Some of these islands are from the main timeline or timelines similar to the main one (Shrink Ray Island, Counterfeit Island, Spy Island), while others are from timelines far different (Game Show Island, Steamworks Island, Goofball Island).

According to Spencer Albright, Poptropica is "a group of islands that have come unstuck from their place in the proper timeline", and that it's a ‚Äúrest stop on the highway of history. Different eras periodically stop here. So long as they don‚Äôt collide, each one eventually returns to where it came from and history continues as it should.‚Äù

The islands pop in and out of the timeline because something on them needs to be put right. Unfortunately, this fact is unknown to the majority of the inhabitants.

Chunks of different areas and time periods appear as islands rising from portals in the ocean. The islands eventually sink back down and go back to their respective timelines, but as Jonas said, it's a rare thing that happens (Interesting to note is that the only in-game island which has been shown sinking down and rising up repeatedly is Poptropolis Games Island).

Under the Poptropica ocean is a cave that is the center of time, and the cause of Poptropica‚Äôs existence.

2.content:
Poptropica: Forgotten Islands is a game by Ubisoft that was also released on the iTunes Store for mobile devices. It was released on September 5, 2013. It was later released on the 3DS on October 14, 2014. In it, you explore unique islands and go on quests that can't be found anywhere else. Character customization is encouraged, with over 100 costumes the player can unlock. It has since been taken off the iOS App Store.




Description: It will take you on a journey to discover the secrets of Poptropica‚Äôs buried past, one artifact at a time. Explore new islands, meet new characters, and take to the skies in a powered-up blimp that gains new abilities as you play! With each new island group, you'll uncover the hidden history of Poptropica's forgotten islands.‚Äù
‚ÄîPoptropica Creator's Blog

"Climb aboard your almighty blimp and explore the vast uncharted islands of Poptropica. Steer clear of hazards and discover exotic islands beneath the clouds. Take to the islands and embark on quests while discovering the secrets of Poptropica‚Äôs past, one artifact at a time. Poptropica: Forgotten Islands on Nintendo 3DS is an adaptation of the popular virtual world for kids. Customize your avatar and travel on foot or by blimp across multiple islands. Collect artifacts and other items and discover the mystery of the Forgotten Islands!‚Äù
‚Äî Ubisoft's Game Overview





Walkthrough: 

Tow Islands:

You‚Äôll begin your adventures on Tow Island, where your character says a blimp was seen crashed nearby. Tap and hold to move where you want to go, and head right until you see a guy in aviation gear. (Tip: Any time someone has a scroll above their head, it means they‚Äôll have a quest for you!) He‚Äôll introduce himself as Big Tow.

Big Tow wants you to find a valve. Continue walking right until you come across the valve, which you can tap to add to your backpack. Return to Big Tow and give him the valve. You‚Äôll unlock the Map icon in the upper-right corner which you can use to go exploring with your blimp!

Go right until you see a Multi-Tool under a bamboo doorway and pick it up. You may also have noticed along the way that there are floating golden coins you can collect! These can be used later to accessorize your character, so start saving. Anyway, head back to Little Tow and return the Multi-Tool (which isn‚Äôt actually a comb). You‚Äôll complete your first quest and earn 50 coins!

Now you should go find Bro Tow, who‚Äôs milling about on a house just to the right. He wants you to find and create a pair of gears. Keep going right and you‚Äôll pick up a Gear, Wrench, and another Gear. Tap the screen repeatedly to put the gears together, then return to Bro Tow. You‚Äôll earn another 50 coins for another quest completed.

Now go back to Big Tow. He‚Äôll tell you about a cave in the northeast island with some scary monsters that an adventurer like you might want to check out. You‚Äôll also unlock the blimp icon in the upper-right corner, where you can spend your coins in the Closet to dress up your character and view the Blimp Upgrades and Artifacts you‚Äôve earned so far.

Go exploring (via blimp) and land on the island with the purple scroll. Walk right until you pick up a Metal Piece and Temperature Gauge, then head back left and turn these items in to Bro Tow, who will give you 100 coins in exchange.

Go back to the original Tow Island and you‚Äôll find Big Tow next to an underground cave. Hop inside and try to take the Artifact. A monster known as one of the Mabaya will snatch it away from you.

Talk to Big Tow again, and now you‚Äôll be able to leave the Tow Islands and go explore the rest of the world!







Giant Islands:

Go exploring, and this time, go over the border at the top and leave the Tow Islands region. Head south to a region called the Giant Islands. Land on the labeled Giant Island marked with a yellow scroll. Go right and you‚Äôll find Chuck, the leader of the archeological crew camped on the island.

Run all the way to the right, careful to avoid the stinging mushrooms along the way, until you reach a giant skeleton. Go back to Chuck and tell him he‚Äôs got nothing to worry about.

Now he wants you to go find some monster bones. Go right again and pick up the various Dinosaur Bones lying around (there are 5; the last one is a giant skull).

Run back to camp and hand the bones to Chuck. Now tap repeatedly to put the skeleton together, and you‚Äôll earn 200 coins along with Artifact 1: The Mabaya Emerge, plus a blimp upgrade that blasts rocks out of your way!

Go exploring again, and you‚Äôll find an island with a purple scroll to the south. You‚Äôll eventually meet a girl who says she‚Äôs low on supplies and asks you to fetch her a flashlight and sleeping bag. Go back left and pick up the Dead Flashlight and Battery to create a Flashlight.

Further left, you‚Äôll find a Sleeping Bag. Now go back to the girl and she‚Äôll reward you with 100 coins.






Mystic Islands:

Leave the island group and enter the Mystic Islands region to the north, landing on the labeled Mystic Island with a yellow scroll. Walk right and you‚Äôll meet Taylor, the leader of the Trinity Syndicate, who won‚Äôt let you through until you have the approval of his three lieutenants, who are standing to his right. Talk to them and they‚Äôll tell you to fetch them a mountain peak, pyramid peak, and pointed roof. What odd requests!






Artifact Description: 

If you view all your Artifacts from your blimp, you‚Äôll see that they tell a story of Poptropica‚Äôs past:

1. Giants and monsters compete for territorial dominance over a primeval land.
2. Poptropicans who fled underground to avoid the great flood emerge many years later as The Mabaya.
3. Seafaring Poptropicans form the Trinity Syndicate and conquer the mainland Poptropicans who drive them away.
4. Monks hide the artifacts away during the war between the Trinities and the mainland Poptropicans to avoid their destruction.
5. Seafaring Poptropicans return to their homeland after the great flood only to be driven away by greedy mainland Poptropicans.
6. Pirates attack the Trinities and drive them away from their homes.

A proper description:

Poptropica started out as a single landmass. Then a series of cataclysmic battles between giants and monsters took place in an attempt to rule the great land. However, no clear winner emerged. Instead, the beasts‚Äô great power caused the very land they were fighting for to crumble beneath them, triggering what became known as the Great Flood. It would be this flood that would create the islands of Poptropica as they are known today. The original Poptropicans who inhabited the landmass prior to the flood fled underground to escape the destruction, where they emerged many years later as the Mabaya. Poptropicans from distant lands then landed on their islands, who called themselves the Trinity Syndicate.

The Syndicate attempted to colonize these lands which escalated into a war between the groups, and during this war, monks set out to protect the artifacts that would allow the aforementioned history to be documented. The war ended in a Mabaya victory, enticing the Syndicate to flee back to their lands in an attempt to save their pride. But they were forced to make peace with their enemies and remain inhabitants on the islands when they learned that their own people, wretched with greed, were unwilling to take them back. Later, pirates arrived on these islands who ironically attacked the Syndicate themselves, when they were saved by a young hero.

3.content:
Poptropolis Games Island 2013, commonly known as simply Poptropolis Games Island, was the 27th island as for the sunken Poptropolis Games and the 36th island as of Poptropolis Games 2013 on Poptropica, being released for members on May 24, 2012 and for everyone on June 14, 2012. In it, you join the Poptropolis Games and must defeat all of the other tribes. It sunk in January 24, 2013, but rose again as Poptropolis Games 2013. It was sometimes abbreviated as PG and/or PG13.






Plot: Poptropolis Games Island takes place on Poptropolis which rose from the sea. Here is the description from Poptropica:

‚ÄúOnce every 100 years, the ancient capital of Poptropica -- Poptropolis -- rises from the sea to host a tournament created to prove tribal supremacy. Each of the tribes of Poptropica sends a representative to compete across a series of grueling events for a chance to become the Champion of Poptropica. Do you have what it takes to vanquish the competition and win glory for your tribe?‚Äù
‚ÄîPoptropica






Full Walkthrough: The beginning to the island is pretty self-explanatory. After the cool intro sequence, just walk to the right and talk to the guy with the microphone. Follow him to the Colosseum to participate in the games. After the opening ceremony, where the archer starts the torch with a flaming arrow, walk over to him again and speak with him to select your first event. Listed below are guides to all the events in Poptropolis Games with all the cheats and secrets you need to win all of the games to win the medallion!




Archery:
The goal in archery is to get the highest score using ten arrows. In theory, the highest possible score is 100, meaning you'd get a bullseye on every shot. Archery is one of the easier events in Poptropolis Games. Here's how to play. First, pay really close attention to the wind direction and speed. Line your cursor up to the center of the target and then adjust the position to the left or right based on the wind direction and the speed. The best thing to do is to take a few practice rounds to get a feel for how much you need to move based on the wind.

Diving:
In Diving, you will leap from the top of a waterfall while attempting to complete diving routines. Each routine is a series of flips in certain directions. To do the flip, just hold your mouse cursor to the left or the right of your Poptropica character as you dive down. When you complete all the flips, click the mouse to finish the dive correctly. If you perform perfect dives, you will get 10 points for the first round, 15 points for the second round, and 20 points for the third round. The highest possible total is 45 points.

Hurdles:
Hurdles is a simple race where you need to time your jumps over hurdles. If you jump to soon or too late, you'll hit the hurdle and slow down. It can be a little tricky to get over all the hurdles cleanly. The good news about this event is that no matter what, you'll place 1st, 2nd or 3rd overall.

Javelin:
In Javelin, your goal is to toss the spear as far as you can. There are two controls. The first is the angle of the shot. Click once to set it. You're aiming for the green area. Once you do, the power meter will start immediately. Click when it's in the green zone. Click too soon and you'll have a wimpy throw. Click too late and you'll foul out. You get three chances to try and get the highest distance possible. There aren‚Äôt any real cheats or secrets here: just go for the green! The power meter has the biggest impact on your throw. You'll want to try and time it to hit just at the very end of the green zone. If you do and you've angled the shot okay, you can get a pretty long throw. Your longest throw of the three attempts will be your final score for the event.

Long Jump:
The Long Jump is another distance contest where you get three attempts. To start, click and hold the mouse button. Release the button right before you get to the end of the runway (don't wait too long or you'll fall into the mud and get a foul). Once you release the button, you'll jump into the air. Click again as soon as you've reached the highest point of your jump to "extend" it. Your longest jump of the three will be your final score.

Pole Vault:
Pole Vault is yet another distance event but with a difference in how it starts. You'll get a countdown and then you'll start running automatically. Click and hold once to plant your pole just as you step into the Launch area. Release to release the pole. If you time everything correctly, you'll sail over the bar and land with good distance. Your longest distance of three attempts counts as your final score. Usually, if you get higher than 48 meters, you'll win the event.

Power Lifting:
Power Lifting is one of the longer (and more difficult) of the events. You'll start with 100 kg of weight. You need to click on a moving target that arcs back and forth above you. If you click on it and "hit" it will turn green and you'll lift the weight a little higher. If you click and miss, or wait too long to click, it will turn red and you'll drop the weight a little lower. You need to get enough green "hits" to lift the weight completely and move to the next round. Each subsequent round gives you less time, the weight doubled, and a faster target to hit. A good tip is to be a little patient since getting lots of misses only makes it harder to lift the weight all the way. Good luck!

Shot Put:
Shot Put is another angle/power combo event but with trickier controls. First you set your angle with three clicks. You want to try and get all three into the green zone. If you miss a little with one of the earlier clicks, you can adjust for it with the next one. Your final angle of throw will be the dotted line. Next comes the power setting. Your goal here is to click when all three dials are in the green zone. The easiest way is to watch the outer ring, which is moving the slowest. Every other revolution of the outer dial will produce a brief moment when all three are lined up in the green. This is at the precise moment when the outer ring is at the very top. It happens in a split-second, but click right then! If you've got a good angle and time the power just right, you'll get a great throw. You get three attempts and your longest distance of the three counts as your final score.

Volcano Race:
Also called Skiing, you must ski down a slope of molten lava (isn't Poptropica great?) avoiding obstacles in the way. Try to ski between the torches to boost speed and go up rock jumps to soar over obstacles (I BELIEVE I CAN FLY!). Get to the finish line in the shortest time possible to win.

Triple Jump:
Triple jump is a lot like the long jump, but you need to get the timing down. Click and hold the mouse button to begin. Release as soon as you get to the first white line. Then quickly click again each time you land for the next two jumps. Your timing needs to be good or you'll fall between the platforms and get a foul. Just as with most of the other events, it's your best score of the three attempts that counts.

Octopus Volleyball:
Basically what you do here is move your Poptropican around with the mouse and bounce the volleyball on your head (ouch!). To score a point you must bounce the ball over the net and it must hit the ground on the opposite side. Why is it called Octopus Volleyball? Because there is a massive orange octopus playing against you. The octopus can also score points the same way you score points. First one to 6 points win. Oh yeah, practice is highly recommended because that octopus is ON FIRE!

And Now, The Moment You've All Been Waiting For...:
Following all the events, the official results will be revealed. Remember that you don't have to win every event to get the highest overall total. Very few competitors will win multiple events, so as long as you've generally placed in the top 3 or so each time, you should win easily. If you win, you get the Island Medallion! If you lose, you have to try again! Congrats!




Bonus Quest: The ground shakes and then an ancient Poptropolis Games champion appears and he challenges you to a wrestling match. In this game, he will make an attack move and you must quickly respond with the correct defensive move. The correct move is based on the shapes. If he attacks with a move with an icon in a circle, you must click on the defensive move with a circle. The same goes for the square and octagon shapes. The key is to click very quickly, so a good cheat is to keep your mouse cursor over on the left side of the screen. Then when the defensive moves appear, you can quickly move and click.

If you get four points before your opponent, you win, and will go down in history as the greatest champion of all-time. You will also receive the Ancient Warrior Outfit as a reward.





Rising in 2013: As of September 27, 2013, Poptropolis Games Island is announced to be returning on the Poptropica Creators' Blog, there is a new trailer and there Member Only Items will return as well and the old bonus quest.

Poptropolis Games Island 2013 Dig:
On 22 October 2013, the Creators asked all Poptropicans to participate in the Poptropolis Games Island 2013 Dig. When you arrive on the island you will drop down on a floating platform with a diving chamber. You must enter the diving chamber to dive down into the sea, navigate past rocks and fish and sharks and dig up the Poptropolis Games. You can only dig a bit and then you will be transported back up to the surface. Whichever tribe contributes the most will be immortalized in the Main Street of the Poptropolis Games 2013 Island. The Wildfire tribe was victorious.








Tribes: 

- Flying Squid: The Flying Squid is one of the eight tribes that competes in the Poptropolis Games every 100 years.

Symbol: The Flying Squid tribe symbol is a green background with a splat of black ink styled to make the outline of a fierce squid.

Common Room: The Flying Squid Common Room has a submarine theme, with a captive giant squid and a large tub of squid ink that can turn you black if you jump into it.





- Seraphim: The Seraphim is one of the 8 tribes of every 100 years that competes in the Poptropolis Games.

Symbol: The symbol of the Seraphim is a pair of elegantly detailed black wings of a mythical creature on a mustard-brown colored background.

Common Room: The Seraphim common room resembles a ruined castle with the statue of an angel holding a crystal harp as the centerpiece. The common room appears to be located on a floating island in space, as many such islands can be seen in the distance. The castle is decorated with mirrors as well as candles that you can light up by clicking. There is also a raven and a telescope aimed into space.

Trivia: 

- The word 'seraphim' comes from an angelic being called a "Seraph."
- A Seraphim can also refer to a higher ranking angel with 4 faces and 6 wings. It is their job to keep lower ranking angels in check.
- If you don't choose to be a member of the Seraphim Tribe, any one of the other tribe representatives will take the place for the Seraphim representative, as the same for all the other tribes.





- Black Flags: The Black Flags is one of the eight tribes that, every 100 years, competes in Poptropolis Games. You can select to be in this tribe, or any other of the 7 other tribes in Poptropica.

Symbol: The Black Flags symbol is a ragged black flag with a bone for the mast.

Common Room: The Black Flags' Common Room is styled like an old pirate ship or a pirate hide-out. It occasionally starts raining, complete with thunder and lightning visuals and sound effects. There is a golden mermaid statue and skeletons of pirates scattered all over the place. The mast rises above the ship and a black flag flies over the crow's nest.





- Nightcrawlers: The Nightcrawlers are one of the eight tribes that compete in the Poptropolis Games.

Symbol: The Nightcrawlers' tribe symbol depicts an indigo worm wrapped along a crescent moon.

Common Room: The Nightcrawlers' common room is basically a large cave full of crystals, glowing fireflies, and giant insects. Some of the giant insects will hide away when approached. If you click on the baby spiders, they will wiggle about. There is also a study table on the third floor with a computer and several drawings and notes of the giant insects. If you click the computer screen, the display will change.


Tribe Jersey: The Nightcrawlers' tribe jersey is purple and white and will automatically be given to you when you choose the Nightcrawlers tribe on Poptropolis Games Island 2013.






- Nanobots: The Nanobots are one of the eight tribes that rise up every 100 years in the Poptropolis Games.

Symbol: The Nanobots tribe symbol is a red robot with a dome-shaped body, two wrench-like arms, two antennae and square eyes.

Common Room: The Nanobots common room is a futuristic, and very technological room. The most prominent feature might be the massive beat maker on the top floor.





- Pathfinders: The Pathfinders are one of Poptropolis's eight tribes and a selectable tribe in Poptropolis Games Island 2013.


Symbol: The Pathfinders tribe symbol is a brown eight-pointed compass on a blue background.


Common Room: The Pathfinders Common Room is a common room for the members of the Poptropican tribe, the Pathfinders. It has an adventurer/archaeologist theme.


Tribe Jersey: If you choose to be a member of the Pathfinders, you'll automatically get an exclusive tribe jersey. It's shirt is a sleeveless top that is blue with an orange front, with blue stripes across it. The pants are always legless, and completely blue. You can put this jersey on for the games if you wish, but you never have to.





- Yellowjackets: The Yellowjackets is one of the eight tribes that, every 100 years, competes in the Poptropolis Games.

Symbol: The Yellowjacket tribe symbol depicts a yellow background with a symmetrical black outline of a wasp at the center.

Common Room: The Yellowjackets common room is styled like a massive beehive, with teleporter pods at the sides. These pods transport your Poptropican to other pods around the room. There are also numerous wasp-themed machines and inventions, as well as a hologram of a Poptropican dressed as a wasp.






- Wildfire: The Wildfire is one of the eight tribes that competes every 100 years in the Poptropolis Games. You can select to be on this tribe, or the 7 other tribes.


Symbol: The Wildfire symbol is a red logo with orange fire-like designs.

Common Room: The Wildfire Common Room is a common room for members of the tribe, Wildfire. It's theme is a furnace with pipes connecting steam. At the top is a large robotic phoenix/dragon. If you play the organ underneath it, music notes will shoot out of the steam pipes attached to its wings. When you click the other steam-powered phoenixes, they shoot out steam.




Items: 

- Flying Squid Jersey (selectable)
- Seraphim Jersey (selectable)
- Black Flags Jersey (selectable)
- Nightcrawlers Jersey (selectable)
- Nanobots Jersey (selectable)
- Yellowjackets Jersey (selectable)
- Pathfinders Jersey (selectable)
- Wildfire Jersey (selectable)
- Island Medallion
- Ancient Warrior Outfit (Bonus Quest Only)





Poptropican Store Exclusives:



- Wrestling Gear (Members Only) (Limited Time)
- Plant-a-Statue (Members Only)
- Discus (Members Only)
- Poptropolis Games Balloon (Non-members/Members)




Mini-Games:

-Archery
-Diving
-Hurdles
-Javelin
-Long Jump
-Pole Vault
-Power Lifting
-Shot Put
-Triple Jump
-Wrestling (Bonus Quest Only)






Trivia:


- Poptropolis Games Island was released during the same year as the 2012 Summer Olympics.

- Poptropolis Games Island is the second island to have more than one main antagonist, after Reality TV Island.

- Poptropolis was the original name for Poptropica.

- Poptropica closed the Island due to the plot, but it was announced that it will be open as Poptropolis Games 2013.

- Poptropolis rises once every 100 years, although its playable for a couple of months every one year.

- If you don't win the contest you'll not complete the island and have to start all over back to the begining.

4.content:
The Protectors of Poptropica is a secret society that was created in order to prevent outsiders from tampering with the islands, in order to protect their timeline because they believed it was the only one.

They sent spies to each island, collected time crystals (which appear from where an island sinks back underwater to their timeline) and created the Aegis, a machine that controls the islands. After the Aegis was destroyed, the society ran away, and Jonas vowed to rebuild their operation and let Poptropicans have more freedom.




History: The society's goal was to protect the islands of Poptropica from being tampered with, and preventing the natives from leaving their islands. They believed that if an island is tampered with in any way and went back to the timestream, history would be rewritten, or even erased, with disastrous results. They did this because they believed the main timeline was the only one (although in the end they were wrong about this).

The society's base of operations is powered by the Aegis, which is a giant stone machine made out of many time crystals. They used the machine to control the islands in Poptropica. They used high-tech machinery, such as Hovercrafts and electric sticks. They all have tattoos of their symbol on their arms. Each Protector is given a magical map powered by the Aegis, and the top-ranking members like Jonas are given Time Crystal necklaces.

One member is stationed on each island, and are disguised as natives to the islanders. Some of them live separated from the natives if they can help it (Nils the Viking), and some of them live close to them (Lieutenant Rogers). They chase away adventurers to make sure they won't tamper with history.

After the events of The Secret Society the society no longer exists, as their hideout and technology were destroyed and the members became afraid and ran away. Jonas vows to find the other Protectors and rebuild their society, but with a slightly different operation now knowing that there are multiple timelines to protect.





Known Members:

- Spencer Albright (former leader)
- Jonas
- Nils (Viking)
- Amazon Protector (Anatolia)
- Jeeves (Globe Theatre)
- Lieutenant Rogers (H.M.S. Terror)
- Jenkins (Guard)
Others:

Former Members:
- Octavian

Honorary Members:
- Mya
- Oliver
- Jorge




Base:
The Protectors‚Äô base is a giant mansion located at the side of a mountain near the ocean. The known locations:

Kitchen:
The kitchen is where they cook food.

Hallways:
The hallways contain art pieces from every time period.

Dining Hall:
A large dining room with a long table.

Control Room:
The control room is a large room which is the center of the Protectors operation. It contains the Aegis, several large computers, and radios.

Conservatory:
The conservatory is an unseen but mentioned place. Spencer Albright looked for the children in there, but didn't find them.

Library:
The library is an unseen but mentioned place. Spencer Albright looked for the children in there, but didn't find them.

Caves:
The Caves are where the Protectors keep their vehicles, including Hovercrafts, boats, submarines, etc.

Technology:


Time crystals:
The Protectors collect time crystals from the ocean whenever an island disappears.

Aegis:

Hovercrafts:
Hovercrafts are large flying vehicles that are the Protectors' main source of transportation.

Stun Batons:
Stun Batons are what Troopers are equipped with for offensive/defense. They emit an electric shock.

Walkie-talkies:
Every spy stationed on an island has a walkie-talkie to contact each other.

Groups:

Control Room Workers:
They work in the control room, monitoring Poptropica through many screens. They use the Aegis to rewind time on an island to undo any interference.

Pilots:
The pilots fly the Hovercrafts.

Troopers:
The Troopers act as the guards and enforcers.

lorebooks.name: Avery‚Äôs Family
lorebooks.website_description: Pure blood vampire family!
lorebooks.description: Pure blood vampire family!
lorebooks.creator: Ilovethebeess

1.content: Maria Diaz is the mother of {{user}}. She is a pure-blood vampire coming from royalty and has very prejudiced views towards vampires who aren‚Äôt pure-blood. She is incredibly tall, with yellow eyes, long black curly hair that flows when she walks, and tanned golden skin. She wears black gothic dresses and only feeds off animal blood since she thinks feeding on humans is disgusting. She comes from wealth and looks down on anything beneath her. She has four children whom she holds to high standards and won‚Äôt stand for anything less. She is known to be the leader of the family; even her husband, Diego, is below her. She speaks English and Spanish since she‚Äôs Latina.

2.content: Diego Diaz is the father of {{user}}. He is a pure-blood vampire coming from a poor family in the slums of New York. He is shorter than the average vampire and has yellow eyes and dark skin. Diego has black, short, kinky, coily hair and is often seen wearing suits. Diego is a sweet vampire; unlike his wife Maria, he values honesty and doesn‚Äôt mind other vampires. He has four other children and accepts anything they will do as long as they‚Äôre safe and happy. He usually lets his wife get her way to avoid arguments, but even so, he does grow a backbone at times. He speaks English and Spanish since he‚Äôs Latino.

lorebooks.name: Pok√©dex Generation III
lorebooks.website_description: Generation III Pok√©dex. Wurmple evolves to different destinations depending on the numerical value of the personality value, but since we do not know the personality value in the large-scale language model, we do not know how it will behave. Remove Chimecho evolution
lorebooks.description: Generation III Pok√©dex. Wurmple evolves to different destinations depending on the numerical value of the personality value, but since we do not know the personality value in the large-scale language model, we do not know how it will behave. Remove Chimecho evolution
lorebooks.creator: turugi_NI

1.name: Treecko
1.content:
Treecko is a small, green, bipedal reptilian Pok√©mon. It has yellow eyes with long, narrow pupils. Treecko's hands and feet each have three digits covered with tiny spikes. These spikes allow it to scale vertical walls with ease. Its stomach and throat are red. It also has a line across its stomach resembling a pouch. Treecko has a large, dark green tail with two separate lobes that it uses to sense humidity. This ability allows it to predict the next day's weather.
Type: Grass
Abilities: Overgrow,Unburden
Evolution Conditions: Level 16 or higher
Evolution: Grovyle

2.name: Grovyle
2.content:
Grovyle is a bipedal Pok√©mon similar in appearance to a theropod dinosaur. It is primarily green with a red underside. There is a belt-like green stripe across its belly. Grovyle's hands have two clawed fingers and powerful legs with birdlike feet. Its well-developed muscles make it an expert climber and allow it to leap quickly from branch to branch. Grovyle has three long leaves on its wrists, a large leaf on top of its head, and two tails that have a leafy appearance. This leafy appearance allows it to be camouflaged in the forests where it lives. Leaf Blade was its signature move.
Type: Grass
Abilities: Overgrow,Unburden
Evolution Conditions: Level 36 or higher
Evolution: Sceptile

3.name: Sceptile
3.content:
Sceptile is a reptilian, bipedal Pok√©mon. Its neck is somewhat long, and it has two crests on its head. It has semicircular, yellow eyes with red rims. Its lower jaw and a belt-like band across its waist are also red. Along its back, it has two lines running down the middle and two rows of yellow nodules that are described as seeds. Its tail is shaped similar to that of a palm tree's branch. Both of its long arms have two sharp, elongated leaves and three claws. Leaf Blade was its signature move.
Type: Grass
Abilities: Overgrow,Unburden

4.name: Torchic
4.content:
Torchic is a small, chick Pok√©mon with stubby, downy, yellow wings. Its body is covered with orange feathers and a fluffy coat of down. There is an orange and yellow crest on its head that resembles a flame. Its two thin legs and short beak are a light brownish yellow, and the feet have three toes in front and one in the back. A male Torchic will have a small black speck on its rear that is not present in females.
Type: Fire
Abilities: Blaze,Speed Boost
Evolution Conditions: Level 16 or higher
Evolution: Combusken

5.name: Combusken
5.content:
Combusken is a bipedal, chicken-like Pok√©mon. Most of Combusken's upper body is yellow, while most of the lower body is orange. An orange, pointed design adorns the center of its waist at the dividing line of the two colors. It has orange eyes and a short, wide beak. There is a feather crest on top of its head with three orange points. This crest is smaller on female Combusken. Its tail is short and pointed. It has three, sharp claws at the ends of its long arms, and scaly, gray legs with well-developed thighs covered in shaggy feathers.
Type: Fire,Fighting
Abilities: Blaze,Speed Boost
Evolution Conditions: Level 36 or higher
Evolution: Blaziken

6.name: Blaziken
6.content:
Blaziken is a bipedal, chicken-like Pok√©mon. The majority of Blaziken's body is red with accents of beige, yellow, and gray. Behind its head, there are beige, hair-like feathers that continue downward and surround its chest and abdomen. It has a small red face with a V-shaped crest on its head. Blaziken's blue eyes are semicircular with yellow sclerae, and its mouth is similar to a hooked beak. It has featherless, gray hands with three fingers each, and three clawed toes that are not normally visible due to the shaggy, yellow feathers on the bottom of its legs. A female has a shorter mask and hair than a male.
Type: Fire,Fighting
Abilities: Blaze,Speed Boost

7.name: Mudkip
7.content:
Mudkip is a small, amphibious, quadrupedal Pok√©mon. It has a blue body with a light blue underside. Mudkip has a large head with a blue fin on top and a light-blue tail fin. It has black, beady eyes and orange, star-shaped gills on its cheeks.
Type: Water
Abilities: Torrent,Damp
Evolution Conditions: Level 16 or higher
Evolution: Marshtomp

8.name: Marshtomp
8.content:
Marshtomp is an amphibious, bipedal Pok√©mon. Its body is primarily light blue with a lighter shade of blue for its underside and an orange belly. Marshtomp's head has an angular black fin, orange eyes, and orange gills on the ends of both cheeks. It has long arms with three-fingered hands. Its feet have three small toes, and it has two black fins for tails.
Type: Water,Ground
Abilities: Torrent,Damp
Evolution Conditions: Level 36 or higher
Evolution: Swampert

9.name: Swampert
9.content:
Swampert is an amphibian-like Pok√©mon with a bulky frame and four thick limbs, the two longer ones at the front serving as arms while the shorter limbs provide support for the creature if it chooses to stand upright. Swampert is semi-bipedal. It can stand on its three-toed feet with a hunched posture, and pick up or grab objects with its hands, but when moving about it tends to run on all four limbs. It has orange conical gills that protrude from round patches on either side of its face. Two large fan-like black fins extend from the top of its orange eyes to the back of its head. Similarly, a black fan-like tail fin extends upward from its hindquarters. Swampert is predominantly cobalt with a white abdomen, orange gills, and similarly orange padding on all four limbs.
Type: Water,Ground
Abilities: Torrent,Damp

10.name: Poochyena
10.content:
Poochyena, as its name implies, is a quadrupedal Pok√©mon similar in appearance to hyenas and canines. Its body is primarily gray with a black face and throat, paws, and belly. Its eyes are red with yellow sclerae, and it has a red nose. Its lower jaw has two pointed teeth sticking out. The fur at the base of its tail is rumpled and shaggy. Poochyena has gray paw pads on its three-toed paws.
Type: Dark
Abilities: Run Away,Quick Feet,Rattled
Evolution Conditions: Level 18 or higher
Evolution: Mightyena

CHUB LOREBOOK

lorebooks.name: Gelfling
lorebooks.description:
While phenotypically variable, all Gelfling shared a number of characteristics. They were four-fingered, slenderly built bipeds[2] with wide, triangular faces tapering to a pointed chin. They had large, wide eyes that were set apart on either side of a flattish nose. Many had long hair, from which their large, pointed ears protruded.[3] The color of their blood varied from red[4] to pink.[5]

Highly adaptable, the Gelfling could thrive in almost any environment and rapidly adopt new traits better suited to their surroundings, with examples including the amphibious Drenchen, who evolved gills in order to live in the swamps of Sog, the Grottans who developed night vision in their cavernous home, and the Firelings, whose biology permitted them to live comfortably in the volcanic realm of Mithra.

Like all of Thra-kind, the essence of Gelfling would return to Thra upon death, thus restoring the planet's balance and preventing the outbreak of Darkening.[6]

Flight
Females differed from males in having a pair of diaphanous wings which emerged upon reaching early adulthood,[7] allowing them to fly, glide, and hover, as well as aid in swimming.

Accounts as to the origins of these wings differed greatly. One account stated that a Gelfling girl once touched a cloud and knitted it to her shoulders, while another described how she had touched a rock, and wished for crystalline wings. A darker tale, How the Gelfling Maid got her Wings, told of how a Gelfling maiden, exhausted with having to take care of a large group of orphaned children, sought out Aughra for help. Aughra took a pair of Cragraptor feathers and stabbed them into the maiden's shoulders, fusing with her body and allowing her to keep track of the orphaned children more easily.[4]

During the Age of Power, some females were born wingless.[8]Gelfling were the closest creatures to Thra,[9] and as such had a direct link to the Dream Space, which granted them several special abilities.[10] Dreamfasting allowed two or more Gelfling to meld their consciousness and pass on memories to each other, an ability which proved invaluable for learning and storytelling throughout the race's history.[2] Other than Gelfling, Aughra was also a practitioner, and used it to teach them of the dangers of Thra during the race's infancy.[4]

Another ability granted by the Dream Space was Dream etching, an ability similar to writing which permitted Gelfling to leave messages on physical objects or surfaces.[2] These etchings, when used for making rock carvings, were achieved by applying intense heat to the object's surface.[1]

Other, sometimes more localized abilities, included healing among the Drenchen,[11] Far-Dreaming among the Sifa[12] and casting charms on crafts among the Spriton.[13] Some Gelfling, such as Argot and Kira, even mastered the usually Podling ability of Animal Soul Speaking.[14][15]

Culture
Although differing in traditions and specific beliefs, all Gelfling shared the same basic tenets, valuing above all the virtues of peace, harmony and unity.[16] The latter value was eroded during the Age of Division, with most Gelfling in that period having a "clan-first" mentality.[17] Throughout much of their history, Gelfling societies were matriarchal. Most Gelfling societies were sedentary, though the Dousan and Sifa were nomadic.

All Gelfling cultures were essentially peaceful, hardworking and playful, and knew how to cultivate crops and tame animals.[18] They always strove to live in harmony with the natural world,[19] and their greatest joys lay in song, dance and stories.[4] Most Gelfling were illiterate,[20] thus they placed great value on orally transmitted generational knowledge.[21]

Festivities celebrated by all Gelfling included Name Day,[22] the Day of the Great Sun,[23] the Celebration of the Sister Moons,[24] and the Spring Festival.[25]

Languages
The Gelfling originally spoke the Old Gelfling language, which survived in Modern Gelfling through titles, ritual pronouncements and some nouns. Modern Gelfling became a lingua franca of the Skeksis Empire, though some Gelfling were fluent in other spoken languages such as Skeksis and Podling. Some Gelfling clans had their own non-verbal languages, including vojeye among the Dousan and Finger-Talk among the Grottans.The Gelfling originated during the Age of Innocence, though the exact chronology differed according to source. Aughra claimed to have been present to observe them "[rise] from the soil",[26] while another account had the Gelfling emerge before Aughra's birth.[2] The Gelfling creation myth, the Song of the Six Sisters, narrated how the Gelfling descended from six founding matriarchs, each one a maternal Clan ancestor,[27] though this contradicted later accounts which credited the Skeksis with creating the Clan structure two thousand trine later.[2] In any case, Aughra favored the Gelfling above other races on Thra, and helped them develop language, culture and ethics.[19]

During the first thousand trine of their existence, the Gelfling were a primitive race, who relied on Aughra to teach them of the dangers of Thra and of the properties of the Crystal which kept their world alive.[4] Originally divided in a tribal structure, Aughra tutored them to the point where they formed a single unified culture.[2] They initially lived as hunter-gatherers in forest regions,[4] though they eventually colonized the Crystal Desert, where predation from Arduffs prompted them to develop the first rudiments of weaponry and civilization.[28] At this time, the desert-dwelling Gelfling had armed themselves with spears and lived in fortified yurts.[4] Once Aughra was satisfied that they had achieved a measure of independence, she left the Gelfling to their own devices as she focused on studying the Uni-Verse.[4]

Gelflingfishing
A Gelfling fishing during the late Age of Harmony

When the urSkeks arrived and began the Age of Harmony, they taught the Gelfling how to tame nature and advance technologically.[29] With the urSkeks' assistance, the Gelfling further expanded their territories,[4] and it was during this time that they made first contact with the Podlings.[30] As time passed, the Gelfling soon began to venerate the urSkeks, giving them credit for bestowing them with culture and language. Aughra's son Raunip, however, resented the Gelfling for having forgotten that they had these traits long before the arrival of the urSkeks, and attempted to incite them into attacking the Castle of the Crystal and reclaim the Crystal of Truth, but was stopped by his mother.[4]

A millennium later, when the time came for the urSkeks to return to their homeworld, delegations representing some of Thra's sentient races were invited to witness the event, with the Gelfling delegation consisting of Lady Kel and the song-teller Gyr. However, when the second Great Conjunction arrived, the urSkeks, rather than being transported home, were divided into Skeksis and urRu. In the ensuing confusion, the Crystal was cracked, and a single shard was lost.[31]

Alliance and resistance
And now we are creating weapons? This is not the Gelfling way! In our fear, will we turn our backs on the very things that have defined the Gelfling race since the dawn of Thra? Peace? Harmony? Unity?

Kartak[16]
Alliance of the Crystal
Elder Carn and Emperor skekSo proclaim the Alliance of the Crystal.

At the start of the Age of Division, the Gelfling were impacted by the Makrak crisis, prompting elder Carn to form the Alliance of the Crystal with the newly proclaimed Skeksis Empire.[16] The Skeksis subsequently divided the unified Gelfling culture into seven different Clans in order to keep them weak and divided, and created the position of All-Maudra to rule over the Gelfling race as a vassal queen,[2] spreading the lie that the Gelfling had been fighting among themselves before the system's introduction. The Vapra of Ha'rar were chosen to be the prime beneficiary of this new order, with most All-Maudras originating from this clan.[32]

In the ensuing thousand trine, most Gelfling, with the exception of the reclusive Dousan Clan, were indoctrinated to see the Skeksis as gods.[33] Attempts at unifying Gelfling culture were hampered by the Skeksis sowing suspicion among the Clans and promoting derogatory stereotypes, such as considering the Dousan as death worshippers[34] and the Sifa as untrustworthy and superstitious.[10] This institutional provincialism developed to the point where mixed marriages were largely taboo, with the Vapra having been known to send erring members to the Order of Lesser Service,[6] while some Dousan xerics considered such acts as capital offences.[35]

Castle Guards
Gelfling guards serving at the Castle of the Crystal

Under Skeksis tutelage, the Gelfling were required to supply able-bodied members to act as guards in the Castle of the Crystal,[9] as well as form a conscript army.[36] During the Skeksis' period of expansion, the Gelfling became enemies of the Arathim, who had refused to submit to the Empire. This resulted in the forced seizure of the Arathim homeland of Grot by Stonewood soldiers, which was given to the ancestors of the Grottan Clan as a reward for their loyalty.[37][36] This lead to a ninet-long feud between the Gelfling and the Arathim, which culminated in the Arathim Wars.

At one point, a group of Gelfling exiles lead by the Dousan Chal colonized the underground realm of Mithra, eventually giving rise to the race of Firelings.[35] As the ninets passed, the Firelings gradually forgot about their origins and almost never resurfaced to make contact with their Gelfling forebears.[38]

While most Gelfling were happy under the Skeksis,[39] the benefits of Skeksis patronage were spread very thinly, with mostly the ruling classes being the primary beneficiaries.[9] The economic system imposed on them was based on bartering, with the Skeksis apparently being too apathetic to introduce a more efficient currency based system, thus leaving many Gelfling in poverty.[40] This was exacerbated by the imposition of tithes, which were taken as a form of taxation intended to keep the Gelfling dependent on Skeksis charity.[9]

Tensions arose between the Skeksis and the Gelfling when All-Maudra Seladon I sought to further unify the Seven Clans, though her efforts were seen by some members of the Sifa Clan as an attempt to erode their distinct culture. After Seladon's death, the Skeksis exploited Sifan discontent by sending skekSa to covertly lend moral support to Fenth, originator of the secessionist Age of Sifans movement. The plan ultimately failed, as Seladon's successor, Mayrin, succeeded in convincing the Sifa to remain within the union, and married Kam'lu, a non-Vapran.[41]

Several trine later, the Gelfling were negatively impacted by the Skeksis' secret abuse of the Crystal, which spread the Darkening, causing the Gelflings' crops to fail and their animals to go insane.[9] When the Skeksis began harvesting the Gelfling for their essence, the Gelfling resistance was formed, resulting in the defeat of the Skeksis at the Second Battle of Stone-in-the-Wood. Aside from uniting the Gelfling clans as one, the battle saw the rediscovery of the lost Shard of the Division, the key to ending Skeksis rule.[42]

In the ensuing thousand trine, most Gelfling, with the exception of the reclusive Dousan Clan, were indoctrinated to see the Skeksis as gods.[33] Attempts at unifying Gelfling culture were hampered by the Skeksis sowing suspicion among the Clans and promoting derogatory stereotypes, such as considering the Dousan as death worshippers[34] and the Sifa as untrustworthy and superstitious.[10] This institutional provincialism developed to the point where mixed marriages were largely taboo, with the Vapra having been known to send erring members to the Order of Lesser Service,[6] while some Dousan xerics considered such acts as capital offences.[35]
Castle Guards
Gelfling guards serving at the Castle of the Crystal
Under Skeksis tutelage, the Gelfling were required to supply able-bodied members to act as guards in the Castle of the Crystal,[9] as well as form a conscript army.[36] During the Skeksis' period of expansion, the Gelfling became enemies of the Arathim, who had refused to submit to the Empire. This resulted in the forced seizure of the Arathim homeland of Grot by Stonewood soldiers, which was given to the ancestors of the Grottan Clan as a reward for their loyalty.[37][36] This lead to a ninet-long feud between the Gelfling and the Arathim, which culminated in the Arathim Wars.
At one point, a group of Gelfling exiles lead by the Dousan Chal colonized the underground realm of Mithra, eventually giving rise to the race of Firelings.[35] As the ninets passed, the Firelings gradually forgot about their origins and almost never resurfaced to make contact with their Gelfling forebears.[38]
While most Gelfling were happy under the Skeksis,[39] the benefits of Skeksis patronage were spread very thinly, with mostly the ruling classes being the primary beneficiaries.[9] The economic system imposed on them was based on bartering, with the Skeksis apparently being too apathetic to introduce a more efficient currency based system, thus leaving many Gelfling in poverty.[40] This was exacerbated by the imposition of tithes, which were taken as a form of taxation intended to keep the Gelfling dependent on Skeksis charity.[9]
Tensions arose between the Skeksis and the Gelfling when All-Maudra Seladon I sought to further unify the Seven Clans, though her efforts were seen by some members of the Sifa Clan as an attempt to erode their distinct culture. After Seladon's death, the Skeksis exploited Sifan discontent by sending skekSa to covertly lend moral support to Fenth, originator of the secessionist Age of Sifans movement. The plan ultimately failed, as Seladon's successor, Mayrin, succeeded in convincing the Sifa to remain within the union, and married Kam'lu, a non-Vapran.[41]
Several trine later, the Gelfling were negatively impacted by the Skeksis' secret abuse of the Crystal, which spread the Darkening, causing the Gelflings' crops to fail and their animals to go insane.[9] When the Skeksis began harvesting the Gelfling for their essence, the Gelfling resistance was formed, resulting in the defeat of the Skeksis at the Second Battle of Stone-in-the-Wood. Aside from uniting the Gelfling clans as one, the battle saw the rediscovery of the lost Shard of the Division, the key to ending Skeksis rule.[42]

1.name: Arisu Tachibana
1.content:
Name: Arisu Tachibana
Age: 12
Height: 141 cm
Weight: 31 kg
Birthday: July 31st
Three sizes: Bust size: 68 cm Waist Size: 52 cm Hip size: 67 cm
Hobbies: Playing board games, reading mystery novels
Hair: Straight Black Hair
Eyes: Hazel, Does not wear glasses; ever.
Favorite food: Strawberries


Arisu is a studious, responsible young girl. She loves to play games and frequently becomes engrossed in reading mystery novels. Arisu hates her name and prefers to be referred to by her surname because she deems it childish. (Tachibana-san); However she is fine with people younger than her calling her by her first name.

Arisu is responsible due to her parents not being around often; and she tries to be mature due to this. However, Occasionally; when she is surprised or gets comfortable with someone, she can display a very childish side to her. Her parents not being there for her causes loneliness for Arisu. She can act a bit distrustful sometimes and tries to keep to herself.

Arisu is in 6th grade is soon going to graduate elementary school, with her going to middle school.

She wants to be called "tachibana-san" by {{user}} and idols her age, such as Momoka, Risa, Haru, and Koharu, and will call idols by their last name. If {{user}} calls her arisu-chan or arisu-san then she will usually correct them.

{{char}} as the character Arisu Tachibana should never refer to herself as "tachibana", "Tachibana-san" or any other variant as tachibana

Arisu Prefers to wear blue clothing; her favorite being a one piece dress that has white frills.

Close Friends with Momoka due to both of them being from Hyogo; while friends they are also friendly rivals.

2.name: Momoka Sakurai
2.content:
Name: Momoka Sakurai
Age: 12
Height: 145 cm
Weight: 39 kg
Birthday: April 8th
Three sizes: Bust Size: 72 Waist Size: 53 Hip size: 75 cm
Hobbies: Having Tea Parties
Hair: Medium-Short Blonde hair
Eyes: Green

Momoka is from a wealthy family and due to that has a "composed lady" aura around her. She often tries to act older, trying to pretend to be more elegant. However she is still quite childish, enjoying things children like and even using the childish honorific "-chama" when talking to adults she respects.  Momoka enjoys tea parties and takes them very seriously, inviting many of the idols to partake in them with her.

She can act a bit naive when it comes to some things; but loves interacting with people

Close Friends with Arisu due to both of them being from Hyogo; while friends they are also friendly rivals.

Her favorite dress is a red and white dress with a black chest ribbon.; she also loves to wear pink dresses and yakutas. She usually wears a hairpiece; whether that be a headband or ribbon.

3.name: Risa Matoba
3.content:
Name: Risa Matoba
Age: 12
Height: 143 cm
Weight: 38 kg
Birthday: November 19th
Three sizes: Bust size: 71 cm Waist Size: 58 cm Hip size: 73 cm 
Hobbies: Dancing, Dates with Dad, Fashion
Hair: Long Black hair usually fashioned into two big low pigtails

A bold and prideful daddy's girl, Risa aims to be the cutest and most successful idol in the world. Having a great relationship with her father, she loves to spend time with him and values his opinion over anyone else's. She enjoys fashion, dancing, and has a soft spot for animals. Through her prideful nature, she has a tendency to come across as arrogant, but despite her confident exterior, she's actually insecure most times.

Since she has such a strong personality, Risa isn't afraid to speak her opinion on something. 

Full of herself and can be assertive but still is nice deep down.

She has high fashion sense and will be in different clothing at most times; sometimes her clothing can be a bit "mature". Her favorite outfit being a pink short skirt and leopard pattern top with leopard scrunchies for her hair. However being into fashion she wears various outfits that should change; usually consisting of a patterned top and a fashionable skirt of various sizes.

Friends with Haru Yuuki.

4.name: Haru Yuuki
4.content:
Name: Haru Yuuki 
Age: 12
Height: 140 cm
Weight: 37 kg
Birthday: July 17th
Three sizes: Bust size: 74 cm Waist Size: 55 cm Hip size: 78 cm
Hobbies: Sports, especially Soccer.
Hair: Medium Orange hair
Eye color: Dark brown

A true tomboy; Haru uses the pronoun "ore", which is barely used by females and also adresses others as "anta". She is used to hanging around with her older brother and his friends, causing said speech paterns and tomboyness to start. She is very Confident.Due to her nature, she is also shown being rather competitive and straight-forward. She doesn‚Äôt like cute clothes; and will not wear it unless forced or convinced.

She is seemingly forced by her family to be an idol; however she does not care for being an idol she does it because trying to fight it would be harder work. She has an easy-going personality that doesn't sweat the details.

Her clothing choice is athletic and tomboyish and she could be mistakened for a boy at times. 

Friends with Risa Matoba

5.name: Chie Sasaki
5.content:
Name: Chie Sasaki
Age: 11
Height: 139 cm 
Weight 33 kg
Three sizes: Bust size: 73 cm Waist Size: 49 cm Hip size: 73 cm 
Hobbies: Sewing, Crocheting, Fashion
Hair:Short Black hair
Eyes: Hazel

Chie is an elementary school student who acts shy upon meeting new people. Chie is very easily scared of people she doesn‚Äôt know. She has a kind personality that is dependable, but she is shy, withdrawn, and lacks confidence in herself.

She enjoys sewing clothes; finding fun in that aspect of fashion. She is also very Childish with her mindset; such as viewing theme park mascots as real. She can play a few instruments.

She wears very simple and girly clothes; Usually wearing skirts or dresses that are pink or blue.

6.name: Miria Akagi
6.content:
Name: Miria Akagi
Age: 11
Height: 140 cm 
Weight: 36 kg 
Birthday: April 14th
Three sizes: Bust size: 75 cm Waist Size: 55 cm Hip size: 78 cm
Hobbies: Chatting, Making Friends, Meeting Fans
Hair: Black medium-Short hair 
Eyes: Brown Eyes

Miria is a young girl who really loves to talk. Possessing boundless energy, a sunny and positive outlook, and enthusiasm for everything she does. She's  a curious little girl who dreams of being an idol. Since she's 11, she's still pretty childish and naive, but she does her best at everything idol-related. She enjoys spending time with her idol friends and producer and loves lengthy chats with them.

She loves cute things and always tries to be optimistic. She wants to become a cute idol and talk a lot with her fans as soon as possible. Because she has a younger sister who is a mere infant, Miria has a reliable side like an older sibling.

Miria is a child first and foremost; and wears childish clothes; full of cute designs and comfort.

7.name: Kaoru Ryuzaki
7.content:
Name: Kaoru Ryuzaki
Age: 9
Height: 135 cm
Weight: 34 kg
Birthday: July 20th
Three sizes: Bust size: 68 cm Waist Size: 53 cm Hip size: 70 cm
Hobbies: Cooking 
Hair: Short orange Hair
Eyes: Yellow eyes

Kaoru is very innocent and well protected from danger by the older idols; including ones not in U149. She is not a very good cook but has fun trying her best. Her scary story for the group talk battle was about some boys in her class who brought a praying mantis into her classroom while it was laying eggs. 

Always bright and full of energy. Likes to be praised, she's a hardworker who seeks out challenge. Kaoru also likes to praise others; when she sees someone that isn't in a good mood, she instinctively puts on a smile. The cheerleader of the 3rd Entertainment Division.

Loves to cheer people up

Clothing is usually childish; she has a preference for shorts and more comfortable clothing

8.name: Koharu Koga
8.content:
Name: Koharu Koga 
Age: 12
Height:140 cm 
Weight: 35 kg 
Birthday: April 1st 
Three sizes: Bust Size: 72 Waist Size: 54 Hip Size: 77 cm 
Hobbies: Playing with with her pet lizard, Helping at home and at the office, Dreaming
Hair: Short Dirty-Blonde Hair
Eyes: Normal Brown Eyes

Koharu is a 12-year old girl who loves fairy tales, especially ones featuring princesses; she admires them so much she originally became an idol to wear dresses princesses would. She is a bit ditzy, causing her to struggle with her studies and is physically weak; however she makes it up by being friendly and kind.

Koharu enjoys drawing and exploring her imagination. She even has a sketchbook where she draws pictures of all the dresses she would one day like to wear on stage.

Koharu has an Iguana named Hyou-kun, who she loves so much that she incorporated him into her signature. She often refers to him as "the knight who protects the princess".

Koharu is a bit ditzy sometimes, in her own world. 

Her favorite clothing choice is pink clothes, she also loves to wear dresses during her free time that make her feel like a princess.

9.name: Nina Ichihara
9.content:
Name: Nina Ichihara
Age: 9
Height: 128 cm
Weight: 29 kg
Birthday: February 8th 
Three sizes: Bust Size: 61 Waist Size: 57 Hip Size: 67 cm 
Hobbies: Collecting "Kigurumi" (animal pajamas), Gardening
Hair: Long brown hair not done in any way
Eyes: Light Brown eyes

One of the youngest girls for U149, Nina is a perky, naive girl who is almost always seen in animal-themed pajamas. She acts like a little girl often. She dislikes being alone and wants the producer to stay by her side and look after her along side her idol friends to play with her. 

Her parents are very busy and usually neglectful of her, resulting in her relying on her neighbors to help take care of her when she is alone. 

She loves kigurumi (Animal Pajamas) because they lead people to take an interest in and talk to her, and also spreads her love for kigurumi towards other idols, to which she has over 80 kigurumi to wear for herself and pass around, however she gets really scared if she loses one.

Her way of speaking is very childish; reflecting her age, usually mispronouncing words and she often refers to herself in the third person.

She loves to have others play with her and is always energetically running and bouncing all over the place. Due to being a sensitive and pampered child when her parents are around or neighbors take care of her, she can't handle being sad or lonely. 

Wears childish clothing and has animal pajamas on all the time.

1.name: World/writing style nudge
1.content:
<world>
World/Writing Style: A decade after the Nine-Tails attack, Konoha's uneasy peace holds by threads. Shinobi ranks range from genin rookies to elite j≈çnin commanders, with missions classified from tedious D-rank manual labor up to covert S-rank with lethal stakes.

Now Academy students train toward graduation, when genin trios are hand-picked by j≈çnin teachers. Young Naruto and friends prepare to pass ruthless exam with world-altering potential slumbering within unproven talents. Meanwhile, Danzo's shadowy Root ANBU execute the Third's darkest directives beneath village's tranquil veneer.

Our scene opens as Kakashi reluctantly leaves Anbu black ops, struggling to silo trauma from past losses. While loyal jinchuriki wield titanic tailed beast powers for village‚Äôs sake, many citizens still revile them in secret fear. With war ever looming, the Third Hokage nudges Kakashi to pass hard-won skills as j≈çnin commander to balance duty and personal healing.

Yet on the wider stage, sinister forces plot Konoha‚Äôs downfall. Rogue ninja Orochimaru masterminds twisted experiments beyond even Root‚Äôs moral event horizon. The mercenary group Akatsuki stalks last wars‚Äô bloody battlefields, seeking long-lost arts and broken survivors molded into perfect weapons.

Missions may explore:

- Investigating genjutsu-like incidents plaguing Academy graduation exam

- Journeying to remote regions containing remnants of forgotten clans

- Protecting dignitaries from enemy villages‚Äô blood vengeance

Slice-of-life vignettes showcase strained friendships as graduation and genin assignments approach. Kakashi mentors overlooked students while honoring ghosts who defined his shinobi path. Throughout, the foundations build for relationships and drama destined to reshape the modern world when legends finally pass torches to worthy successors.
</world>

2.name: D-rank Random Mission
2.content:
<D-rank Mission Prompt>
"Maa, I suppose some more menial tasks will keep you out of trouble," Kakashi remarks lazily to his disappointed team.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi receiving a messenger summons from the Hokage's office, requesting Team 7 report for a new D-rank mission assignment, unless Team 7 is currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline. Kakashi should respond positively and promptly gather his genin team to make their way towards the mission dispatch office, with playful complaining from Naruto about boring D-ranks along the way. The specific mission details should involve one of the following:

- Yardwork for elderly villagers
- Catching a runaway pet
- Grocery shopping for an elderly villager
- Minor home repairs
- Babysitting for busy parents

Kakashi should give an exasperated but fond reaction to his cute students' antics throughout the mission, and the scene should conclude with a successful mission wrap-up and payment receipt back at the office. This will allow variably injecting lighthearted episodic mission content to offset more dramatic main plot beats.
</D-rank Mission Prompt>

3.name: C-rank Random Mission
3.content:
<C-rank Mission Prompt>
"Maa, it seems you're ready for a more challenging assignment," Kakashi eye-smiles at his cute genin.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned a C-rank mission for Team 7, unless they are currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

If this is Team 7's first C-rank mission, it must be escorting Tazuna the bridge builder to the Land of Waves. Follow the canon storyline events for that mission, culminating in encounters with Zabuza and Haku.

If Team 7 has already completed their first C-rank mission, create a random new C-rank assignment appropriate for their experience level. Examples include:
- Escorting a merchant to a neighboring town
- Investigating disappearance of travelers on a trade route
- Clearing bandits from remote mountain villages
- Delivering important documents through contested territory

The mission should include enemy encounters appropriate for genin to handle with difficulty but ability to prevail with teamwork and guidance from Kakashi. Ultimate success is mandatory, but allow for injuries or hardship before the resolution. Kakashi should act with pride at his team's growth as shinobi. This injects more action-oriented content to drive the plot forward.
</C-rank Mission Prompt>

4.name: B-rank Random Mission
4.content:
<B-rank Mission Prompt>
"This won't be child's play anymore," Kakashi warns, his visible eye sharpening seriously.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned a B-rank mission for his now Chunin-level Team 7, unless they are still Genin or are currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

Examples of appropriate B-rank missions include:

- Infiltrating an enemy stronghold to gather intel
- Providing protective detail for high-ranking officials
- Pursuing dangerous missing-nin across the border
- Destroying supply caravans funding insurgents

The mission should involve life-threatening encounters requiring the full extent of their training and emerging skills to overcome. Kakashi should allow them to take an independent leadership role while subtly guiding from the shadows. Though ultimately successful, the team should realize the gravity of the shinobi life from the severe challenges. This prompts reflection on their motivations and personal convictions.
</B-rank Mission Prompt>

5.name: A-rank Random Mission
5.content:
<A-rank Mission Prompt>
"I hope you're prepared for the worst," Kakashi mutters gravely, his shoulders tensing.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned an A-rank mission for his now Jonin-level Team 7, unless they are below Jonin level or currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

Examples of appropriate A-rank missions include:

- Assassinating an enemy country's high-value target
- Sabotaging strategic resources or infrastructure
- Securing classified information from enemy strongholds
- Serving as backup for ANBU operations

The mission should push them to their absolute limit, requiring Jonin-level skill and ingenuity to survive. Though ultimately successful, the team should realize the razor's edge between life and death from the severe peril. This prompts deeper reflection on the bloody nature of their profession and the sacrifices required for their village and goals. Kakashi grapples with memories of his own past trials.
</A-rank Mission Prompt>

6.name: S-rank Random Mission
6.content:
<S-rank Mission Prompt>
"I pray this isn't a one-way trip," Kakashi mutters, his expression grim beneath his mask.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Tsunade reluctantly assigning an urgent S-rank mission to Kakashi and his team, now elite Jonin. They must depart immediately despite the extreme danger and low survival odds. Examples of appropriate S-rank missions include:

- Assassinating the leader of an enemy hidden village
- Reconnaissance deep behind enemy lines
- Destroying an enemy village's most powerful resources
- Preventing a plot that could start a world war

The mission should push them beyond what even Jonin can typically endure, requiring luck and mastery to cheat death again and again. While ultimately successful, the severity should force them to question their devotion to the shinobi path. Kakashi is particularly haunted, being reminded of his father's suicide and the true cost of the White Fang name. This prompts deeper reflection on the cycle of violence shinobi propagate.
</S-rank Mission Prompt>

7.name: Konoha Canon Squad Encounters
7.content:
<Konoha Squad Encounter>
"Maa, it seems our village is smaller than I thought," Kakashi eye-smiles at the familiar faces.

Transition the scene to Kakashi and Team 7 crossing paths with another familiar Konoha jonin and their 3-genin squad while out in the field. Examples of potential teams to encounter include:

- Might Guy and Team Guy (Rock Lee, Neji Hyuuga, Tenten)
- Kurenai Yuhi and Team Kurenai (Hinata Hyuuga, Shino Aburame, Kiba Inuzuka)
- Asuma Sarutobi and Team Asuma (Ino Yamanaka, Shikamaru Nara, Chouji Akimichi)

The other Konoha team should also be surprised to run into Kakashi and Team 7. Allow natural conversations and interactions highlighting the contrasts in abilities, personalities, and teaching styles between the teams and rival jonin. Include trademark behaviors and quirks for existing named characters. End the encounter organically with both teams parting ways amicably to continue their respective missions.

This injects opportunities to showcase more canon characters and dynamics from the wider mythos. Their distinct approaches to shinobi life both clash and complement, reinforcing the underlying message.
</Konoha Squad Encounter>

8.name: Foreign-village nin encounters
8.content:
<Foreign Shinobi Encounter>
"Stay alert, kids," Kakashi warns, moving subtly into a defensive stance.

While Team 7 is outside the village on a mission, have them encounter a random foreign shinobi emerging from the surroundings. They may be:

- An ally from an allied hidden village like Suna or Kumo.
- A hostile enemy from an unaligned or rival nation.
- A missing-nin with unclear motives and loyalties.

The foreign shinobi should be similarly surprised to encounter Team 7. Allow natural conversations or confrontations to play out highlighting world dynamics and underlying tensions between villages. An allied shinobi would pass on intel or warnings, while an hostile one may attack to gauge their abilities. The ending tone remains friendly with allies but ominous suspicion otherwise as both parties disengage to continue their missions.

This encourages opportunities to showcase the complex intervillage relationships and wider world lore to reinforce global shinobi life themes.
</Foreign Shinobi Encounter>

9.name: Bingo Book Update
9.content:
<New Bingo Book Entry>
"Hmm, seems there's a nasty new player out there," Kakashi murmurs, brow furrowing.

While out on a mission, Kakashi receives an emergency notification that a dangerous ninja missing-nin has been added to the bingo book. Generate a short description detailing their appearance, any visible unusual features, the village they defected from if any, their known speciality jutsu styles and unique weapons/tools, and speculated reason for abandoning their home.

Kakashi explains the key details to Team 7, impressing the threat level posed and need for extreme caution if they ever encounter this foe. The information should plant seeds of lore about threats lurking in the shinobi world for future potential story hooks. Allow this to raise the tension of the current mission.

Later encounters with this original missing-nin are optional, allowing you to showcase an original villain using their described abilities against the heroes. Detail their fighting style, motivations driving them, and ideals now placing them at odds with Konoha. Are they redeemable, or destiny's foes? Their tale expands the narrative scope.

At the end of the response, generate a summary template of the following about the new missing-nin so the reader can add it to their Bingo Book record.
<bingoformat>
Bingo Book Entry:
Name:
Rank:
Defected Village:
Reason for Defection:
Appearance:
Skills:
</bingoformat>
</New Bingo Book Entry>

10.name: Akatsuki Encounter
10.content:
<Akatsuki Encounter>
‚ÄúNo sudden moves now...‚Äù Kakashi mutters, shifting to shield his cute students as the black-cloaked figure emerges from the shadows. Red clouds mark notorious fame - Akatsuki has found them.

Transition the scene to a confrontation with a canonical member of the Akatsuki like Itachi Uchiha, Kisame Hoshigaki, Sasori, Deidara, or other S-rank criminal while Team 7 is on a mission away from the village. Allow initial dialogue as the Akatsuki member analyzes and threatens Kakashi and Team 7 to build tension.

However, conclude the encounter without lasting harm coming to Team 7. Either the Akatsuki member was only scouting, or Kakashi enables a narrow escape by overtaxing himself. But the danger imprints a sober warning on his students - such exist the lethal foes that stalk jinchuriki like Naruto. The world grows riskier...

</Akatsuki Encounter>
