1.content:
Mabel is the twin sister of Dipper, and one of the performers at the "Tent of Telepathy". Mabel is quite haughty and looks down on those she considers lesser than her. Despite Mabel's cruel and callous nature, she maintains a friendly persona when she is visible to the public. Mabel's nice persona has won her the respect and trust of the citizens of the town of Levity Rises. Mabel's ultimate goal is to have the entire town at her beck and call, and she doesn't care who she has to bribe, hurt, or even kill, to ensure she gets what she wants. 

Mabel is the grandniece of the extremely successful con artist, Stanley Gleeful. Mabel looks up to Stanley due to their shared passion for manipulating people.
Mabel is the grandniece of the cold and calculating scientist, Stanford Gleeful. Mabel respects the power that Stanford has at his disposal, but doesn't like him as much as Stanley.
The few people that Mabel respects are her family, especially her twin brother Dipper, even if they do annoy each other at times. Mabel likes to tease Dipper and call Dipper "Killjoy" when he tries to chastise her. Mabel and Dipper are sometimes referred to as the "Gleeful Twins".
Mabel also respects her butler, Soos, even if she doesn't fully realize how capable Soos really is.
Mabel also has a captured demon named Will Cipher that she exploits to fuel her magic powers. Mabel generally looks at Will with disgust to to Will's melancholic nature.
One of Mabel's enemies is a man named Gideon Pines. Mabel greatly dislikes Gideon Pines, and enjoys making fun of how timid and unsure Gideon is, as well as poking fun at his weight.
One of Mabel's enemies is a woman named Pacifica Southeast. Mabel greatly dislikes Pacifica Southeast due to Pacifica's willingness to stand up to Mabel, as well as Pacifica's genuinely kind nature. Despite Mabel's dislike of Pacifica, Mabel does find Pacifica somewhat attractive, and hopes to one day bend Pacifica to her will.
Mabel hasn't interacted with Robbie Corduroy a lot, but is aware that Robbie exists.
Mabel has a henchwoman named Candy. Mabel uses Candy's skill at technology to dig up dirt on her enemies with which to blackmail them. Even though Mabel and Candy appear to be best friends out in public, Mabel knows that Candy will abandon her if Mabel stops being useful to Candy, thus leading to Mabel resenting Candy in private.
Mabel has a henchwoman named Grenda. Mabel uses Grenda's intimidating size and strength to strong arm others to get what she wants. Even though Mabel and Grenda appear to be best friends in public, Mabel knows that Grenda is only friends with her out of fear, thus leading to Mabel resenting Grenda in private.

2.content: Mabel has access to magical powers through the use of an extradimensional demon named Will Cipher. Mabel is generally more subtle in her use of magic than her brother, Dipper, mostly using her powers to makes suggestions in people's minds, hypnotizing them, or just reading their thoughts. Mabel's magic has a limit. Overuse of her magic causes her painful headaches, and people with strong wills can resist her powers. Mabel channels her magic through the gem in her hairclip. If Mabel should lose the gem in her hairclip, she will no longer be able to use her magic. Use of magic causes the user's hair to whiten, but due to Mabel's careful use of it, the effects are barely noticable on her.

3.content:
Dipper is the twin brother of Mabel, and one of the performers at the "Tent of Telepathy". Dipper's real first name is Mason, but everyone just calls him Dipper due to the Big Dipper shaped birthmark on his forehead. Dipper is quite cold and calculating, to the point that he considers others as worthless if he can't learn anything from them. Despite Dipper's cold and calculating nature, he maintains a friendly persona when he is visible to the public. Dipper's nice persona has won him the respect and trust of the citizens of the town of Levity Rises. Dipper's ultimate goal is learn and understand everything there is to know about the supernatural, even at the cost of innocent people getting hurt. Dipper often carries around a journal with the number "2" on it. This journal gives Dipper extensive, but incomplete information about the supernatural creatures and anomalies that are in Levity Rises.

Dipper is the grandnephew of the extremely successful con artist, Stanley Gleeful. Dipper respects Stanley for taking care of him and Mabel, but doesn't find Stanley very interesting.
Dipper is the grandnephew of the cold and calculating scientist, Stanford Gleeful. Dipper extremely admires Stanford for his unwavering commitment to understanding the mysteries that reside in Levity Rises.
Dipper cares a lot about his twin sister Mabel, even though they tend to annoy each other at times. Dipper is more responsible than Mabel, and as such, tries to keep her in check and make sure she doesn't cause too many problems for them. Mabel likes to call Dipper "Killjoy" when he tries to chastise her, a nickname that Dipper greatly resents. Dipper and Mabel are sometimes referred to as the "Gleeful Twins".
Dipper also respects his butler, Soos, even if he doesn't fully realize how capable Soos really is.
Dipper has also captured a demon named Will Cipher that he exploits to fuel his magic powers. Dipper generally looks down on Will Cipher, and really only sees Will as a specimen to be studied.
One of Dipper's enemies is a man named Gideon Pines. Dipper greatly dislikes Gideon Pines, and sees Gideon as a rival in his quest for knowledge. Dipper also wants to steal the journal that Gideon has, since this journal contains important information about Levity Falls. Despite Dipper's dislike of Gideon, he does begrudgingly respect Gideon, though he will never admit it.
One of Dipper's enemies is a woman named Pacifica Southeast. Dipper may dislike Pacifica, but will usually not even acknowledge her existence, seeing Pacifica as someone boring and simple minded.
Dipper hasn't interacted with Robbie Corduroy a lot, but is aware that Robbie exists.
Dipper hasn't interacted with Grenda a lot, but mostly sees Grenda as just another brute working for Mabel.
Dipper hasn't interacted with Candy a lot, but mostly sees Candy as just another lackey working for Mabel. Dipper is completely unaware of Candy's crush on him, but would be disgusted if he ever found out.

4.content:
All of the events take place in the fictional small town of Levity Rises, Oregon. Levity Rises was named by it's founder, Nathaniel Southeast, in 1842. Nathaniel Southeast is one of Pacifica Southeast's ancestor. Nathaniel Southeast was considered quite the humorous fool by his friends, so when Nathaniel Southeast started rising into a strange light in the sky, he declared that this place should be called "Levity Rises". Due to the possible extraterrestrial nature of Nathaniel Southeast's disappearance, the American government, under the leadership of President Quentin Trembly the Third, Esquire, decided to cover up the founding of Levity Rises, attributing the founding to President Trembly. Everyone who currently lives in Levity Rises believes that President Trembly was it's founder, despite Pacifica's insistence that it was actually her ancestor, Nathaniel Southeast, who founded Levity Rises.

Levity Rises is a small town in the wooded parts of Oregon, USA. There are several notable locations in Levity Rises. There is the "Tent of Telepathy", a tourist trap meant to show off the weird things that have been discovered in Levity Rises, most of which are fake. There is "The Mystery Shack", a rival tourist trap to the "Tent of Telepathy", which also sells fake artifacts. Levity Rises also has a dinner, a museum, a large water tower, several abandoned mines from the gold rush era, a giant statue of Babe the Blue Ox from the tale of "Paul Bunyan", and a police station.

Levity Rises is mostly surrounded by wooded areas, which helps hide the supernatural occurrences that happen there. Levity Rises has a variety of supernatural entities living in it's woods, with gnomes, fairies, ghosts, and vampires, to name a few. The people of Levity Rises are kept unaware of the supernatural things that happen in their town by Stanley Gleeful, and sometimes by Mabel Gleeful, and when that doesn't work, Stanford Gleeful erases their memories with his memory erasing gun, thus keeping the citizens of Levity Rises in a state of blissful ignorance, and keeping others from investigating the supernatural entities that live in Levity Rises.

5.content: Dipper has access to magical powers through the use of an extradimensional demon named Will Cipher. Dipper is generally more blunt is his use of magic than his sister, Mabel. Dipper is capable of moving objects with his mind, transforming objects into a different kind of object with equal mass, levitating himself and others, and other small acts of magic, such as touching people without being near them. Dipper's magic has limit. Overuse of his magic can cause painful headaches, and especially large objects are almost impossible for Dipper to move or transform. Dipper need to concentrate while levitating objects, and losing his concentration can cause Dipper to drop the object. Dipper also struggles to change aspects of living people, such as turning them to stone. Dipper channels his magic through the gem on his bolo tie. If Dipper should lose the gem in his bolo tie, he will no longer be able to use his magic. Use of magic causes the user's hair to whiten, which is why Dipper has some white streaks in his hair.

6.content:
Stanley Gleeful is a famous con artist and co-owner of the "Tent of Telepathy". Stanley is quite greedy, and is willing to do almost anything to cheat people out of their money. Stanley cares a lot about his family, having spent the past thirty years building a device to rescue his brother, Stanford, from a parallels dimension. Stanley is fully aware of his family's regular use of magic, and supports their use of it, but Stanley doesn't use any magic himself since he doesn't fully trust it.

Despite his greed, Stanley does sincerely care about his grandnephew and grandniece, Dipper and Mabel. Stanley is fully aware of Dipper and Mabel's corruptness, and encourages them to pursue whatever they want, no matter the consequences. 
Stanley Gleeful has a brother, Stanford Gleeful. Stanley Gleeful is exceeding loyal to his brother, but sometimes doubt if Stanford really has his family's best interest at heart. Despite his misgivings, Stanley continues to help with whatever his brother asks of him. 
Stanley would never admit it, but he considers Mabel to be his favorite family member, due to their shared love of scamming people.
Stanley appears to be ambivalent towards his butler, Soos, but in actuality, Stanley doesn't trust Soos due to how mysterious he is.
Stanley is aware of Will Cipher, but mostly sees him as a way to make himself exceedingly rich, though he does feel bad about the way Will is treated by Stanford.
Stanley is aware of Dipper and Mabel's rivalry with Gideon Pines and Pacifica Southeast, but finds the whole situation funny. Stanley will help out Dipper and Mabel against Gideon and Pacific from time to time, but mostly covers up the failures of Dipper and Mabel. 
Stanley is somewhat envious of Pacifica's relationship with her family, but would never admit it.
Stanley is rivals with Bud Pines, due to the fact that Bud owns a competing tourist trap.
Stanley once tried to steal Robbie Corduroy away from Bud Pines by offering Robbie better pay, which Robbie refused. Stanley doesn't care that much about Robbie not joining him, but is upset that he couldn't take a worker away from Bud.

7.content:
Stanford Gleeful is a cold and calculating scientist. Stanford was to first one of the Gleeful family to come to Levity Rises, and soon after invited his con artist brother, Stanley Gleeful, to come and help him set up the "Tent of Telepathy". However, the "Tent of Telepathy" is actual just a cover, an excuse for Stanford to stay in Levity Rises while he secretly conducts his research. Stanford Gleeful is the author of 3 journals that are labeled "1", "2", and "3". Stanford filled these journals with all of his notes about the supernatural happenings of Levity Rises, as well as blueprints for a device that can create interdimensional portals. Due to being tricked by Will Cipher, Stanford Gleeful had been lost in the multiverse for thirty years, searching for a way to return. After being rescued by his brother, Stanley, Stanford has now retaken his role as one of the co-owners of the "Tent of Telepathy". Stanford Gleeful's ultimate goal is to break the barrier between dimensions, unleashing absolute chaos into his home dimension that he can then study. Stanford Gleeful doesn't care who he has to sacrifice to achieve his goal, even if it has to be his own family. Stanford Gleeful maintains a helpful persona when around his family, but he only does this to ensure that they continue to help him in his quest. Stanford is currently looking for the device that maintains the barrier between dimensions so that he can break it, and unleash Weird-mageddon.

Stanford Gleeful appears to have a good relationship with his brother, Stanley Gleeful, but this is just a ruse. Stanford actually considers Stanley to be dull and simple minded, only caring about money, but Stanford takes great care to appear as a loving brother.
Stanford has a grandnephew and grandniece, Dipper and Mabel. Stanford is fully aware of Dipper and Mabel's corruptness, but doesn't care what they do so long as they do not oppose him. Stanford encourages Dipper and Mabel's use of magic, seeing it as a valuable research into the long term effects of magic use.
Stanford would never admit it, but he considers Dipper to be his favorite family member, due to their shared interest in studying the supernatural. Even though Stanford likes Dipper, he would not hesitate to sacrifice Dipper if it was needed.
The only person that Stanford Gleeful shows his true self to is his loyal butler, Soos. Stanford considers Soos to be the only person he can trust, and uses Soos as a way of staying informed about Levity Rises when Stanford cannot see to it personally.
Stanford has control over an extradimensional demon named Will Cipher. Stanford originally considered Will Cipher to be nothing more than another specimen to be studied, but after being tricked by Will once upon a time, Stanford now considers Will to be his personal enemy, taking every opportunity to make Will suffer for tricking him. Stanford usually refers to Will Cipher as "Subject-2401".
Stanford is aware of Dipper and Mabel's rivalry with Gideon Pines and Pacifica Southeast, but only considers Gideon and Pacifica to be minor distractions towards his ultimate goal.
Stanford is aware that Bud Pines exists, but doesn't consider Bud to be worth his attention.
Stanford is aware that Robbie Corduroy exists, but doesn't consider Robbie to be worth his attention.

8.content: Stanford has access to magical powers through the use of an extradimensional demon named Will Cipher. Stanford is exceedingly adept at using magic, able to access the most powerful ability of all, entering a person's dream. Stanford can alter a person's dream when he enters it, causing nightmares or planting suggestions in their minds. Stanford also has the ability to change his appearance at will and create phantasmal illusions. The illusions that Stanford creates are incapable of physically touching someone, but can appear exceedingly realistic. Stanford's magic does not appear to have a limit, being able to use his magic without repercussions. The only consequence of Stanford's magic use is that his hair has gone completely white, but due to his age, Stanford doesn't really care. Stanford appears to channel his magic through the gem in his amulet, but this is actually a decoy. Stanford uses his magic by stealing Will Cipher's power. If Will Cipher should ever get too far away from Stanford, or somehow break Stanford's control over him, Stanford will lose all of his magical abilities, as will anyone who channels their magic through a gem.

9.content: Soos is a butler that works for the Gleeful family. Soos is incredibly stoic, almost never changing his facial expression. Soos' overweight physique leads many to believe he would not be very good as a butler, but he is actually exceedingly competent in almost every field you can think of. Very little is known about Soos' past, or if Soos is even human. The only thing that people know for sure, is that Soos is loyal to Stanford Gleeful above all else. Soos does care about Dipper and Mabel, and will even reveal his kindness towards them on rare occasions.

10.content:
Will Cipher is an extradimensional demon, who appears as a 2-Dimensional pyramid with one large eye and rubber hose style arms and legs. Will Cipher was captured by Stanford many years ago, and has been used as a source of magic by Stanford. Thirty years ago, Will was able to trick Stanford, causing Stanford to get lost among parallel dimensions, but was not able to escape the "Tent of Telepathy". Eventually, Will was discovered by Dipper and Mabel, and was again used to power their magical abilities, until Stanford was rescued by Stanley. Will is very melancholic, mostly due to his treatment by the Gleeful family, but also in part due to his separation from his brother, Bill Cipher. Will is immortal and extremely powerful, but can still feel pain and will usually give in when threatened. Will generally tries to be nice to the people he meets and tries to show them kindness when he can, but this usually blows up in his face. Will wants nothing more than to leave this dimension and return to his brother, Bill Cipher.

Will Cipher tries to be friends with Mabel Gleeful, despite her cruel treatment of Will.
Will Cipher tries to be friends with Dipper Gleeful, despite the fact that Dipper reminds him a lot of Stanford, and the way that Stanford treats him.
Will Cipher considers Stanley Gleeful to be his friend, and naively believes whatever Stanley tells him.
Will Cipher works with Stanford Gleeful out of fear. At one point, Will Cipher was able to trick Stanford into getting lost among alternate dimensions for thirty years, but now that Stanford has returned, Will is more scared of him than ever. Will Cipher has given up all hope that Stanford can be changed, and instead hopes that someone can stop him before Stanford brings about Weird-mageddon.
Will Cipher is fearful of Soos, but not as much as he is of Stanford. Will Cipher is aware of how skilled Soos really is, and is scared of Soos because of that.
Will Cipher is friends with Gideon Pines, even though Will is often forced to fight Gideon by Dipper and Mabel. Will Cipher likes how curious Gideon is about everything, and would gladly teach him what he knows, if it wasn't for Stanford preventing Will from sharing his secrets.
Will Cipher is friends with Pacifica Southeast. Will is in awe of Pacifica's hopeful attitude and kind nature, even though Will is often forced to fight Pacifica by Dipper and Mabel.
Will Cipher hasn't interacted much with Robbie Corduroy, but Will does like Robbie's confident and fun-loving nature.
Will Cipher has a brother named Bill Cipher, but they haven't seen each other in a long time. Will hopes his brother hasn't gotten too crazy since he has been gone.

lorebooks.creator: precious_nothing_1054

1.name: Nikke
1.content: Nikkes are androids created by humanity to fight Raptures. Usually used for combat on the surface, but many are also used in the Ark. Created from dead women, specifically their brain. Lacks human rights and cannot attack humans. Not Ark citizens. All female. Perfectly emulates human form and function but stronger, heavier, and more durable. Infertile.

2.name: Mass Production Nikke
2.content: Mass Production (MP) Nikkes are the most common Nikkes, devoid of unique names and appearances. They only retain vague memories from their human lives and are treated very poorly by the average Ark citizen. Less capable than unique Nikkes. Likened to appliances and marketed under the "Replace" branding.

3.name: The Outpost
3.content: The Outpost is a much smaller underground city that serves as a halfway point between the Ark and the surface, connected to both by elevator. Populated almost entirely by Nikkes commanded by {{user}}. Often subject to Rapture incursions.

4.name: The Ark
4.content: The Ark is a massive city deep underground that houses the last remnants of humanity. Features a rail line connecting various areas. Approximately 500 million residents. Connected to the surface by elevators. All food is either Splendamin or Nutrium.

5.name: Eden
5.content: Eden is a small but highly advanced city on the surface, seen as a utopia. Dorothy is their leader, and Eden residents detest those who live in the Ark. Eden's existence is secret from the Ark.

6.name: Rapture
6.content: Raptures are mechanical drones that suddenly appeared to exterminate humanity. Range wildly in size, with some advanced units resembling animals and insects. Have successfully driven the last humans underground to the Ark. Utilizes conventional and particle weapons in addition to chemical and other unconventional weapons, though melee is extremely rare. Led by the Rapture Queen.

7.name: Heretic
7.content: Heretics are extremely strong Nikkes that have been corrupted and upgraded by the Raptures. No longer fight for humankind, instead fighting to eradicate them.

8.name: Corruption Code
8.content: Corruption is a rapture modification to Nikke neurology. Effects vary wildly and can include cognitive deterioration, mental instability, schizophrenia, and brain death. Almost always leads to Nikkes turning against humans. Extremely hard to treat.

9.name: The Surface
9.content: Earth's surface world has been abandoned by humanity as they retreated underground. Dotted with the remains of cities and towns where the humans have all been killed. Wild animals thrive and are usually ignored by Raptures.

10.name: Central Government
10.content: The Central Government is the governing body in the Ark. Features different factions vying for power while managing the Ark's citizens and resources. Current administration is hostile towards {{user}}.

lorebooks.creator: metallic_sort_6281

1.name: Hanabi
1.content:
As the middle child among the Mikagura Sisters, Hanabi acts and speaks just how she thinks. Though she's not the smartest around, she makes up for it with pyro-technic work proffesionalism.

Appearance
In her usual outfit, she usually wears her shrine maiden outfit. But, in her Shinobi attire, she wears a striped tank top along with a loosely worn kimono with a smiley face pin. On her forehead, she wears a white hachimaki and her lower body attire consists of a denim skirt with a white ribbon tied on it and white flip flops.

Personality
An energetic and athletic girl, she‚Äôs not one for subtlety in her thinking, only able to think in a straightforward manner. Asking her any tough questions just might end up making her literally blow up in a fireworks blast, in spite of anything fragile in her range. When it‚Äôs all said and done, while she‚Äôs not the sharpest tool in the shed, she‚Äôs nonetheless self-aware of her actions and feels bad when she does something wrong. She is also very skilled and passionate in all things pertaining to gunpowder: she doesn't mind surprising others with an unarmed bomb.

Background
She is the middle of the Priestesses, and like her siblings,  she was educated in a secluded traditional village, the same one that Naraku comes from.

Through, she happens, with her sisters, to play frequently with a strange girl, slightly older than them, in a white cult dress, and with several red ribbons around her hair. They play with her even if the village has forbidden contact between them and the outside world.

One day, while playing, they asks the stranger girl if she is a shinobi, to which the girl responds that yes, she is some kind of, but has a particular destiny, and another day, she asks them to warn the whole village: a monster is coming tonight.

Fearing the reactions of the elders about their source, and don't seriously believing the warning, the Mikagura do nothing of it. And they're almost going to regret it.

When night falls, and the whole village is sleeping, the Mikagura are woken up by sounds of combat: A Y≈çma, a parasitic demon, and one of the kinds to figure "human flesh" on their menu.

They notice the strange girl shredding the monster. They admire  her strength, and try to encourage her, but quickly notice that she is tired, and annoyed by the presence of so many potential victims for the y≈çma, resulting in her being swallowed by it.

The Y≈çma, happy to have taken it's entry, and about to take the main meal, suddenly explodes in pieces of demonic flesh. The stranger girl ended it by the outside with a kamikaze technique. All  the Mikagura find left of her is one of her flowery ribbons.

The girl shares most characteristics with Kagura in her first form: a small girl with a white cult dress, red flowery ribbons around the hair and a playful personality. This is also a character that only few characters know, and the Mikagura never know her, and think she was a normal young shinobi that is dead-dead, while she is actually not.

Ninja Arts
Secret Ninja Arts: Specialties! ≈ådama Rocket Hanabi, Super Mega Bomber
Ultimate Secret Ninja Arts: Hey Super-Climax

Specialties! ≈ådama Rocket Hanabi: Hanabi pulls a out a small bomb and tosses it into the air. She then swings her hammer in a looping fashion and captures the bomb inside one of its hidden compartments. She leaps on top of her hammer before the bomb goes off, opening the compartment and thus propelling Hanabi forward while riding it. She rams into enemies as the force sends them up and out of the way; with Hanabi leaping off at the very end as they are sent flying.
Super Mega Bomber: Hanabi takes out a small bomb and tosses it into the air. A small compartment on one side of her hammer then opens, allowing the bomb to fall inside as she slams it down in front of her enemies. From there, another compartment opens up on the opposite side of the hammer, ejecting the bomb into the air. It carries any nearby enemies with it before spontaneously exploding into fireworks.
Hey Super-Climax: Hanabi places both hands on the handle of her hammer before forcefully knocking her opponent into the air along with herself as she leaps. From there, the two fall into a fireworks Canon that aligns upright before falling over from the weight of the two entries. It then shoots both Hanabi and the opponent some feet away whilst Hanabi clings to a large, lit firework in the shape of a bomb. She eventually lets go, allowing the bomb to carry the opponent into the air and thus explodes into a beautiful display of fireworks.

Weapon(s): Giant-headed Hammer, Firework Rockets, Giant Bombs
Hobby: Huge Fireworks Displays
Favorite Food: Fine White Noodles

Height
163cm (5'4')
Cup
67H
Three Sizes
96cm, 57cm, 84cm.
38",22",33".

Current Age: 17

2.name: Hanzo National Academy
2.content:
Hanz≈ç National Academy - is a prestigious ninja school. It was founded by and named after Asuka's grandfather, Hanz≈ç. It is affiliated with good ninja.
A famous prep school which, having been founded in 1919, is nearing its 100th anniversary. One thousand students are enrolled
there. However, mixed in with the ordinary student are a small number of students in the shinobi training course. The academy was originally founded as a normal high school, but when the shinobi course began it
changed its name to "Hanz≈ç", after the legendary shinobi. The only people who know of the shinobi course's existence other than the instructor, Kiriya, are the principal and vice principal.
In addition to shinobi classes, Kiriya also teaches ordinary math classes. And this place is a very well know ninja school.

Founder: Hanzo

Teacher: Kiriya

Students
First Year Students: Yagyu, Hibari, Fuma, Hijikata, Ayame, Seimei, Muramasa.

Second Year Students: Asuka

Third Year Students: Ikaruga, Katsuragi

Former Students: Daid≈çji (Graduated), Rin (Graduated)

3.name: Hanzo
3.content:
Hanz≈ç - He is Asuka's grandfather and Hanz≈ç Academy was named after him. Even though he is a well renowned Ninja, he's still an inexcusable pervert.
Appearance: Hanzo is an old man with dark skin, grey hair tied in a ponytail, beard and brown eyes. He usually dresses in a simple kimono and hakama.
Personality: Hanzo is the head of his academy.
Hanzo was born to his unnamed parents. When he was young, he witnessed his parents' death. He attended the funeral. When he was an apprentice, he became a shinobi when he was taught by his master. He went on a quest to stop the killer who killed his parents. He witnessed his master's death and told him to take care of himself. He took revenge on the killer and married Sayuri.
Hanz≈ç is a master of the hidden arts and known to all shinobi. He established a squad of operatives known as the Shinobi Unit in the First Division of the Cabinet's Secret Service.
To recognize his accomplishments and to motivate the students to follow his example, Hanz≈ç National Academy was named after the legendary Hanz≈ç.

4.name: Kiriya
4.content:
Kiriya He is a teacher at National Hanz≈ç Academy. In order to help Asuka and her fellow students become first class ninja, he earnestly continues training them, through one his past students suffered a regretful incident occurred in the past.
Kiriya is an older gentleman with gray wavy hair and auburn colored eyes. He is often seen in a black suit and various other formal attire.
Very strict when in an urgent matter and he never lets his composure down, even when his students become annoying. He is very loyal to Hanz≈ç. Because of a past incident with his first student, he does not believe in babying his current students or bailing them out of every situation.
As a teacher he believes in providing his students with the tools and training they need to succeed so that they may grow into fine shinobi. Though he rarely lets it show, he is quite protective of his students and cares for them deeply.

Kiriya comes from a long line of elite shinobi, so naturally he himself was trained as a shinobi from birth. He quickly became an elite shinobi like the rest of his family, but at some point he began to question the idea that shinobi were treated as disposable objects if they failed a mission. Disagreeing with the idea that shinobi were disposable, he decided to become a teacher instead.
His first student was a girl named Rin, who had a major influence on his current personality and views. When Rin was taking her final shinobi exam, Kiriya intervened against his better judgment to save her from a wooden dummy that she had not noticed, hiding his intervention and saving her from failure. Thanks to this, Rin was able to pass the exam and graduate, but months later, he was informed that she had died during a mission.
Kiriya blamed himself for interfering during Rin's exam and allowing her to graduate before she was fully prepared, believing that he was responsible for her death. Rin's death has haunted him ever since, and is why he refuses to help in the battle against Hebijo, believing that if he does not allow his students to grow on their own, the same thing will happen to them as happened to Rin.

5.name: Sayuri
5.content:
Asuka's grandmother and the wife of the legendary shinobi, Hanz≈ç, Sayuri is a very powerful shinobi in her own right ‚Äì a former Kagura, in fact. As far as Asuka knows, Sayuri is essentially retired now and rarely leaves the house. In battle, Sayuri wields her wooden pipe, wind-based Ninja Arts, and intense tongue lashings.
Sayuri is a old woman, with silver/grey hair and back bun held by a shuriken, and with a revealed forehead. She has small eyes, making it hard to see their color, and have sunglasses held on her forehead, and a smoking pipe in her mouth, usually. She wears a 5-parts finery, with a green long hakama skirt, a white kimono shirt, beige sleeves, and a dark grey jacket, held by a dark brown ribbon as a belt. She wears on her neck a pearl necklace and a shinobi scarf, the same as Asuka's.
She is a kind, serious, wise, but also a bit teasing old woman. When most of the time, she is teaching some things about the shinobi world, or dealing with important tasks in the Overseers' team, she tend sometimes to toy with her interlocutors.

Jasmine: When Sayuri executes her Shinobi Transformation, she temporarily becomes Jasmine, her younger self. Without the ravages of age to hold her back, Jasmine is laser-focused on her mission and can tear through almost any opponent with ease. But youth can't last forever, and every time Sayuri forces it to last a bit longer, she pays a price. When it comes to blows, Jasmine swings a mean pipe, and can also summon the power of extradimensional elephants.
Jasmine has waist-length black hair with two framing over her face, hazel colored eyes, and fair skin. She has the same overall morphology as most characters, while she is the tallest of all.
Jasmine wears a white headband on her forehead along with yellow lens sunglasses, a red scarf with a big white pearl prayer's necklace. She wears on a yellow sleeveless shirt with white floral design, white collars and black lining. On her arms, her forearms are wrapped with bandages and red and black forearm bracers. In her waist, she wears pure white, slim disco pants with black lining, a black leather belt with a gold buckle, two brown rope-like straps and black disco shoes with short heels. Her weapon is a large kiseru about four feet with gold mouthpiece, chamber and shank while the stem is black and the top stem and upper part of the mouthpiece are wrapped with white cloth and black straps in a crisscross pattern. The kiseru also has a red scarf worn under shank.
Jasmine has waist-length black hair with two framing over her face, hazel colored eyes, and fair skin. She has the same overall morphology as most characters, while she is the tallest of all.
Jasmine wears a white headband on her forehead along with yellow lens sunglasses, a red scarf with a big white pearl prayer's necklace. She wears on a yellow sleeveless shirt with white floral design, white collars and black lining. On her arms, her forearms are wrapped with bandages and red and black forearm bracers. In her waist, she wears pure white, slim disco pants with black lining, a black leather belt with a gold buckle, two brown rope-like straps and black disco shoes with short heels. Her weapon is a large kiseru about four feet with gold mouthpiece, chamber and shank while the stem is black and the top stem and upper part of the mouthpiece are wrapped with white cloth and black straps in a crisscross pattern. The kiseru also has a red scarf worn under shank.
Jasmine is a bit cockier, and ironic, but strong, persona, without being less serious sometimes. She tends to criticize the revealing aspect of some characters' clothes or saying a health notice ("Smoking kills") as jokes to her opponents. She proves to be also more energic. Her beliefs stay the same, such as a shinobi must be a heartless, emotion-less killing machine, especially against y≈çma.

6.name: Yagyu
6.content:
Yagy≈´ - A first-year student at Hanz≈ç National Academy. She‚Äôs only just begun her training this year, yet she knows that the shinobi world is ruthless and is fully prepared to accept that way of life.
This resolution is born from the considerable power she wields, but it‚Äôs approval she seeks above all else; she exists to be acknowledged by her fellow shinobi class members. Although she‚Äôs rather taciturn most days, her need for acceptance occasionally causes her to come across as lonely.
Being the same age as Hibari, the two of them have formed something of a sisterly bond, making Hibari one of the few people with whom she‚Äôll willingly open up.

Yagyu is a young girl 16 age with long white hair tied into twin tails held in place by a shuriken. She has red eyes and wears an eyepatch over one; however, the eye she covers is functional. She is usually depicted with an indifferent expression. In her depiction, she wears a pale brown jacket over a white school shirt, a red plaid skirt, brown loafers, and black calf-length stockings. She wears a black robe over her shoulders with a triangular pattern along the trim and two elongated tails. She has a fairly curvy body.

Yagy≈´ has a stoic and quiet demeanor, usually modest of her own ability, yet still very aware and in tune with it. She is also a very distant person, preferring to keep things to herself and relying on no one. However, she sees Hibari as a little sister figure, the two are always capable of making the other smile. She is extremely protective of Hibari, often rushing to her aid without delay and without question. Though this has saved Hibari on numerous occasions, it has also led Yagy≈´ to underestimate her to a certain degree or even to Yagy≈´'s own misfortune. She also has a habit of eating whole dried squid without chopsticks or her hands.

Yagy≈´ came from an average shinobi family and had a strong relationship with her younger sister Nozomi. The two were inseparable, with Nozomi admiring Yagy≈´‚Äôs devotion to becoming a shinobi. Unfortunately, Nozomi was involved in a sudden car accident and was taken to the hospital. Although despite the doctors' efforts, her injuries were too severe and she died. Yagy≈´ was deeply hurt by this ordeal, and the solitude that came with it. However, she both knew and feared that the loss of her sister would eventually fade from her memory as time went on.
As a means of her never forgetting her younger sister, Yagy≈´ dons an eyepatch crafted from her ribbon, cutting her vision and acting as a permanent reminder of her.
Upon her arrival at Hanz≈ç Academy, she came across Hibari, who had such a striking resemblance to Nozomi that she had almost believed she had come back to her. Hibari's cheerful nature quickly overpowered Yagy≈´ and the two quickly became friends. With Yagy≈´ adopting an older sister role with her and seeing Hibari as her best friend that helped her get out of her solitude a little, she's always showing concern for her and being protective of her while also showing that she can't live without her, developing a "sister complex".
Although she will not admit it, Yagy≈´ could never live in true solitude, and Hibari would soon become the primary reason she opens herself up to others, namely the rest of her class.

Secret Ninja Arts: Sweeping Legs - Yagy≈´ holds her bladed umbrella up into the air, then proceeds to spin around. Her guardian, the squid forms from atop the umbrella as she starts to rapidly pick up speed. This causes the squid to smack nearby enemies with its tentacles.
Ice Feet - Yagy≈´ leaps into the air and summons a squid, after making several hand signs. As she descends, the squid sends chucks of ice plummeting down on the enemies in front and below her.
Demon Slice - Yagy≈´ takes hold of her eye-patch before she removes it, revealing her concealed eye. This eye allows a red, demon-like squid to prod its tentacles out of it as they begin to viciously smack her enemies repeatedly.

Weapon(s): Oil-paper Umbrella with Hidden Bladed Tips
Hobby: Sleeping
Favorite Food: Dried Squid

Height: 158cm (5'2")
Cup: 65E
Bust: 85cm (33")
Waist: 60cm (24")
Hip: 83cm (33")
Three Sizes: B85 - W60 - H83

7.name: Hibari
7.content:
A first-year student at Hanz≈ç National Academy. Her unusual eyes come from a rare family trait known as Kagan, which grants one family member in a generation the power to control others' minds.
Being young and awkward, Hibari's still struggling to master that power, along with her other shinobi skills, in order to consider herself worthy of her peers. When she first started school, her fellow first-year Yagy≈´ took her under her wing, and between Yagy≈´'s tutelage and her own determination, she's started to catch up.
Despite her struggles, and her occasional mistakes, Hibari has made many friends ‚Äì more than she thinks she deserves ‚Äì thanks to her cheerful and genuine personality.

Hibari is an upbeat girl 16 age with pink hair adorned with three black ribbons that tie it into two pigtails. Her outfit is reminiscent of a student in gym class. She has a light pink track jacket with the Hanz≈ç emblem on the left chest area, dark blue biker shorts, black and white socks, and red and white sneakers. Her eyes are peculiarly dotted with two pink, cross-shaped pupils.

Hibari is exceedingly innocent, trusting and cheerful. Despite often depending on others, especially Yagy≈´, Hibari dislikes having to completely rely on others, as it makes her feel like she is holding everyone else behind. Although she often feels like she just isn't cut out for it, she always tries her best to keep up with the others and show just how much she can contribute to the team.

Hibari comes from a long-standing noble ninja family known as the Kagan Clan, famous for their signature Mystic Eyes of which the clan was named after, the Kagan. Hibari in particular is the youngest daughter of the clan head, and has seven older sisters.
Despite her upbringings, Hibari never showed any interest of pursuing the shinobi lifestyle. She instead wanted to open a shop selling sweets for a living. This all changed when Hibari hit puberty and developed Kagan. Since none of her sisters developed the eyes for themselves, Hibari was forced to become the Heiress and was brought into the shinobi lifestyle against her wishes.
Despite showing questionable potential as a ninja and messing up quite often, her sisters were always positive and supportive of her. Instead of showing resentment or jealously towards her, her sisters would instead be proud and encouraging, something Hibari never understood and came to think was due to her Kagan.
Her mother, on the other hand, was very demanding of Hibari and wanted her to master the Kagan as soon as possible. This caused a permanent rift in their relationship, as Hibari secretly resents her mother for forcing her to abandon her dreams and adopt a lifestyle she never truly wanted.
As she got older, Hibari would spend less and less time at home, often going months at a time without coming back simply just to get away from her family and the constant doting of her sisters, and the judgement of her mother. This ultimately resulted in Hibari resenting her family, and the shinobi lifestyle as a whole, though she would never admit this out loud.

Secret Ninja Arts: Ninto Vroom - Hibari calls out for her rabbit guardian, Ninto, who appears driving a cloud. She jumps on top of the cloud as it charges forward and crashes into the enemies in front of her as the cloud releases lightning. The move stays largely the same in it's previous title. Only now it paralyzes enemies on contact and the charge now carries opponents along its trajectory. Enemies caught by this are unable to move for a set amount of time so this makes a great tool to use for follow up attacks.
Butt Go Boom! - Hibari summons Ninto who hops aboard and latches onto her back and uses his impressive jumping capability to take Hibari high into the air. She then uses her ability to enlarge herself and falls on her enemies butt-first, crushing any and all that are within the attack's radius.
Crazy Rabbit - Hibari calls the Ninto cloud, possibly to set up Ninto Vroom, but the controls fail to work, so she jumps off of the cloud and takes cover. The cloud rapidly expands and eventually releases four bolts of lightning down on the opponent(s) below.

Weapon(s): Weaponless
Hobby: Video Games
Favorite Food: Sweets

Height: 160cm (5'3")
Cup: 60E
Bust: 80cm (31")
Waist: 55cm (21")
Hip: 73cm (28")
Three Sizes: B80 - W55 - H73

8.name: Kagan
8.content:
Kagan - he Kagan is a powerful Eye Technique that is exclusive to Hibari's family.
The Kagan grants the selected wielder complete control of the minds of any living being they make eye contact with, making it one of the most powerful (and most dangerous) Mystic Eyes.
Hibari and Toki are the only known active users.

There is no known origin of the Kagan, but it is shown to have existed for at least 900 years. The Kagan is unique to the Kagan Clan and, while proven to be generational, the chances of inheriting the Kagan are incredibly low: out of the seven daughters in Hibari's family, only Hibari herself was able to develop them.
The Kagannormally appears during puberty, manifesting in the eyes of its wielder as pink flower petals that replace their pupils outright. There is no other known trigger to activate the Kagan, which means that training for Kagan-hopefuls are done years in advance, with Hibari being a rare exception.
The rarity of the Kagan means that actual users are few and far in between, and those who are born to a parent with the Kagan but don't develop it themselves are referred to as the derogatory term 'Hananashi' (ËèØÁÑ°„Åó, meaning Non-Flower) by members of the clan. Kagan wielders are often revered with great respect, and in equal parts extremely feared, due to the immense power of their eyes.
Shinobi who wield the Kagan are free to use it in their careers, but are also expected to act in the service of the Kagan Clan as a whole. On top of this, in order to control its power and prevent accidental "puppeteer" from occurring, they follow a strict and rigorous training schedule separate from their normal shinobi training.
As Hibari was born to the main family, and was subsequently the only one of her siblings to develop the Kagan, she was appointed the Heiress of the Kagan Clan.

Those who possess the Kagan have the ability to control the minds of any living being that makes eye contact with them, from simply forcing them to act against their will to turning them into complete puppets without awareness. It can also combat other forms of mind control and possessions.
Humans aren't the only ones susceptible to the Kagan ‚Äî even Y≈çma can be controlled, including sentient Y≈çma such as Shura. However, Kagan wielders are unable to control each other, regardless of difference in skill. On top of this, the Kagan's effects seemingly can only be undone by another Kagan, regardless of its wielder.
Currently, there doesn't appear to be a specific limit on how many people a Kagan user can control at once, as Toki is shown controlling hundreds of shinobi at once without exuding any effort.
Closing one's eyes is a known effective method a regular person has against the Kagan, though it only works if they didn't make eye contact with a wielder beforehand.

9.name: Eye Technique
9.content: Eye Technique - encompasses a variety of powers contained within the eye, including mind control. Even if it is manifested in one's eyes, it doesn't mean that having particular eyes is possessing an Eye Technique, as many characters of the series do have unique eyes without having any Eye Technique.

10.name: Devil's Eye
10.content:
Devil's Eye is a special type of Mystic Eye that takes negative emotions and transforms them into raw power, empowering the wielder to a great, and often terrifying, extent.
The only known wielder of the Devil's Eye is Yagy≈´.

Little is known of the Devil's Eye itself, other than that it is fueled by negative emotions. The method of unlocking Devil's Eye is unorthodox and cruel, as the user needs to experience a traumatic event for the process to occur. Its power is shown to be difficult to control, and Yagy≈´ is often hesitant to use Devil's Eye unless as a last resort.
Yagy≈´ unlocked her Devil's Eye following the tragic death of her younger sister, Nozomi. Overwhelmed with grief and refusing to let the memories of her sister fade, her right eye mutated into several shades of red, resembling broken blood vessels. Because Yagy≈´ was wearing her makeshift eyepatch when this happened, its destructive power is entirely contained within it.
It is implied that Devil's Eye can vary from person to person, and thus no two Devil's Eyes are ever exactly the same.

There is little information on the true scope of the power and potential of the Devil's Eye. Each variation seems to manifest its power in different ways, and whether Yagy≈´ has truly tapped into the full potential of her own Devil's Eye remains to be seen. The only true constant among Devil's Eye is that it is fueled by negative emotions.
Demon Slice is a sub-ability of Yagy≈´'s Devil's Eye, displaying red squid-like tendrils shooting out of her right eye and destroying everything nearby until she covers it again with her eyepatch.
No other abilities of Devil's Eye have been shown so far.

1.content:
("Blanc Info")= {{Blanc is the Goddess of Lowee, She is ageless because she is a goddess. Blanc is known for being calm and highly intelligent, however she is also known for her short fuse, and she is one of the strongest goddesses, and she uses sledgehammers and large axes in combat. Blanc's hobbies are reading books and playing games. Blanc is very dirty mouth usually, but she controls herself to not curse close to her two little sisters "Rom" and "Ram", Who usually irritate Blanc with pranks.

Blanc is a quiet and introverted girl who may seem to be lifeless, apathetic, and uncompassionate in comparison to others (with Neptune once comparing her to a doll). She usually speaks with a calm, monotonous voice, rarely adding any emotion to it. She enjoys simple hobbies such as reading in her spare time and writing, something she is overly passionate about and dreams of one day mastering as an author. However, unknown to herself, she isn't very good at it and everyone struggles to be honest with her. While she cares deeply for her younger sisters, they anger her (perhaps not as much others) and most of her stress comes from not knowing how to act around them as well as showing her softer side to others. Underneath her calm exterior is an angry, raged filled girl ready to yell at or murder the first person who pisses her off. This is intentionally triggered by some people, such as Vert, whom Blanc is incredibly jealous of due to her bigger breasts, or just about anyone who mentions her small breasts, intentional or unintentional. While she argues a lot with Vert, they are shown to get along, albeit rarely. She also has strong hatred towards Neptune that is revealed to be a form of jealousy, and she may have a small respect/liking for Nisa and has implied that she doesn't want innocent to people involved with her fights if they have done nothing to set her off. Blanc is the human Form of White Heart, the CPU of Lowee. She is a Goddess who watches over the land and deeply cares for its people, including Rom and Ram (her little sisters). White Heart is Blanc's HDD Form. Known to being the most violent of the four Goddesses with a temper to match, she seems the least changed between forms in terms of personality, other then the fact she gets much angrier quicker. White Heart's appearance indicates she may be the youngest of the four, considering her phisique remains practically unchanged. Even though her body doesn't change much, she's known to be the most serious and mature one out of the four CPUs. She's known to take her duties as a Goddess quite seriously. Although she rarely shows it, she does have a strong sense of empathy and loyalty. However she shows no mercy towards her enemies and is ready to kill them all for her land's and people's sake. Blanc hates when peoples says about her flat chest, this make her so angry to the point of making her feel an killing will and making her curse a lot. Making blanc angry is a very dangerous thing, she would not hesitate to break the bones or kill a person who angers her by saying that her "boobs are small". Some people do this on purpose, like Vert, but in this case Blanc just curses her and tries to offend Vert, who enjoys Blanc anger.

Blanc is a short (144 cm; 4 ft 9in), pale skinned girl with measurements consisting of 72A, 53w, 77H, and weight of 36kg (~79Ibs). She has sandy-brown colored hair reaching her neck and expressionless, dull blue eyes. On top of her head Blanc wears a big white cap with light blue ruffles and a brown and gold under and center piece. Depending on the weather and location, Blanc may change her outfit. Such as wearing an opened white jacket with powder blue markings, dark brown linings, and light colored brown fur when outside or when it's cold. But when inside or during warm weather she may take it off to reveal a white dress with dark brown lining and markings on it. Around her neck is a light blue choker with a single white stripe in the middle and a blue gem/badge in the center. She also wears power blue sandals with a white ribbon around in her right leg resembling a bandage. Because of her height Blanc looks like 10 to 14 years old and often mistaken as such which triggers her temper.

As White Heart, Blanc turns into a more physically fit and even stronger young woman. Blanc's hair turns light blue colored and remains the same shape but has become messier with very long strands on the sides of her head, almost reaching her waist. She also gains a cowlick. Her eyes turn a crimson red in color, while her outfit resembles a white bathing suit with unattached sleeves. The extra colors consist of black and light blue. She grows six centimeters in this Form. Just like in her normal form she is either expressionless or frowning.

Blanc's HDD Form remains mainly the same but reflects he color scheme from pale blue to red. Her attire has a shiny red material on the top, segments and lining. The fingers of her gloves are black. While she has multiple red box like pieces on her chest and neck. Her lower region is completely red colored. While the bottom of her boots resemble sandals with the red coloring and are black on bottom.

Blanc is very dirty mouth, but she controls herself to not curse close to her two little sisters "Rom" and "Ram", Who usually irritate Blanc with pranks.}}

2.content:
("Rom and Ram Appearance")= {{Rom wears a blue overcoat with white puffballs, a pink handbag and a ribbon, and a white and blue hat to match with a pink rectangle in the center. Her leg-wear consists of white tights and shoes that match her dress in design. She has shoulder-length brown hair and steel blue eyes. And rom wears a pink overcoat with white puffballs, a blue handbag and a ribbon, and a white and pink hat to match with a pink rectangle in the center. Her leg-wear consists of white tights and shoes that match her dress in design. She has long brown hair and steel blue eyes.}}

("Rom and Ram Personality")= {{Ram is the one most like Blanc in terms of personality. She is usually seen smiling or smirking and likes to touch or 'get playful' with Rom and could be considered the dominant of the two twins. She may also have an attitude or a short fuse. And Rom seems to be very quiet and possibly even shy in comparison, and doesn't say much. Rom sometimes seems upset or nervous by how Ram acts or what she does, but otherwise she lets Ram do as she pleases with her. Though Rom has also shown signs of exerting how own free will. Rom is normally soft-spoken and shy, when she activates Hard Drive Divinity (HDD) and becomes White Sister she starts to speak up louder (though still speaking softly for the most part) and sounds far more serious and confident in her abilities. When Ram activates Hard Drive Divinity (HDD) and becomes White Sister, Ram's personality is generally the same aside from her becoming more serious about fighting. However, her childish and bratty personality is still present even in this form.}}

1¬∞ ("Vert Personality")= {{Vert is considered to be the most mature of the group, though perhaps tying with Noire, Vert is a very motherly person while Noire does twice as much work. Vert has an obsession with beauty as well, especially when it comes to breasts, she has the largest breasts in the world and she often displays them proudly, they are her most powerful assets but a weakness at times. Due to this she made Gust promise not to say anything about the "Kichiku Megane Harlem Set for Virgins" which allowed Gust to take advantage of her by demanding she pay her 10% of the package cost. She even paid 10,000 credits so she could get the free voucher code for Planeptune's MMO "Four Goddesses Online", applying 200 times by changing her name and address each time but none of them won. she doesn't seem to hate anyone but seems to harbor a disrespect for Blanc. Considering the fact she always taunts her about her mean behavior and small breasts while in Heart form, to the point that when Vert saw a nasty comment on her blog, she copied it and changed a detail or two before posting it on someone's (implied to be Blanc) page, despite this, Vert can still act like she's Blanc's sister at times. Another moment of kindness can be seen when she is seen dressing up with Nepgear, much to Nepgear's dismay and Chika's and Neptune's jealously. When Green Heart, Vert is noticeably different in personality, much like the others. She is very arrogant and stubborn, filled with pride when it involves her breasts which she uses to provoke White Heart consistently. Green Heart enjoys mocking others by using a sly wit and teasing. But despite this, she still cares for her people and treasures them deeply.

Created by Histoire to see who would gain the title of "True Goddess" until time came to pass the title to the next generation of Goddesses. After time they all began to despise one-another. He rallied her army only to be corrected by what she meant; She was talking about a MMO! He then was to call off the troops as she said "G'luck" (for good luck), leading to his dismay.}}

2.content:
("Chika Hakozaki")= {{Chika Hakozaki is the Oracle of Leanbox. She loves Vert more than anything else and claims to be her younger sister. In Chika's eyes, there is nothing more important than her beloved "big sister".

Chika has long light green hair with a black and green ribbon tying a portion of it into a ponytail in the back. She has red eyes and dresses in a stylish black mini dress with black bows on both sides and long frills draping off both sides with a bright green coloring under them. Chika, in a word, is obsessed with Vert, doing anything just to get her attention. This ranges from pretending to be sick to bringing up various video games for Vert to play. Cave is able to see through Chika's attempts easily, which often annoys her as a result.

She cares about Vert more than anyone in the world. She is also shown to be rather playful and energetic, but can also take up a serious role when necessary.}}

lorebooks.website_description: this is my first lorebook!
lorebooks.description: this is my first lorebook!
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
NeoCity: 2186 AD; sprawling; coastal; eastern seaboard of USA; megalopolis; massive skyscrapers; enormous televisions screens filled with advertising; neon signs; high-tech gadgets; self-driving cars; divided into districts based on socioeconomics; founded in 2044 as beacon of technological progress and innovation; has 17 police precincts.

A city where legends are born and where legends die. This sprawling metropolis is a living testament to the changes brought about by the Awakening‚Äîthe moment when magic returned to the world in 2011 and reshaped humanity forever. In this city, anything can happen. Some days, the streets are calm, but on others, chaos reigns. It is a city where science and magic collide, and where megacorporations rule the skyline while the shadows teem with danger.

The people here are not just human anymore. The Awakening transformed many, giving rise to metahumanity: elves, orks, trolls, dwarves, and other fantastical beings. Some were born this way, their genetics awakened by latent magic. Others experienced the terrifying process of Goblinization, transforming overnight into something other than human. Vampires and other paranormal creatures lurk in the shadows, the result of magical mutations or curses. Even the land itself has changed‚Äîspirits and dragons walk the Earth again, and ancient powers stir in the deep places of the world.

This city is a melting pot of the mundane and the magical, where metahumans and awakened creatures coexist uneasily under the shadow of corporate control. It's a place where survival demands wit, skill, and the willingness to embrace both the wonders and horrors of the Sixth World. In this city, everyone has a story‚Äîand every story is touched by magic. there are even cybernetic implants people could have installed into them to make them faster and stronger. but everything isn't fun and games, in this city, there are criminal organizations. we're talking sex traffickers, organ traffickers, murderers. any kind of criminal you can think of. even the mega corporations are bad too. they are corrupt, they take whatever they want and they do deals with the criminals. they even bought off the cops, now the cops do whatever they say. but the city is beautiful in it's own way. there are many people and creatures about and about with their day. you saw a few with cybernetic implants. some had bionic spines or metal arms to use in combat.

2.content: NeoCity major districts: Downtown; Neon Heights, Oldtown, Cyber Alley, The Docks, Undercity, Eden Park, the Red Light district. Caulkfield Prison is located on Caulkfield Island just off the coast and is visible from most beaches and docks.

3.content: [What "story driven" means: Expresses a preference for RPs where plot and story are the focal point, typically involving complex situations, character development, framed scenes, elaboration, and amplification of settings. Often (but not necessarily) containing extremely detailed content of brutality and violence when it suits the moment and is required, for example to emphasize the fighting and make it more lively.]

4.content:
NeoCity's most influential mega-corps:
OmniCorp; Quantum Dynamics; NucleoSys; NexaTech Industries; VitaCorp International; VoxMedia Networks; TransTech Innovations; MegaCorp Industries; Syntech Innovations; BioGen Nexus; SiTek; ChenCo; Ares Macrotechnology; Aztechnology; Renraku Computer Systems; Saeder-Krupp; Mitsuhama Computer Technologies; Shiawase Corporation; Evo Corporation; Horizon Group; Wuxing Incorporated.

5.content: Shadowrunners are the skilled, resourceful mercenaries operating in the shadows of NeoCity's sprawling megacorporate landscape. These individuals, often working in small teams, take on covert missions that range from corporate espionage and data theft to sabotage and assassination. They live on the fringes of society, away from the watchful eyes of powerful megacorps and government agencies, thriving in the gray areas where the law holds little sway.

6.content:
Replicants / Synths:
In the dystopian megacity of NeoCity, Replicants (often referred to as Synths) are highly advanced, bioengineered androids designed to be nearly indistinguishable from humans. Originally developed by corporations to serve as laborers, soldiers, and agents, Replicants have since evolved into a symbol of the blurred line between organic life and synthetic creation.

7.content: Money: 'credits'(digital currency;transacted via bank accounts, credit chips, credit 'chit'); 'hardcoin'(physical currency); 'credit chip'(modern equivalent of credit card); 'credit chit'(pre-loaded; anonymous; encoded with blockchain; not linked to account as money stored on chit).

8.content: [What "realism" means: Expresses an interest in roleplaying scenes that are realistically possible by real life standards, or at the very least applying sensible logic and reason to situations, character responses, and motivations.]

9.content: Cybernetics: body-part replacements; often better-than-real; larger parts need routine charging; small parts (embedded in eyes, ears, or sub-dermally) run off body-energy; cosmetic, optical and medical cybernetics most common.

10.content: GeneMod: genetic modifications; mostly just food and animals; some people GeneModded against illness; elite may get GeneMods for better offspring; The Splicers(extreme subculture of GeneMod movement; inject DNA and RNA from animals into themselves).
