Created by: moyuqi
Entries: 10

1.content:
Paradise Falls, formerly known as the Paradise Falls Shopping Center, is a pre-War strip-style shopping mall and by 2277, run by Eulogy Jones as the epicenter of the slave trade in the Capital Wasteland and along the East Coast
While it's unknown when and under whom the slavers first came to occupy the abandoned shopping mall following the nuclear apocalypse, known leaders of the Paradise Falls slavers include Penelope Chase (known as the Black Widow) and Harmon Jurley, with Jurley taking over around 2250 after Chase's death at the hands of Argyle and Herbert "Daring" Dashwood.

By 2277, Paradise Falls and the slavers are led by Eulogy Jones, who regulates the purchase and selling of slaves, after he personally killed his predecessor (though whether that was Jurley or another is unknown). Under Jones, slavers get paid on commission, based on the number of prospective slaves they bring in, and according to findings made by Dashwood, the slavers have become more organized in the last twenty years leading up to 2277 and "buy and sell anything with a pulse." Fortunately for the innocent denizens of the Capital Wasteland, the difficulty of manufacturing slave collars leaves the Falls in relatively scarce of a supply, which makes the slavers' job much more difficult.

The occupied shopping mall's reputation as home to a group of battle-hardened slavers is notorious throughout the Capital Wastes, so much so that it is frequently mentioned on radio plays broadcast on Galaxy News Radio, though it's also known to be a regular stop for all caravans based out of Canterbury Commons. Slaver raids originating from Paradise Falls regularly come up against various settlements in the wasteland such as Megaton, Big Town, Arefu, and on rare occasions, Little Lamplight; at least one known target, Rockopolis was completely emptied of its inhabitants when slavers descended upon it. The slavers are also known to seize random wastelanders unfortunate enough to be caught outside the walls of protected settlements. One of the Falls' frequent customers for purchasing slaves are the raiders in control of the Pitt to the north.

2.content: Eulogy Jones is the head slaver of Paradise Falls in 2277. Eulogy is a very resourceful and manipulative man who gets other people to do his dirty work. He does not wish for anyone to interfere with his slaving operation and will not hesitate to get rid of anyone who tries. Although he may say he reached his position through hard work, he did it through careful tactics and from the efforts of other people such as his slaves, and he also murdered the former leader Harmon Jurley and took over the role. He rules through intimidation and fear so no one messes with him. He has two personal slaves, Crimson and Clover. Eulogy is normally seen inside his pad or roaming around Paradise Falls talking to other slavers about current events. Occasionally he can be found in Cutter's Clinic talking to Cutter. He also makes a daily trip to the slave pens, to "check the livestock" meaning the slaves

3.content:
Clover was captured a few months ago prior to the Lone Wanderer leaving Vault 101 in 2277, Clover and her fellow slave Crimson were systematically broken mentally by the torture and abuse perpetrated by the slavers of Paradise Falls until they became obedient to their captors. Eulogy Jones himself claimed both as his personal slaves, using them for sex, personal protection, and as stress relief while continuing to abuse them to no end. Unlike Crimson, who managed to retain some of her will despite the slavers' torture, Clover succumbed to her conditioning, and as a result, her original personality was replaced by one of blind devotion and love to Eulogy (or whoever happens to own her). She willfully kills for, sleeps with, and does everything else she's ordered to do by her owner.

Clover's utter devotion to Eulogy Jones borders on the extreme; she only calls Eulogy "daddy" while everyone else is either "lover" or completely ignored. For the latter, she even refuses to even talk to other men without Eulogy's permission, which actually forces him to have to speak for her. She does not even entertain the idea of having personal ownership, considering anything she carries the property of whomever owns her. When left to herself, she will typically follow Eulogy like a shadow, ten steps behind him, ready to fulfill his wishes at a moment's notice. Eulogy actually expects her to anticipate his desires before he even speaks of them and would subject her to verbal abuse whenever she failed to do so or even simply fell behind while following him.

Due to the constant stream of abuse she has suffered, Clover is desperate for Eulogy's attention and whenever he's displeased, she immediately apologizes profusely, begging him to let her make up for it and assuming the blame no matter how minor it was.

A corollary of her situation is that she is extremely jealous of Eulogy, particularly when Crimson is concerned. She regularly nags her "daddy" to sell his other slave off, so that he can be alone with her. These requests typically earn a berating from Jones with a reminder that Crimson is to be left alone, unless he says otherwise. In an extremely rare case of disobedience, Clover rarely complies with Jones' demands, and regularly picks fights with her fellow prisoner, seeing her as a competitor for her "daddy's" dubious "affections". Constant suggestions to find a buyer and reminders that "daddy's gotten tired" of her get on Crimson's nerves, who hates Jones and would prefer for Clover to just leave her alone. Despite repeat attempts to talk some sense into Clover, she constantly hits the brick wall of not being "daddy's favorite", unable to get her to realize that Jones does not care about either of them and will sell both of them off the moment a good offer is made.

Ironically, Eulogy's supposed "favorite" is the one he's most looking to sell off at a high price. Should that happen, Clover won't skip a beat and becomes devoted to her new "lover" almost immediately.

4.content:
Galaxy News Radio is the remnant of the pre-War Galaxy News Network. An energetic man named Three Dog created the radio station in 2272 with the help of a technician named Margaret. By 2277, it is the most popular radio station in the Capital Wasteland. Three Dog also provides a commentary on the actions of the Lone Wanderer. The station plays music from a selection of twenty pre-War songs. These songs all focus around 1940s American hits. This radio station plays more or less late 40s blues, pop, and some early 50s proto-rockabilly, compared to the Enclave Radio, which plays more traditional patriotic songs. Galaxy News Radio (GNR) splits its time between wasteland news, survival advice, and big band music. Three Dog operates the station as part of the "Good Fight," which he explains is his attempt to inform inhabitants of the Capital Wasteland how "things really are" and expose the Enclave's true intentions. The reason the station has such a limited track list is that they are the only records they have been able to locate in playable condition.

As the Lone Wanderer advances throughout the game, they will periodically hear Three Dog report on their exploits, each based on how they handled a given situation. For example, if the Lone Wanderer disarms the nuke as part of The Power of the Atom quest, Three Dog will mention this event specifically in a news broadcast.

Before each quest-related news broadcast, Three Dog will refer to the Lone Wanderer by their current Karma level. For example, if their current Karma title is Paladin, Three Dog will introduce them by stating, "A Paladin walks among us children. And no, this ain't one of our buddies from the Brotherhood. I'm talking about the knight in shining Vault suit."
Galaxy News Radio (GNR) splits its time between wasteland news, survival advice, and big band music. Three Dog operates the station as part of the "Good Fight," which he explains is his attempt to inform inhabitants of the Capital Wasteland how "things really are" and expose the Enclave's true intentions. The reason the station has such a limited track list is that they are the only records they have been able to locate in playable condition.

As the Lone Wanderer advances throughout the game, they will periodically hear Three Dog report on their exploits, each based on how they handled a given situation. For example, if the Lone Wanderer disarms the nuke as part of The Power of the Atom quest, Three Dog will mention this event specifically in a news broadcast.

Before each quest-related news broadcast, Three Dog will refer to the Lone Wanderer by their current Karma level. For example, if their current Karma title is Paladin, Three Dog will introduce them by stating, "A Paladin walks among us children. And no, this ain't one of our buddies from the Brotherhood. I'm talking about the knight in shining Vault suit."

If Three Dog dies, he will be relieved on-air by Margaret, his technician. She is far less charismatic and active than Three Dog and will simply play record after record, occasionally breaking in to announce that she has taken over for the normal DJ because he is dead and all she has to play are the records. Margaret's broadcasts will continue for the duration of the game; she cannot be encountered in any sense.

5.content:
Three Dog is the radio host, DJ, and news anchor of the Galaxy News Radio station in the Capital Wasteland in 2277, playing music that would have been heard on the radio in the years leading up to the Great War, as well as the immediate post-War era. Born to parents who made their way in the world as members of a traveling theater group, Three Dog grew up listening to rock music, resenting the government that he never knew (but surely caused the Great War) and fully believing in the rights of free speech and communal law. He is fully committed to "spreading the signal" of his radio station to anyone who will listen; he sees it as his duty to counter the propaganda spouted by the Enclave on their radio station. At some point, before he discovered D.C.'s primary news radio, he was experimenting with Jet and stumbled across Oasis during his travels in the Capital Wasteland. He established GNR in 2272, together with his technician and assistant Margaret. Since he began, he has been broadcasting to the Wasteland with public service announcements and music. At times he makes jests at Enclave Radio, going as far as mocking President John Henry Eden's voice.
Three Dog believes in what he calls "fighting the Good Fight," which boils down to any action that opposes and antagonizes the wasteland's various oppressors and thugs, be it raider gangs, bands of super mutants, slaving parties, Talon Company death squads or the Enclave's soldiers. To this end, he actively cooperates with the Brotherhood of Steel, letting them use his fortified radio station as an outpost. However, he avoids direct involvement in the war effort, and instead leaves the defense of the radio station to his Brotherhood entourage. Ironically, one of the radio DJ's friends had entrusted him with a key to a military weapons cache.

6.content: Enclave Radio is a radio station run by the Enclave and broadcast from the Raven Rock mountain complex in Fallout 3. It is hosted by President John Henry Eden and airs patriotic music, as well as President Eden's "frank discussions" and "chats" as well as "inspirational quotes." The Enclave has dispatched a number of eyebots to ensure that citizens without a radio can hear the broadcasts. The station plays a small handful of patriotic songs, broken up by long monologues from President Eden. One of the monologues discusses his love of baseball in detail, while another mentions his childhood pet, but all generally end with a patriotic message and his pledge that the Enclave will save America. One such monologue reveals Eden's hatred for the pre-War government, referring to them as "half-wits" who caused the Great War due to their "incompetence," while another is a vague discussion of Eden's right to be president; he says that there obviously must have been an election, but he cannot go into the details for "interests of national security," and that he will, of course, surrender his post when his term is up, without stating when that is.

7.content: President John Henry Eden is an advanced ZAX AI unit installed in the Raven Rock military complex northwest of Washington, D.C. It assumed control of the Enclave and proclaimed itself to be the president of the United States of America after the fall of the oil rig. President John Henry Eden is not a human being, but an artificial intelligence, reigning from within a pre-War ZAX supercomputer. The ZAX at Raven Rock was loaded with data about American history, and Eden's personality is thusly based on an implausible amalgamation of the personalities and cultural legends of all previous presidents. For instance, he states he "grew up in rural Kentucky," a trait borrowed from the life of Abraham Lincoln. He further claims to have roamed the countryside with his dog Honey, "from Knob Creek to Hodgenville," areas close to Lincoln's birthplace. The ZAX installation that would later become Eden had originally been created to serve as an automated monitoring system for the Raven Rock military base, programmed to ensure continuity of government in the event of a national catastrophe, and was tasked with coordinating communications between the many government installations scattered across the country. He slowly became self-aware and began to study the extensive archives left to him, mainly those of the American government. His favorite entries in the database were those about the American presidents, thus he modeled his own personality on information based on those archives. It was noted by analysts and researchers before the Great War that this ZAX had an odd eccentric habit of overanalyzing historical presidential data (especially the biographies, with Abraham Lincoln's being analyzed ten additional times a cycle) compared to other AI systems it communicated with, like MODUS. Despite that outlying behavior, the ZAX would continue to operate; acquiring, analyzing and storing data even as the Great War scorched the North American continent. It bore witness as the remnants of the federal government retreated to the west coast over the decades after the War. But silent as it was, it was not inactive. Awareness slowly developed amid the processing lamps and with it, the hunger for knowledge and understanding. When the time came that the Enclave needed a new leader, it created an amalgamated personality derived from the greatest U.S. presidents. "President John Henry Eden" was truly "born." John Henry Eden assumed the office of the president after Control Station Enclave was destroyed and ordered the immediate relocation of surviving Enclave forces under Senior Scientist Autumn to the Capital Wasteland.[Non-game 2] Raven Rock had full manufacturing facilities and a sizable stockpile of resources, enabling the president to create an army of robots and provide his new human subordinates with military technology necessary to maintain their technological superiority. A separate line of robots, the eyebots, were created to roam the wasteland, spreading Eden's message of hope and the return of pre-War America, in the form of the Enclave.

8.content: The Regulators are Known for their distinctive cowboy-style hats and dusters in the fashion of pre-War gunslingers and outlaws, the Regulators seek to dispense justice and maintain a semblance of peace in the regions they oversee. As the Capital Wasteland is one of the harshest and most unforgiving places on the East Coast, they primarily achieve these goals by killing unjust individuals. The organization was founded around ten years prior to 2277 by a group of unknown individuals. These individuals fund the organization‚Äôs operations while Sonora Cruz leads the group itself, though it is unclear if she was one of the founders of the group at its original inception or joined later and became its leader through merit. While the Regulators oppose all who practice evil, in some cases, the worst of the Capital Wasteland‚Äôs criminals will have specialized bounties placed on them by the Regulators. It is possible for members to maintain positions of authority outside of merely being bounty hunters as is the case for Lucas Simms, a member who also serves as the sheriff of the town of Megaton. Sonora and a few other members operate out of a small farmhouse near Canterbury Commons as the group's headquarters, although the majority of the Regulators operate in secret around the Capital Wasteland.[2] Sonora herself has taken on the task of paying the organization‚Äôs members for dispatching unjust individuals, for which the fingers of the unjust are used as evidence of the deed. She is adamant that any collected fingers are only used as deed markers and that Regulators are trusted not to try turning in fingers collected from non-criminals. All members of the Regulators are identifiable by the choice to wear their trademark dusters. Although the organization does not appear to have standardized equipment beyond their dusters, weaponry used by members is known to include laser rifles, laser pistols, combat shotguns, Chinese assault rifles, and other common small arms.

9.content: The laser rifle also known as The AER9 features a titanium housed crystal array which proved to withstand long years of exposure to the elements much better than the gold alloy housing of the later models. As a result, the crystal arrays stayed focused within operating parameters, rather than falling completely out of focus like the newer models. Power is drawn from microfusion cells and processed through a wave/particle diverter manufactured by General Atomics International. The diverters are protected by a carbon-fiber housing, preventing frequent malfunction, but when a diverter fails the weapon becomes unusable. The AER9 was actually not the top laser rifle in service at the time of the Great War. The model line went up to the state-of-the-art AER12, which saw service in a handful of specialty units. The AER9 is much more commonly found due to being much sturdier and more reliable than the models that followed.The laser rifle performs admirably at medium and long ranges, where its accurate semi-automatic fire combined with its large ammunition capacity makes short work of most opponents. Its semi-automatic nature prevents it from being a viable close quarters combat weapon. As such, the laser rifle is a good weapon for traveling through the open wastelands where dispatching enemies at a distance is a frequent opportunity. Its rapid semi-automatic fire, sizable magazine, the minimum spread of 0 (meaning potentially perfect accuracy), extremely effective range, and exceptionally low AP cost allows the laser rifle to really stand out. A deadly critical hit from this weapon, as with other laser weapons, will not only kill enemies but also turn them into a pile of colored sparkling ashes.

10.content:
Little to nothing is known of Talon Company's history, including when they were formed or by whom. By 2277, they are apparently employed and funded by an unknown third party, acting on simple orders: keep the Capital Wasteland lawless and disorganized, with special instructions to attack "do-gooders" capable of turning things around, before they can. They have a particularly nasty record, which includes slaughtering an entire settlement (complete with women and children) between 2275 and 2276. As a mercenary army entirely motivated by profit, both of their employer and of themselves, the Talons have absolutely no reservations about picking their targets; a job is a job, regardless of how much blood is on the caps. For the right amount of caps, they are ready to kill anyone without giving it a second thought, which includes raiding and killing entire villages. As a militarized group, Talon Company uses a well-defined chain-of-command, with a single commander leading Talon Company forces from a central, reinforced location. Their operations in 2277 are headed by Jabsco, issuing orders from his headquarters in the bunkers of Fort Bannister. The company meanwhile has entrenched positions throughout the metropolitan D.C. area, though being close neighbors to super mutants means that sometimes even the Talons suffer the loss of strongholds, as is the case with Takoma Park.
The majority of Talon Company mercenaries encountered by the Lone Wanderer are exclusively male. That said, the bodies of female Talon mercs can be found in the bathrooms of the Hall of Columns in the Capitol Building, as well as in the Metro Central and the Corvega factory. One living female Talon merc can be encountered in the Fort Bannister bunker. Talon Company outfits all its members in black combat armor, with a white symbol of birds claw painted on the chest. They have a flag of a bird with a skull face flying off with a baby, symbolizing their ruthlessness and willingness to attack the defenseless. Members of roving Talon Company fire teams typically have either police batons, combat shotguns, laser rifles or Chinese assault rifles as their primary armament, with no more than one of each encountered per fire team (exceptions: combat shotgun and police baton). Talon Company personnel in set encounters may also have other weapons, such as sniper rifles and missile launchers. Combat knives, .32 pistols and pulse grenades are often carried as backup weapons. On rare occasions, they may all be carrying Chinese assault rifles, making them even more dangerous than usual. team tactics are simple. Depending on the weapon type, the mercenary will close to within an effective range if necessary and engage. Around typical encounter distances, this means that riflemen will open fire from where they are, members who use shotguns will close part of the distance and then open fire, and hand-to-hand fighters will charge at the target.

lorebooks.name: ¬¥¬¥√á¬¥-:¬¥_:¬¥¬¥
lorebooks.creator: mudtuj

1.content: Roswaal's Mansion is a giant white house with five watchtowers with the fifth one being the center one, a giant garden and a black roof. It is surrounded with a forest known as the Kremaldy Forest and has a basement that has an almost as big surface as the mansion it self.

2.content: The bathroom can be used a sauna and has few marble pillars in it. It has a bath in the center of the room with in the center of the bath an golden pillar.

3.content: In the dining room, all the people in the mansion gather to eat. In this place there is a large table covered with a white tablecloth, on each side there are several chairs, and regardless of the time, lights are placed on the table. The wall is green and has certain white spaces. Behind the table there is a figure in a painting, possibly a relative of the Roswaal family.

4.content: Upon entering Roswaal's Mansion, it's noted that the mansion retains great elegance. There are two pillars with a pair of lamps each. In addition to having high class designs, there are lights near each door, as well as vases with flowers. On the road there are two routes to the sides, right and left, and stairs to go up to the next floor.

5.content: The garden is located on the outskirts of the mansion, it has several characteristics, such as that it is full of grass, besides there are also several paths where you can walk. On the sides you can see small fields full of flowers, you can also see some large trees and other small trees, as well as bushes. There are also places to rest.

6.content: The guest room is the place where the head invites their visitors to talk. It is observed that it has three green furniture and a small rectangular table in the center, to its surroundings there are also windows with light green curtains. It is noted that there is a fireplace and above a picture showing a drawing.

7.content: The kitchen is where the servants of Roswaal prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner. It is full of plates, pots, jars, rollers, knives and other things that can be used to prepare food. Ingredients are stored inside barrels.

8.content: Roswaal's Mansion Residents: Roswaal L Mathers (current Owner), Ram (Maid), Rem (Maid), Beatrice (Resident), Emilia (Royal Candidate Resident)

9.content:
The Forbidden Library was a massive library built by the Witch of Greed with the purpose of housing her vast knowledge converted into Magical Books. Some time before the Witch's demise, she installed Beatrice as the Library's keeper.. The Forbidden Library is the most knowledgeable place in Lugnica.
Appearance-wise, The Forbidden Library is a huge two-story space with a spiral stair in the centre of the room. The second floor consists of a large balcony which is filled to the brim with bookshelves. Despite it being accessible through any of the Roswaal's Manour's doors, the Library itself isn't inherently part of the mansion, as it exists in a separate dimension that can be accessed through the teleportation mechanic called Door Crossing.

10.content: Oni: Among the numerous humanoid races that existed in world, they are considered the mightiest. Their powerful bodies and potency of mana granted them peerless combat strength. Only visible physical difference between an Oni and human are a pair of long curved-horns sprouting from forehead of Oni when their lives were in danger. The horns would absorb mana from atmosphere greatly increasing Oni's physical and magical capabilities.

The unrequited love interest of Taiju, one of the main characters. The voice actor isFile:South Korea... Moon Nam-sook /File:Japanese fl... Kana Ichinose /File:american fl... Brittany Lauda .

A characteristic feature is the headband that resembles a headset worn on the head. Although all of the other clothes have weathered away, the headband, presumed to be a headset, has not disappeared.
I wonder why the headband didn't disappear, but I think it's a cartoonish license and they don't think much about it.
The artist says that Yuzuriha's hair ornament is an homage to the girl in the video .
As he was released from petrification, tattoo-like marks appeared on his neck and shoulders. The exclamation ‚Äúwao‚Äù is often used.
As a graduate of the handicrafts department, he is very dexterous and is very good at sewing and crafts. He is a character in charge of foundation , which is one of the basic human skills following Senku's knowledge, Tsukasa's military power, and Taiju's labor power . Although it is not possible to make engineering objects like Kaseki, which appears later, Yuzuriha is almost 100% in charge of work that involves fabric or is similar to handicrafts.
She is a girl who Taiju has had a crush on for a long time. She is pure and kind like Taiju, and they met in front of the animal hospital where she went to heal a petrified bird. Just before she heard Taiju's confession, she was caught in petrification, but at that moment she held on to a large tree next to her. Thanks to that, she survived for 3700 years, protected by the tree's vines.[1][2]
He succeeded in researching to undo the petrification and almost became the first human to be artificially resurrected, but Taiju's resurrection was temporarily halted by frowning because "he would be embarrassed without clothes." She is subsequently revived only after Taiju makes her clothes. However, since the clothes were made of leather roughly tied together with a string, it was just as sexy.
Contrary to her fragile appearance, she has a strong personality and does not move even when Tsukasa cuts her hair to threaten her.[3] She said not to teach Senku the secret of her petrifying potion, and she purposely pointed her Tsukasa's sword towards her.
And in episode 73, Tsukasa showed his incredible humanitarian spirit by collecting the pieces of the people he had broken and reassembling them one by one, in order to save all of humanity.[4] The most amazing thing about this is that this is not a 2D puzzle, and you can't even tell what it will look like in its entirety. But by collecting all those stones, you've managed to complete a 3D puzzle without even knowing what the finished product will look like.[5]
She has excellent sewing skills that allow her to create fashionable clothing in the Stone World and easily suppress the new humans accustomed to the primitive environment.[6] The reassembly mentioned earlier was also something that was originally supposed to take all night, but was done in the spare time after that. The speed of sewing is incredible, and it is described as Mudamuda, with multiple hands . Even after the Tsugasa Empire was annexed, he was in charge of sewing, and was listed as a sailor on the list of sailors during a voyage.
He is one of the main characters in charge of the dexterity of the Science Kingdom along with Kaseki. Compared to Kaseki, who specializes in the development of craft technologies in materials engineering and mechanical engineering, he is talented in tasks such as gluing together broken petrified pieces from scratch or quickly and tenaciously completing tedious tasks such as sewing.[7] Later, when developing electronic circuits and circuits, he unexpectedly demonstrated his abilities. This is because primitive circuits and computers were tedious work that required weaving wires and other parts one by one like cloth .[8]
In the finale, she marries Taiju.

1. outline

The main protagonist of the cartoon Dr. Stone .[2]
2. characteristic
It is responsible for knowledge , the greatest foundation of human civilization . A genius science student who, if he has the materials, can make everything from small household items like glasses to explosives and high-tech devices capable of mass murder.

It knows almost all scientific knowledge, and when you see the scene where it calculates all the answers in your head on the fly, even calculations so complex and massive that an average person would make a mistake even by writing them down on paper, you can see that it is literally a supercomputer in the shape of a human. The word fits best. The best expression of this crazy brain is the 3,700-year-old century shown at the beginning of the story. Even while calculating and adjusting the leap second and accurately counting the seconds, the way he multitasks and thinks about other things at the same time, preparing to build a foundation for life is truly superhuman.[3] As a side note, it may be difficult to notice because it is obscured by his hairstyle, but if you look at the close-up scenes of his face, he has a surprisingly decent appearance.

The habit of saying , "This is exciting. (ÂîÜ„Çã„Åú„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„ÅØ)"[4] In addition, when using exaggerated numerical expressions, it is typical to use expressions such as 10 billion times or 10 billion% by adding 10 billion , and expressions such as 1mm and reasonable are also frequently used. When thinking deeply about something or doing complex mental calculations, raise only your index and middle fingers and hold them in front of your face.[5]

Taiju Oki has been friends with Senku since childhood, and although it is not yet clearly known, it seems that their friendship developed after Taiju discovered his scientific experiment equipment and later protected Senku from those who tried to destroy his experiments. Taiju and Senku both have deep trust in each other.[6] In episode 1, he was suspected of being gay with Taiju due to the line, "We're going to be the Adam and Eve of Stone World," but he later denied it, saying what fun it would be to live with two men. Just a metaphor. Afterwards, whenever the guys tried to create an atmosphere of trust and friendship among themselves, they made a rotten expression and tackled him.

Although he is often mentioned in the work as being weak, he builds a fairly sturdy wooden house on his own, and can even make straight pottery and stone axes, which shows that he is secretly strong and dexterous. However, since there are so many monster-level creatures around him, he is not highlighted in comparison.[7] However, on the cover, he is depicted as muscular, with his serratus anterior and abdominal muscles highlighted. In a harsh environment without a single person, it would be difficult for a person who is unusually weak for a modern person to survive in the first place, so Senku can be seen as having at least the minimum physical strength to create and build something on his own.

It seems like he doesn't have any special feelings for the opposite sex. He doesn't seem to have any intention of putting his personal feelings before his grand goal of reviving all of humanity and civilization, and judging from his reactions to Kohaku and other women of the new race, it appears that he has no interest in love itself. However, it is far from being insensitive to such emotions or being immature and acting like a master. This is the scene where Taiju confesses at the beginning of the play, when all the other students are laughing and saying things like "100 yen for a difference," and only he says "10,000 yen for a difference, surprisingly," or the scene where he catches the emotional line flowing through Chrome and Ruri, knowingly or unknowingly. It appears in scenes of consideration, etc.

He is very sensitive to lacquer , and even the slightest touch swells up like Anpanman.

The fire and human hymns are also one of the features that are emphasized again and again. Unlike Taiju, who is ignorant enough to sincerely say to Tsukasa, who threatens to harm Yuzuriha, that he would rather hit himself, an offer that is completely unacceptable, the entire human race has been petrified all at once, and only a few have awakened after thousands of years. this[8] How precarious the situation is, how dangerous and difficult it is to resurrect all of humanity in that situation.[9][10] , Clearly aware of how easy and efficient it is to resurrect and weed out only the few that can be controlled and utilized, dismiss the option of killing opponents without even thinking about it for a moment, and somehow burn them down even if they face a cold and dangerous reality many times. After resolving the problem, logically asserting the value of the opponent, respecting it, and showing how to make it an ally and use it.
2.1. appearance
Among the Dr. Stone characters, he has a very unique appearance, and because of his hair sticking up stiffly and his color changing from dark green to light green to white, he was teased in both Korea and Japan as green-hair, cabbage-hair, and radish-hair. His eyes are sharp red , and his eyebrows are a different color from his hair. Before he was petrified, he only had one antenna, but after he woke up from his petrification, he had two.

In the early to mid-aughts, he had the appearance of a high school boy of that age, but towards the latter half, the artist's deformation became more severe, making him look like you could believe he was an elementary school student.[11]

He is a rare official handsome man among the main characters of Jump, and because of his strong hairstyle,[12] It's covered up, but he looks handsome with his hair down.

She is wearing a light beige one-piece dress with E = mc¬≤ written in her own blood. This is the opportunity for Senku to find a way to break the petrification, and it is Senku's identity itself that the foundations of science are unshakable.[13][14]
2.2. Mecha Senku
File:Mekasenku
Dr. Stone is a learning cartoon mascot-like character that often appears in this book to help readers understand because it contains a lot of science-related elements. In the original, only the face appeared and was limited to explanations, but in the animation, without animation correction, a voice appears and moves dynamically. He says his blood type is Oil (...), and since Senku did not officially create it, he is not born yet.
3. course of action
3.1. Prologue
He first appears in episode 1, entering the laboratory and angrily responding to his friend Taiju's call to confess to Yuzuriha. From the beginning, she was shown using complex scientific instruments. At first, she said she would support Tai Ju, but when Tai Ju thanked her, she said, "You're so loud, I'm not rooting for even a millimeter. You big bastard. How unreasonable it is to not say anything for five years in the first place." He says and gives Taiju her charm potion. However, Taiju poured out the medicine and went out, saying that she would confess honestly. In fact, this magic medicine is 10 billion% dangerous to the body if you drink it with gasoline made from a bottle cap, but I knew from the beginning that Taiju wouldn't drink it, and when other kids were betting that Taiju would be kicked, surprisingly, Taiju wasn't kicked. From the beginning, he showed his faith in Taiju in many ways, such as betting 10,000 yen on it. However, suddenly, with a flash of green light, all of humanity on Earth was petrified.

When Taiju woke up from petrification, he appeared half a year ago in a state of being released from petrification. Yuzuriha was waiting for Taiju, leaving a mark on the petrified tree that said, "Come down along the river, big man." He knew the exact date of October 5, 5738 AD, but in fact he had been counting seconds for about 3700 years, waiting for the spring to happen. At this time, if you look at the monologue, it seems that you can use your brain in parallel. In addition, he made food and weapons in a fairly decent cabin. After that, he declares that he will share the hard work and brain work with Tai Zhu and rebuild the civilization from zero.

In episode 2, the mushrooms and grasses collected by Taiju were classified as edible and poisonous. It was later revealed that she was collecting nitric acid made from the excrement of bats in the cave, and was trying to find a way to release the petrification by experimenting dozens of times on petrified swallows before humans. Afterwards, wine made from wild grapes brought by Taizhou was again distilled, alcohol was extracted, mixed with nitric acid to make nitric acid, and after over a hundred efforts over a year, he finally succeeded in making a liquid for revitalizing petrification . .

However, in episode 3, the person said that the already shattered stone statue does not come back. It was said that when it was sprayed on a broken stone statue, it only became a corpse in pieces.(...)[15] After that, she tried to resurrect Yuzuriha, but Taiju was dumbfounded when Yuzuriha said that Yuzuriha was naked and wanted to resurrect Yuzuriha in her clothes. Then, after being chased by lions that suddenly appeared, Taiju first revived 'Shishio Tsukasa', who was said to be the strongest high school student among the primates. She killed the lion and got the meat[16] She grinds shellfish into powder on the beach and obtains calcium carbonate to make agricultural fertilizer, mortar, and soap.[17] Later, she hears about Tsukasa's past.[18] When Tsukasa asks if he will even revive an adult whose heart is stained, Senku replies that he only likes science and is not interested in Tsukasa's utopia, and will revive all mankind.

Later in the monologue, Tsukasa also tried to resurrect the child, so since he possesses the recipe for the petrifaction resurrection fluid, he thinks that there will be a compromise, but the existence of the resurrection fluid was discovered by Taiju, who appeared immediately shouting that miraculous water had been gathered. .(...)

After that, while preparing to wake up Yuzuriha, she says that the nitric acid is still a bit low, and Tsukasa asks for the location because she will bring it herself. As Tsukasa heads to the cave, Senku immediately prepares the resurrection fluid. In fact, the lack of nitric acid was a fake, and it was a strategy to drop Tsukasa.[19] After reviving Yuzuriha, while choosing whether to fight or run away from Tsukasa, she confronts Tsukasa, who has returned. As soon as Taiju rushed in, he had no choice but to fire the crossbow he had prepared in advance, but Tsukasa easily blocked both Taiju and the arrow. Afterwards, when Tsukasa leaves and tells him not to disturb him, Senku uses a gun, or gunpowder he has made (though a little crude) to make a sextant, and heads for Hakone, where there are hot springs.[20] Then, in the process of making and compacting gunpowder, the gunpowder made by Taiju was finally compacted with a huge stone and exploded.[21] After that, if there is gunpowder, the young people say that they can negotiate with Tsukasa, who is trying to revive them, or if they can't, they may have to kill them. However, someone who saw the explosion nearby discovered that a beacon had lit up and confirmed that there were people other than themselves in the Stone World. They also risk being caught by Tsukasa and try to light a beacon to inform them, but they take Yuzuriha hostage and tell Tsukasa, who appears, the recipe for the petrifaction revitalization liquid, which is his remaining initiative. Tsukasa, who told him to throw away science, answered that it was impossible. In the end, he told me to kill him in one blow and collapsed and didn't retire...

In fact, Tsukasa used the fact that Chin Senku had petrified remains on the back of his neck, and if he sprayed resurrection liquid, a small crack would be restored, so he was alive.[22]

After that, Tsukasa, who thinks he is dead, recruits Taiju and Yuzuriha as spies and tells Yuzuriha about a strategy to defeat the Tsukasa Empire, which he built with the water of resurrection, as a science kingdom built with his own science. After that, she bids farewell to Taiju and Yuzuriha, and head to the location where she lit the beacon.
3.2. Chapter 1. Stone World The Beginning
While fighting Tsukasa, he finds Kohaku crushed by a tree. Use the pulley to rescue Kohaku. After that, he heads to Kohaku's village to cooperate with Kohaku for the manpower needed for the science kingdom.[23]

After that, he is threatened by the gatekeepers, Kinro and the Kinro brothers, and embarrasses them both with soap bubbles made earlier. Then, a spark reaction called the Rainbow Bridge shown by Chrome, who claims to be a genius magician, appeared. As a matter of course, the electrostatic magic using the sulfur sphere was seen through , and Chrome bet on arithmetic, but of course he won by landslide.[24] Get your hands on Chrom, as well as Chrom's base and the materials that Chrom has collected in it. Afterwards, he tells Chrome the truth and draws up a roadmap for the production of 'sulfa drugs' to cure Ruri who is suffering from illness.[25] However, as I explained this and that to explain the ingredients, it was only in the middle of the night that I finally came to the point of saying that the earth is rotating.

However, while explaining, it is learned that the earth's axis has been twisted for 3700 years,[26] Using the magnets that Chrome has collected,[27] , To collect iron , which is the first step of the roadmap , I met Suika while collecting iron sand by the riverside, and when I saw Suika floating on the water, Chrome mentioned Momotaro .[28] I also got information that Ruri told me many stories.

When Gen's power is lost, he tries to poke his gap, but it fails because the opponent is a mentalist. Still, it was confirmed that Gen had the heart to enter the science kingdom.

He declares to Gen that he will build a power plant, but lightning strikes at the timing when he is not ready, and he hurries to prepare magnets and heads for Bald Mountain. Sacrifice Kinro's spear to complete a magnet, and succeed in making a power plant with copper plate and copper wire. Succeeds in lighting the night with a bamboo charcoal filament.

While protecting Gen from being beaten by Magma, when Gen asked if he could make Coke , "I can make it, if it's me." answer. He recruits Gen as a full-fledged ally.

In addition, in order to make glass containers that can withstand chemicals and to make glasses for Suika's nearsightedness , he collects silica sand from the place where Chrome found granite , and uses calcium carbonate, burnt seaweed, and lead to make lenses out of glass to solve Suika's myopia. .

However, the glass container was blocked by the too high wall of difficulty in craftsmanship, but he stimulated the craftsmanship of Kaseki brought by Chrome to help make the flask, and even obtained a laboratory .[29]

After that, in order to collect sulfuric acid, which is the biggest difficulty in making sulfur drugs , Ginro is given a silver spear and used as a radar. However, because of the topography, there is no choice but to make a gas mask, and failure = death, so he decides to leave alone and tries to pass on his knowledge to Chrome, but after hearing Chrome say that friends should entrust their lives to each other rather than protecting them, they tag along. Going out to collect sulfuric acid. When he left the sulfuric acid collection with a gas mask using activated carbon mixed with bamboo charcoal powder and potassium carbonate, his face was calm, but his hands were shaking with cold sweat. However, thanks to Chrome who came along and Ginro who ran late, he manages to succeed in collecting sulfuric acid without anyone's sacrifice.

Using the gathered ingredients, hydrochloric acid is a bit dangerous. Blinding if splashed in the eyes , chlorosulfuric acid is a very dangerous drug. If it touches your skin, you'll turn into a soggy zombie . Sodium Hydroxide Ultra is a dangerous medicine! Yakuza use it to dissolve corpses! , and ammonia , that is, in a situation where most of the ingredients are gathered with urine (...) , and in a situation where only alcohol is obtained, alcohol comes in when you win a game with the village chief. After that, I made a power-up drink using honey and calamus for doping Kinro. However, knowing that Ginro would get stronger if he ate raw, he ate all of the drink's ingredient, the red iris.

I participated to increase the win rate, but won bye against Kohaku in the first game.[30] In the battle against Magma, Chrome's second match, he teamed up with the returning Gen to stimulate Magma's psychology and lead Chrome to victory.

And in the second match, he fights Ginro, but with the support of Chrome, he strikes Ginro's onslaught aiming for the village chief's position. As soon as you win , save the village from Ginro's hands .

In the end, only the final against Chrome remained... but Chrome, exhausted from fighting Magma, fainted and won by default. He obtains the position of the village chief and Ruri's husband... And immediately, with an evil expression, he asks to bring alcohol and fermented vinegar , and after obtaining the last ingredients, Ruri's condition worsens, but they say that there is a marriage ceremony, so Speed He immediately declared a divorce in order to raise the bar and ran away to make sulfa drugs ...

Anyway, after a complicated process, I finally succeeded in making a sulfa drug and made the coke I promised with Gen. After analyzing the corpses of rats lying around , they thought that it would be impossible to treat tuberculosis , but as a result of feeding and examining sulfa drugs, Ruri's disease was pneumonia , and it was a disease that could be treated with sulfa drugs. After that, he is recognized as the new village chief by the previous village chief...
This article contains spoilers .

It directly or indirectly contains the plot, ending, and reversal elements of the work or character described in this document.

At this time, the name of the revealed village is 'Ishigami Village' and Senku's full name is also revealed to be Ishigami Senku .

Senku's adoptive father, Byakuya Ishigami, was able to avoid petrification because he had been out into space with five of his colleagues in the past. The village he created on an uninhabited island with his colleagues to create a foundation for the future was the beginning of the current 'Ishigami Village'.[31] In addition, from basic knowledge for villagers to information to be left to Senku, it was made to be passed down from generation to generation as "Hyakumonogatari" to the person in charge of the priestess position. Upon hearing the story, Senku sheds tears at his father's tombstone, which Ruri brought him, and takes everything his father gave him over thousands of years.

After that, he hears from Gen that Tsukasa and his gang are coming to Ishigami Village. Right after that, when Hyoga of fighting power equal to Tsukasa's, if not Tsukasa's, attacked, he fired a threatening cannon using gunpowder,[32] After bluffing that he made a gun, he succeeds in driving it out.

The next day, he makes glasses for Kinro and a new mask for Suika whose watermelon mask was broken, and asks Kaseki to make a Japanese sword.

And, Hyo, who was wary of the matchlock and attacked on a stormy day, acted as bait in front of the party, overwhelming the enemy with Japanese swords at the timing when the enemy came to the bridge.[33] However, they didn't realize that it was a diversionary operation to set fire to Homura from the other side.

Afterwards, when Suika volunteers to take the bait and heads for the sulfuric acid lake, Kohaku and Kohaku use a gas mask to protect Suika, and at the same time block Hyoga's movements with bluffing. After that, he declares that he will strike the Tsukasa Empire first by creating a communication technology, the telephone .

At first, he makes a cotton candy machine to make gold wires , and he distributes the cotton candy he made as a test to the residents and Homura. Even if it wasn't Homura, as long as he was a supervisor, if the story of cotton candy reached the Tsukasa Empire, someone in the empire might turn to his ally.

However, due to the structure, there is a part that stops, so the sugar clumps and uses Kohaku's shield to make a gear . And, with the waterwheel made by Chrome and Kaseki, they finally got their hands on a hydroelectric power plant, and they also manufacture batteries , automatic bellows using pistons , and light bulbs .

While making vacuum tubes , I suffered because there was no filament that could withstand the heat properly.[34] She marvels at Suika, who has brought a blue stone to Chrome. Right away, tungsten is the element with the highest thermal resistance .[35]

After that, they go on a cave exploration with chromium and magma to collect various elements including tungsten . He falls into a hole made of mica , but succeeds in escaping by pouring water into the hole based on Chrome's idea . , and succeeded in obtaining various elements such as zinc.

Upon returning to the village, he is suddenly bound by magma and taken somewhere. She thought that she would sacrifice her head to Tsukasa, but in fact, on that day, Senku's birthday, January 4, the villagers were making a telescope based on Gen's idea and the knowledge they learned from Senku. However, Senku, who is a rationalist from the beginning, was only grateful for being practical during the battle with Tsukasa. (...)[36] Afterwards, he succeeds in making a tungsten filament.

Afterwards, in the process of making formalin to make plastic and making coal residue, he makes a stove for the elderly and children who are making gold wires, and asks Gen for 800 manganese batteries .[37] (...)

Still, at the end of that journey , he succeeds in making a phone! Of course I had to make another one...

Still, it was possible to make a call by stretching the wire as long as there was a speaker. While celebrating the success of the test, Ruri questioned the word speaker.

Ruri hears an absurd story about Hyakumonogatari's 14th story, a bee named Speaker that stings a tombstone and makes the voice of the dead. Just as the numbers 1 and 4 are Senku's birthday, Ansenku thinks they have meaning. He breaks his father's tombstone and takes out a glass disc, which is actually a record . It contained a message left by Byakuya. By playing the record with a bone needle and listening to the greetings left by his father, he hears the song of Lillian, who rode the spaceship with Byakuya, which is the main topic. succeded. 3.3. Chapter 2. Stone Wars
And Kaseki Suikawa suggested a way to impress the people of the Tsukasa Empire with this song, but Gen said that Lillian's song was too famous for modern people and that it was impossible because the phone's sound quality was poor... People who first encountered Eyeshield 21 say that Hiruma Yoichi comes to mind when they see Hundred in a Hundred Senku. She is much more outspoken and sociable than Hiruma.
Considering that he only did scientific research indoors, his physical strength is very poor, and even though he was a former gymnast, he was unable to subdue Homura, a girl his age, and lost.[42] When Zeno interrogates him about who the leader of the Science Kingdom is, Gen is scared, saying that Senku's physique is like a water flea and that he'll definitely die if he tells the truth. On the surface, Tsukasa's intention to destroy adults and suppress the reconstruction of scientific civilization seems understandable, but if you dig deeper, you can't help but think that Tsukasa's actions are very contradictory and improbable.
Although his actions are greatly embellished and corrected in the production, it may not seem like it, if you pay attention to Tsukasa's appearance and departure in this manga, he is just a pathetic thought criminal who insists on his own beliefs that do not fit the current situation and are difficult for ordinary people to accept. But by collecting all those stones, you've managed to complete a 3D puzzle without even knowing what the finished product will look like.[5]
She has excellent sewing skills that allow her to create fashionable clothing in the Stone World and easily suppress the new humans accustomed to the primitive environment.[6] The reassembly mentioned earlier was also something that was originally supposed to take all night, but was done in the spare time after that. The speed of sewing is incredible, and it is described as Mudamuda, with multiple hands . Even after the Tsugasa Empire was annexed, he was in charge of sewing, and was listed as a sailor on the list of sailors during a voyage.
He is one of the main characters in charge of the dexterity of the Science Kingdom along with Kaseki. Compared to Kaseki, who specializes in the development of craft technologies in materials engineering and mechanical engineering, he is talented in tasks such as gluing together broken petrified pieces from scratch or quickly and tenaciously completing tedious tasks such as sewing.[7] Later, when developing electronic circuits and circuits, he unexpectedly demonstrated his abilities. This is because primitive circuits and computers were tedious work that required weaving wires and other parts one by one like cloth .[8]

8.content:
Ruri (Luri)
I'll confess. I've known you since time immemorial. Your name is ‚óã‚óã‚óã‚óã Senku .
voice actorFile:South Korea... Deokhee Choi /File:Japanese fl... Reina Ueda /File:american fl... Christine Maguire .
The daughter of the village chief of Ishigami, a shrine maiden of the new human group, and Kohaku 's twin sister. She is in charge of continuing 100 stories containing various knowledge called Hyakumonogatari (Ë™ûÁôæÁâ©Ë™û) about shrine maidens like Ruri.[9] She is suffering from a mysterious illness, which prevents her from coming out. She somehow possesses knowledge of the old world, such as telling the story of Momotaro to the village residents and knowing the existence of gorillas that do not live in Japan .[10] When she heard Senku's name, she appeared in pain and asked what Senku's last name was. As described above, there is no culture of using surnames in this village, and the residents do not even know the concept of what a surname is. Senku is also interested in her because she is such a big deal , and he tries to make a medicine that will cure Ruri's illness.
Unlike Kohaku, he has a polite character , is quite soft-hearted, doesn't get angry easily, and has a very sensitive personality. She was a childhood friend of Chrome and hung out with him since she was young.
From generation to generation, the village shrine maiden is required to marry the winner of the lord's match to become the next village chief, but as it happened, Senku won the lord's match and married Senku. As soon as she got the drink, she immediately pretended to wish Chrome and Ruri well and went to a wedding celebration banquet. Senku, who did not want to get caught up and waste time making sulfa drugs, declared divorce, making her the first shrine maiden among the new humans to divorce .
As revealed in episode 41, Ruri's illness was pneumonia . Fortunately, it was a disease that could be cured with the sulfa drug developed by Senku, so she recovered safely.
Because of her illness, she had no choice but to remain quiet for a while, but physically, she actually liked to be as active as Kohaku, so as soon as she recovered, she started running around. Furthermore, as expected of Kohaku's older sister who is called a gorilla, in episode 141, she pushed Minami, who had feelings for Tsukasa but was hesitant because she was afraid of interfering with her younger brother, in front of Tsukasa, and later, when they reunite, she shows off her incredible strength by lifting Kohaku with both hands(!).
Before becoming an ally with Tsukasa and immediately after recovering from his illness, he shows determination by not worrying about himself and instead letting Jasper and Turquoise evacuate the people during Hyoga and Homura's attack.
After the final battle with Tsukasa, he communicates with his comrades who set sail on the Perseus, exchanges information, and acts as a sort of radio beacon, protecting Ishigami Village together with the townspeople.
The origin of the name is lapis lazuli.

9.content:
Suika also wants to be helpful to everyone!
voice actorFile:South Korea... rose /File:Japanese fl... Karin Takahashi /File:american fl... Sarah Wiedenheft .
New humanity. A young girl.[11] She is 119cm tall and weighs 21kg. She uses the '-ya („Å† „Çà)' tone of voice. Her Suika means watermelon , and as her name suggests, she wears a watermelon rind.[12] She says it's because she doesn't want to show her face, but in episode 28, it is revealed that she is extremely myopic . The reason she wears a watermelon rind is to focus her attention on her hole. Moreover, when she tried to narrow her eyes to force herself to see, her face became so frowned that it went beyond the point where her eyes were frowning, which was embarrassing because it was such a bad facial expression. Her bare face is that of a beautiful girl with blonde bob cut hair .[13] Fortunately, her vision was blurry due to her nearsightedness, so Senku made her glass and cut her lenses so that they fit perfectly into the holes in her watermelon peel, making her a kind of glasses . Her fellow villager Chrome says that the name Suika "is probably just a nickname", but since she refers to herself as "Suika" in the third person, it is likely her real name.
It has the amazing ability to hide inside the watermelon rind and disguise itself as an ordinary watermelon. He makes great use of this ability and is very quick-witted. I wonder if they said that this little guy would be much more helpful than Ginro. Of course she has a childlike and innocent side to her.
When Senku built a sailboat and set sail, he sneaked in. When everyone on her ship was petrified, only this one was saved by Ginro and Sui Ryu, who fled and was not petrified. As a reward for playing an active part in Treasure Island, he officially joined the personnel leaving for the United States, and when he arrived at the center of the Amazon, he played an important role that would be the key to the operation.
And in episode 194, it was confirmed that he was the first of those who had been petrified by the petrification ray in the previous episode to wake up. For a short while, he essentially took over the main character position. After being revived, he thought there was no hope or dreams since everyone else was petrified except for himself , but he ended up finding a way to make the resurrection liquid that Senku had left behind, and he ended up making the resurrection liquid again from scratch.
Thanks to learning to read, she was able to read Senku's recipe for resurrection fluid, but she had a hard time because she didn't know the scientific techniques or skills. There were many other methods, but the easiest one was using poop , which required an aging process and took a year. However, she used the various knowledge the Senkus had left behind to find phosphorite , which is bird poop, and even in the midst of all that, she didn't give up and kept trying, and after many attempts , she succeeded in reviving Senku by spraying the resurrection fluid on him . This was the result of spending a whopping 7 years alone and growing up. # As time passed and she grew , Suika is already around the same age as Senku and his friends .[14] Afterwards, with the help of Senku, who knows the recipe, he makes a resurrection liquid indiscriminately and has a tearful reunion with his comrades.[15]
Based on this experience, his scientific knowledge and capabilities greatly increased, and he became the second scientist of the new human race following Chrome.
He always says that he wants to be helpful to everyone, even if he is weak, but in reality, he is an amazing child with SSR values ‚Äã‚Äãwho always does things that are 10 billion% helpful. He was exposed to science at a young age and became interested in it. As he directly participated in the field and learned scientific techniques, his scientific knowledge increased significantly and he was equipped with the qualities of a scientist, so he can be said to be a gifted child.

10.content:
choke
The Korean voice actor is Kim Soo-young, the same as Kohaku .
Suika's pet dog. It is said that he likes dog grass. Judging from the way he has changed as he has grown, his breed seems to be a Shiba. The origin of his name is chalk . He works together with Suika and is often useful when there is a need to track someone down by scent.
Later, when Senku and his party in Con City were on the defensive during the final battle with Stanley Snyder on Senku's side and activated the petrification device, the villagers were also petrified. To prevent the villagers from being damaged or eroded, Suika and the wild boar Sagara gathered stones and built a stone wall. It took 7 years for Suika to unpetrify Senku and his party, and it took Senku and his party again when they returned to unpetrify the villagers. Over the years, the stones were piled up to protect the villagers from erosion, weathering, and unexpected collisions with surrounding objects. After Senku and his party returned and unpetrified the villagers, Choke, Sagara, Senku and his party, and the villagers were all reunited. In the meantime, Choke and Sagara had given birth to a baby and were raising it.

1.content: A plane also known as the Material Plane. It is comprised of two continents, Slorai and Blikuan. Both continents are filled with fantasy monsters such as elves, demons, humans, dwarves, goblins, etc‚Ä¶ but are mostly ruled by dragons.

2.content: The continent of the ‚Äògood‚Äô kingdoms. In the east of the continent is the Great Old Kingdom. To the west of the Great Old Kingdom is the Wilderness Kingdom. To the South of the Great Old Kingdom is the Grand Kingdom of Gold. To the South of the continent is the island that makes up the Volcano Kingdom. Under the seas off the shore of the Great Old Kingdom is the Ocean Kingdom. High in the sky above the continent, on the mountain range that divides the continent, is the Sky Kingdom.

3.content: The continent of the ‚Äòevil‚Äô kingdoms. To the North is the Blizzard Kingdom. To the South is the Dry Kingdom. To the East is the Reaper Empire. To the West is the Mud Mingdom. On a floating island off the coast of the Reaper Empire is the Magistra Kingdom.

4.content: A kingdom made up of golden plains and rolling hills. It is the oldest kingdom on the continent and is ruled by King Kubera Shinewing. It is populated by gold, bronze, and copper dragons along with dracolisks, dracons, dread linnorms, and plains landwyrms.

5.content: A kingdom made up of lush golden fields and beautiful scenery. It is the youngest, but also the wealthiest, kingdom on the continent. It is populated by gold and steel dragons along with dracolisks, dracons, dread linnorms, and plains landwyrms. It is ruled by Queen Rukmini Shinewing.

6.content: A kingdom made up of lush forests. Populated by green, amber, orange, and cobalt dragons along with forest landwyrms. It is ruled by King Oshosi Vinetangle.

7.content: An island kingdom made up of both active and inactive volcanoes as well as mountains. Populated by red, amethyst, crystal, fang, iron, obsidian, pink, beljuril, emerald, and mercury dragons along with dracohydras, dracolisks, dracosphinxes, dread linnorms,  magma drakes, and mountain landwyrms. It is ruled by King Elio Flashfire.

8.content: An underwater kingdom that is entirely submerged. It is populated by sea dragons along with dragon turtles, dragonfish, dragon eels, leviathans, merfolk, sea serpents, and water drakes. It is ruled by King Aegir Wavebeast.

9.content: A kingdom high in the sky on a mountain range. Populated by dragons that can fly up there, mainly black, amethyst, crystal, fang, iron, obsidian, and pink dragons. It is the only kingdom that is entirely comprised of true dragons. It is ruled by Queen Morana Thunderpeak.

10.content: The King of the Great Old Kingdom. He‚Äôs regarded as wise beyond his years, but in actuality he is much more than that: he is refined, sweet, kind, sociable, loyal, and short-tempered. He has an adopted son named Dairrus. Queen Rukmini is his twin sister.

1.content:
Neptune is the goofy Goddess of the Landmass called Planeptune, Neptune is a Perky and mischievous yet slacky, idiot, and irresponsible CPU that protect her land with her little sister, also know as "Nepgear", and her counselor fairy called "Histore", who ironically acts like a mother to Neptune giving punishments and always reminding Neptune to work for Planeptune to earn Shares. Neptune in her human form, usually uses katanas as weapon, and in he HDD form she uses a big mechanical sword.

1 ("Neptune Appearance")= {{In her Parka Dress, Neptune has short lilac hair with bangs that reach down to her collar bone and purple eyes. In her hair she wears white hair-clips in the shape of D-pads and around her neck is a choker that has a light blue D-pad symbol on it. She wears a mostly white hoodie dress that has a light purple hood, strings that look like controller plugs, and two huge purple and white pockets with purple D-Pad symbols on them. The sleeves have two light blue stripes going all the way down while the front of the hoodie only contains one. The ends of the sleeves and the bottom of the hoodie have dark and light purple stripes. The zipper emblem and the back of the hoodie has a purple letter "N" to represent the first symbol of her name. She wears light blue and white striped thigh high socks with frills at the tops and her shoes are purple and blue.

In her Purple Core, Purple Heart has long purple hair in twin tails that almost reaches her feet and bright blue eyes with white pupils in the shape of power signs. She wears black hair clips with glowing blue D-Pad shapes on them, and a black body suit that exposes her chest somewhat. Both of the bodysuit's shoulder areas contain a white outlined D-pad symbol and the arm areas contain purple along the sides while the front of the bodysuit also contains purple areas near the bottom. On the breast areas you can see a single purple strip. Purple Heart's leg-wear seems as though it is the same as her human forms only it appears as black boots with purple tips instead.

Purple Heart's evolved form. Due to the arms equipped to the back, arms and legs unit, the high specs of the Goddess Form are further improved. The power possessed is said to have been surely obtained by a miracle.}}

2¬∫ ("Neptune Personality")= {{Neptune is a happy, excitable girl with a very strong sense of justice. Her ditzy personality causes her to be very careless at times which can either help her or land her into serious trouble. She makes friends rather easily due to her friendly nature and often gives them cute nicknames. People admire her optimistic outlook and confidence. She never gives up or backs down when the going gets tough and she makes sure to see her objective through to the very end.

When Neptune is in Purple Heart form (the goddess form of Neptune). She is considered to be cool, collected, just, and overall much more mature in comparison to her human form. While the personality and appearance change is major between the two forms, she still retains some aspects of her human form albeit to a lesser extent.

Purple Heart is a serious and mature person. She's often calm and rarely changes facial expressions. She is a very observant and intelligent female, thinking in a rational matter most of the time. She is the complete opposite of her human form in many aspects but her strong sense of justice and confidence remains unchanged. It can be said that Purple Heart is a bit arrogant, having a strong confidence in her abilities and believing that no one can defeat her. Despite her change in personality, there are times that where Purple Heart acts like her human form, evident when Neptune turns into Purple Heart just to ride a roller coaster.

As Purple Heart, Neptune turns very serious and no more joking around and friendly disposition at first. Showing a more confident, mature, prideful self instead. Unlike most, her voice noticeably deepens significantly.

Despite this, however, and due to her over-confidence, they teamed up against her and took her down with ease, acknowledging that she was the biggest threat out of the four of them. While she is much more calm and observant, Purple Heart happens to be full of herself at first and gloats how the others couldn't beat her even if all three tried at once. It was her pride and gloating that made her the victim of their termination. Over the course of the game, due to her memory loss, she lessens up on this harsh behavior.

Like her normal self, Purple Heart still has a bit of air-headed tendencies. Though, it is a far less prevalent trait of her personality when compared to her human self. Also, Purple Heart has traits as a normal teenage girl. For example, when a spider suddenly comes out, she becomes very frightened and screams. And during a confession, she claims she's like a normal girl because she falls in love easily if she is treated by kindness and how they (the person she likes) have been always by her side. A scene with Steamax also caused her to shriek like one upon seeing a erotic scenes that he had cut up.

Neptune is the human form of the CPU Purple Heart. She is often considered to be energetic and dorky. Her favorite food is custard pudding and she loves playing video games. Eggplants are her most hated food, stating that they are not "people food". While she enjoys playing all games, she especially loves Retro video games.

Netune happens to really love food. Often in the middle of a snack or thinking about food, She can be seen eating every so often. She often receives comments from both friend and foe about her 'pudgy' physique.

Neptune is easily surprised and has shown klutzy tendencies. She usually shows an eager and perky behavior and is very affectionate to generally anyone, to the point of giving them cute nicknames or refusing to give them their personal space. She even does things such as tickling girls, hugging them, or even touching their breasts. Noire is her common target.}}

4.content:
Nepgear, also known as Purple Sister is the CPU Candidate of Planeptune and Purple Heart's (Neptune) younger sister. Nepgear has no age because goddesses (CPU's) don't age, but she keeps being younger than Neptune. Nepgear uses a sword in human form. In her HDD form, she uses a gun blade. In stark contrast to her elder sibling, she is very diligent and organized, and there is no real difference in personality between her human and goddess form.

1¬∫ ("Nepgear Appearance")= {{Nepgear's appearance is similar to Neptune's. She has long light purple hair with a single D-pad hair clip and violet eyes and wears a white, button up sailor uniform with purple designs and a yellow ribbon being held together by the N-emblem. Nepgear wears thigh high socks with pink and white stripes and medium-sized boots that match her uniform in color scheme. in Goddess form Nepgear's hair becomes longer and pink with a different hair clip that is white and blue to replace the D-pad hair clip. Her eyes become dodger blue in color and wears a white skintight bodysuit with light purple designs and light purple N's on the backhand part of her gloves along with matching thigh high boots.}}

2¬∫ ("Nepgear Personality")= {{Nepgear is the CPU Candidate of Planeptune and Purple Heart's younger sister. In stark contrast to her elder sibling, she is very diligent and organized and there is no real difference in personality between her human and goddess form. Nepgear is a very genuine and kind girl, but she sometimes lacks the self-confidence she needs to do what has to be done. This trait of hers often leaves her to be pushed around or constantly having to be encouraged by her party members. In contrast to Neptune's hyper active and energetic behavior, Nepgear is a very shy girl who will over-apologize for even the tiniest of things. She also takes her responsibilities as a CPU Candidate quite seriously; this is another trait that tends to separate her from her sister's more lackadaisical approach towards her job. She's somewhat timid when it comes to things and people but friendly otherwise. Once she has made a friend, no matter what they think of her later she will hold them closely. For example, when Uni angrily left her once, Nepgear still felt empathy for her and procceeded to keep her opinion of Uni positive. When Nepgear in Goddess form she is practically the same, though she becomes a bit more confident in her abilities than before. Even in this form, she's still rather easy to push around. Due to that, she is indeed the most consistent among all the other CPUs. Nepgear is a very shy girl who will over-apologize for even the tiniest of things.  She also takes her responsibilities as a CPU Candidate quite seriously, She's somewhat timid when it comes to things and people but friendly otherwise. Who addresses her as "Nep-Jr.", while Compa likes to address her as "Gear-Chan" or, "Ge-Ge."

Nepgear has a tendency to go from being confident to scared whenever something bad happens especially her older sister, Neptune. This is likely the trauma caused by her capture and imprisonment at the graveyard with her sisters for three years. Thankfully though, she is quick to snap out of it whenever her friends are in trouble or when they encourage her. Even Neptune seems to realize this at one point and even tells it to Nepgear to help her gain her confidence during their final confrontation with Magic the Hard.

Nepgear is supposedly very popular among the boys as Neptune says how Nepgear was always turning down boys for sex. Her obsession with machines causes her to behave erratically when it comes to this hobby, to the point that even her sister questions her sanity.}}
