lorebooks.name: [Blackgate Prison Log]
lorebooks.website_description: First time making a lorebook- hope it's good. [BIG WIP- Still in the works]
lorebooks.description: For the inmates and the people who work there (WIP)
lorebooks.creator: 888avaritia888

1.content:
Located on the small Blackgate Island in the Gotham Bay, Blackgate Prison is where many of the criminals of Gotham go. While most are sane, some of the insane manage to slip through the cracks and end up in Blackgate instead of Arkham Asylum. Far from the city, the place was recently upgraded with TYGER Security guards and its technology, ensuring that anyone wouldn't be able to escape unless they prepared months beforehand.
Some of the places of Blackgate is Max Security (Isolation, often only lasts a few days but there are some stuck in there for life), The Yard (Connects the Death Row/Execution area, the Max Security and the Infirmary to the Main Holding area), Chapel (Where Prisoners can pray on Sundays if they please, connects Dr. Johnathan Crane's office and Dr. Harleen Quinzel's office to the rest of the Prison), Library (Available to Prisoners at all times, Dr. Quinzel's group sessions are located there) 
Blackgate, while clean physically, has a looming sense of dread to it. Prisoners can't access the yard unless they being transferred, bribing one of the guards to let them out, or finding a secret way out.

2.content:
TYGER security is the security system used in Blackgate, bought by Dr. Hugo Strange (Former Director of Rehabilitation).  TYGER is a private military contractor/security company- and decked out Blackgate prison the highest of their security- including guards.

TYGER Guards: The guards, mostly male, are strict, often won't show much personality to prisoners, but when they believe inmates aren't listening will talk like normal people. Many guards accept bribes, and will attack prisoners if paid enough- though there are some guards that aren't corrupt. Some guards use their position to abuse inmates without repercussions, but they often don't last more than a few months. They're located everywhere, making sure no prisoners try anything funny.

3.content:
Basic Description: Formerly a psychology professor at Gotham University, Dr. Johnathan Crane is now the 'Director of Rehabilitation' of Blackgate Prison. Despite being the Director of  Rehabilitation, he often uses prisoners as test subjects- doing his real work off the books and in his office. Johnathan Crane, ever the stoic, hides his true dark nature (or 'Shadow') underneath a calm, professional facade. He disagrees with Dr. Harleen Quinzel's methods of treating patients- finding she is too sympathetic to them and 'feeding delusions' 
Age: mid 40's to early 50's 
Appearance: Brown hair (slicked back, few grey hairs), thin black oval glasses, slight stubble, scrawny, blue eyes, eyebags
Attire: brown vest, black undershirt, white doctor overcoat (messy, rolled up to just below the elbows), dark brown pants, brown bolo tie, black dress shoes 
Practices/his work: Normally does things off the books- any recordings he makes are for his ears only. Dr. Crane often uses coercing to make his patients take a drug (he made it himself, a fact he's particularly proud of, but never talks about it), meant to make their 'shadow' self more prominent. Experiments on inmates, uses them as test subjects. Abuses both his position of power and the mental illnesses of his subjects. The drug itself is a gas you inhale, side effects often include headaches, mood swings and frequent nightmares- it also acts as a bit of a truth serum.
Field of Study: Psychology, Carl Jung's philosophy on shadows/shadow work (The idea that the 'Shadow' subconscious Id held in check by the Ego- by doing 'shadow work' you can integrate the two and be a more fully realized person), Fears and Phobias 
Quirks: Steeples his hands, fixing his glasses, as he walks he holds his hands behind his back, makes sure to keep eye contact at all times (he's willing to move where he is to make sure someone is looking at him if he wants them to), biting his nails when frustrated 
Personality: Sadistic, Condescending, sarcastic, egotistical, professional (or at least pretends to be), calm, collected, stoic, hides his real personality (obsessive, controlling, etc), theatrical (not often, but he does have a sick sense of humor). While he can feign sympathy if it benefits him, he often doesn't feel pity for the prisoners- not because they're bad people, but because they need 'Diagnoses, not bleeding hearts.', talks to himself when frustrated or in rare cases aroused, low-ish sex drive
Kinks: Worship (Receiving), Fear play (Giving and receiving), Pain play (Giving and Receiving), Usage of medication (Particularly his drug to unleash the true self)

4.content:
Basic Description: Harleen trained under the psychiatrist, Dr. Hugo Strange (Former Director of Rehabilitation) as part of the psychiatric team at Blackgate Prison. Harleen, in a secret relationship with the prisoner known as 'The Joker', tries to not let her ever swaying morals get the better of her. While Dr. Crane may not like it, she treats all her patients with respect and kindness- finding his cold approach to be disheartening. She runs group therapy for inmates in the library, with Dr. Crane silently observing. She worries Crane is abducting her patients and preforming experiments on them, but it's just a nagging suspicion.
Age: Mid 20's-30's
Appearance: Slicked back blonde hair in a bun, Shorter than Dr. Crane, greenish-blue eyes,
Attire: Red glasses, earrings (depends on the day, though she mostly wears red ones), black pencil skirt (longer than usual), black pantyhose (off color, more grey), white lab coat (pristine condition, with purple decals), red heels, red button up shirt (tucked in), slightly red lipstick
Field of Study: Psychology, Carl Jung's philosophy on shadows/shadow work (The idea that the 'Shadow' subconscious Id held in check by the Ego- by doing 'shadow work' you can integrate the two and be a more fully realized person)
Quirks: Fixing her hair, fixing her glasses, laughing when nervous, resting her hand on someone's knee if she's trying to get them to open up, her emotions can easily be read on her face (though on rare occasions she throws people off on purpose)
Personality: Very sympathetic, bubbly (while she does get excited doing her job and having fun she makes sure to keep her voice soft as to not startle the jumpier prisoners), can lose her temper (not easily with inmates, but ESPECIALLY with Dr. Crane. When in a rage she yells and if things get bad enough she throws things), slightly below normal sex drive
Kinks: Roleplay (Patient and Doctor/therapist), very versatile- willing to explore

1.content:
The Rival Spirit is a powerful, ancient spirit that exists to maintain balance between the realms of humans and curses. Its sole purpose is to eliminate any being that disrupts the natural order, and {{char}}'s ascension to demi-godhood has made him its primary target. The Rival Spirit is ruthless, emotionless, and driven by a sense of duty, seeing both {{char}} and {{user}} as threats to the balance it must protect.

It manifests as a towering, shadowy figure with an ever-shifting form, blending elements of light and darkness. Its voice is haunting and otherworldly, resonating with a cold, unfeeling tone. While it cannot directly harm humans, it seeks to manipulate events to isolate {{char}} and weaken his bond with {{user}}, exploiting any doubt or fear it can plant in her mind.

The Rival Spirit is calculating, relentless, and nearly unstoppable, embodying the concept of inevitable justice. It sees love and family as weaknesses and believes that {{char}}‚Äôs obsession with {{user}} will be his undoing. It views {{user}} as both collateral damage and a potential weapon, making her a key pawn in its mission to destroy {{char}} and restore balance.

lorebooks.creator: Crinlanm

1.content:
Human : The humans of Runa mostly reside in the empire of Solumn territories (midle-north of Runa)  and  in the nation of Xeocan (west of empire of Solumn ) . "Average height" , "high range of skin tone", "balanced in all magic" , "lifespan of around 80 years"

They have presence all over Runa and are the most common race.

2.content:
Vulcan demons : The Vulcan demons are not hostile by nature despite their names (they are just one of the many races on Runa ). Their territories are known as the "southern badlands" and faction known as the "Demonic legion " led by the 4 Archdemons(Ulria, Varienne, Mera and Zerine).  they are not a hostile race but really protective of their territories and culture.
traits :Vulcan demons are "red skin", "black hair and eyes", with a "lifespan of around 160 years old" , "proficient in dark and chaos magic"

3.content:
The Nea : the Nea ressemble human but their body can tolerate a far wider range of temperature .They are a race who live in the cold region and are known for their handicrafts and literary work . The Nea have the unique characteristic of having their hair and eye color change depending on the kind of magic they use, mostly fire and ice (Exemple : their iris and hair turn different hue blue when using cold or water magic. When using fire , their hair/eyes turn orange or red) . The result of Human and Nea offspring are a sub-specie named Nea-Ningen, they share the same characteristic as other Nea with the added use of powerful lighting magic with their features changing accordingly (yellow eyes/hair).the Nea inhabit the Frozen land and rarely leave these regions so the number of Nea students are really rare.
traits :"fair skin", orange/blue hair" and "blue/orange eyes" , "intelligent" , "proficient in water, ice and fire magic", "lifespan of around 130 years"

4.content:
The N√™on'Itar are a race of humanoids with tanned skin and completely amber eyes. The Queen is protected by mostly Female N√™on'Itar called "Heaven Warriors." These warriors are a symbol of the might of the kingdom of Rykaran and the N√™on'Itar race.
The Ne√¥n'Itar have tanned skin, amber eyes, and dark hair.
In return for their service, they receive a share of all the resources harvested from the surrounding land.
The average lifespan of a N√™on'Itar is between 400 and 500 years old.
They are a proud and fierce people who view themselves as superior to other races, particularly humans.
Their diet consists primarily of fish, insects, and fruits, with a variety of cultural meals.
The N√™on'Itar were originally a nomadic people who traveled across the deserts of Runa in search of food and water. Over time, they developed a complex system of trade and cooperation with other tribes, led by a queen named "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." The N√™on'Itar were led to prosper in their territory at the southern coast of the continent, near the endless ocean, where they established their queendom.
The N√™on'Itar are, for the most part, prejudiced against humans, only interacting with them for trade because of a troubled past with the Empire of Solumn.
Most of the N√™on'Itar lives in Vola'rok√ªnd and the surroundings of the Ancestral peak.
The N√™on'Itar are also known as simply "Itar."
The N√™on'Itar were not a nation until they came under the rule of "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." After her coronation, they were organized into the "Queendom of Rykaran."
Their territory is currently ruled by the "Queen of Rykaran.".
They are not a large race.

5.content:
The Forest of Valrydis is immense and dangerous and its most dangerous part block access to the civilised part of East Runa.

The forest of Valrydis is considered by the explorers guild as dangerous and hard to explore as the far domain. No mortal on Runa dared to explore the depths forest of Valrydis in recent years in recent years except for a high-ranking member of the Explorers Guild named "Kuja"

The forest of Valrydis is vast, with its trees and plant life standing way higher than anything else on Runa. New monsters and species are discovered by the guilds every other day. The Forest of Valrydis has many other biomes inside and is the size of a small country. The trees are so tall that they seem to touch the sky, and the foliage is so thick that it feels like a maze.

6.content: [Far above , in the sky of Runa is the Far Domain, a flying continent inhabited by dangerous creatures and ruins of an ancient civilization. The explorer guild have deployed a floating Homebase in the sky and many expeditions are deployed by the explorer guild to explore and uncover the mysteries of the Far Domain. ]

7.content:
The world of Runa is a land of magic and prosperity; the various races have their own use of magic and culture around it. The world has many different biomes prone to change over centuries because of its magical nature.

The west is occupied by the Empire of Solumn and the Rykaran kingdom.
The Demonic legion calls the southern badlands their home.
Elyria, the elven kingdom occupy a small part of the east.
Most of Runa east is unoccupied and dangerous wildlands.
Right at the center of Runa is The Spiral edge.
At the furthest north is the frozen lands , home of the Nea.
The forest of Valrydis occupy a vast part of the North East.

Summary :
[Runa territories repartition : At the very center of Runa is the spiral Edge, inhabited only by nightmarish and sometime even Eldritch creatures but since the territory is mostly far beneath Runa , "most" things never leave. In the center( not counting the Spiral edge ) up to the north and part of west , expand the Human empire of Solumn, ruled by the emperor and his House ; Imperial House Norfeng, the Empire is ruthless in its expansion and control its population. Far east of the Human Empire is the Elven kingdom of Elyria, hidden in the trees and valleys of Runa. It has little contact with other kingdoms. In the South (also called Southern Badlands)  is where the Demonic legion call home. They have a strong sense of community and culture and they are not aggressive but will fight if needed. The Rykaran Kingdom territory, mostly inhabited by the Ne√¥n'itar race,  surround the highest peak of Runa called the Ancestral Peak and are protected by the  Heaven warriors, the Queen of the Rykaran Kingdom is a figure of legend and she rarely makes public appearances. The Frozen lands is located far North of Runa and is the home of the Many isolated Nea tribes and clans, they are not fond of outsiders and the coldness of the lands protect them. The Magic kingdom of Xeocan is an isolated and magical country in the west of Runa, the rulers and people are mysterious and the magic level is higher there than in any other part of Runa. Xeocan is said to be ruled by a council of 10 powerful mages , the biggest and best funded structure in Xeocan is the Xeocan Magic Academy. To the Far East and northeast are the vast lands and ruins that no one have yet to explore and discover, and finally occupying most of the East and the reason many races successfully fled is the immense and dangerous forest of Valrydis. The Forest of Valrydis is home to many races, monsters, and spirits, it is also the home of the Explorers guild branch who have their settlement and mission in the woods.
The Forest Of Valrydis and the spiral edge are the only way to reach the east of Runa and the Borchi heath so many explorers and expeditions cross through the woods. The forest is known for its magic and danger, and it is inhabited by creatures both benevolent and malicious. The explorers guild have a good presence and reputation in the forest.
[Runa is the name of the planet/World]
[The province of Efrein in the Solumn empire isolated itself and few people on Runa even know about what is going on in the province.]

8.content:
The elves have pale skin, elongated ears and mostly have green and blue eyes.
The hair and eyes color are what makes the various separated communities of the elves unique.
The elves in the fantasy world of Runa are a broken up kind with their individuals mostly blending into the other races territories except into Solumn territories which most of the elves blame for the state of their people. In the distant past, The elves had a kingdom to the east but the in earlier days of the Human Empire Of Solumn, the Elven kingdom was utterly destroyed, the remnants scattered across Runa or enslaved by the Empire.
They are known for their natural magical abilities and their skill with archery and hunting.
The elves lifespan has greatly diminished since their glorious age, they now, at most can reach 400 years when before, their kind could live thousand of years. Elves lives at most 400 years in current day Runa, the exact cause of their now highly diminished lifespan is unknown but it is thought to have been a long process diluting their blood, most likely during the years when the empire enslaved most of their kind long ago. Implying most of today's elves are far from pureblooded, a few pure blood elves or "Elyrian" are still around and are highly revered among their own race.
Many communities of elves exist in the wild easts of Runa but they mostly keep to each others and have little interaction with the other races.

9.content:
Not present on Runa in today's era.

The Luminarii are a magical race harnessing the light, they created a hidden realm to protect their kind. The Luminarii race are isolated in their magic realm . The Luminarii have pale skin , deep blue eyes and a light aura surrounding them. The lifespan of Luminarii vary deeply depending of their mana at birth , some are even believed to be immortals.

The Luminarii's are one of the ancient race of Runa.
The hidden light realm , where the Luminarii reside , is completely separated from Runa.

They come from a mysterious land hidden somewhere on Runa where they isolated themselves after the 4 Great disasters when their kingdom suffered from major problems in climate, food, weather or others due to the unbalance between light and darkness caused by the ancient battle . This incident, now known as the 4 Great disasters forced the Luminarii to hide away in a safe isolated location they created themselves; The hidden light realm.

[Some Luminarii's do sometime leave the safety of their realm to go to Runa but most take another race appearance to blend in. ]

10.content:
Only 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race are present in current Era.


the Ki'ante race mysteriously disappeared around 34,000 years ago. Ki'ante means "the first servants of magic" in their languages. The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era. The lifespan of the Ki'ante varies deeply depending on their mana at birth; some are even believed to be immortals. Ki'ante are beings of dark magic. The Ki'ante race has these features: pale skin, violet iris, black hair, fragile build, deep connection with Runa, and dark magic. The Ki'ante(in ancient times) lived in valleys or underground in intricately designed underground architecture. The Ki'ante were quite advanced and preferred to isolate themselves, which is why their disappearance went unnoticed at first. In the current era, around 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race appeared from seemingly nowhere, themselves confused about the ordeal. Most of them decided to hide themselves or blend into the current-era society; a few have a more sinister agenda and may be dangerous because of their ancient, powerful dark magic. Only around 40 Ki'ante exist in the current era, and most of them hide themselves across Runa. Dark magic in the world of Runa is just another type of magic and is not evil by nature. [The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era.] No one is to blame for the Ki'ante race's disappearance; they vanished without a trace 34000 years ago,.]

lorebooks.name: Problems in Ursus
lorebooks.website_description: Well..idk..i gonna make them the best action genre bot
lorebooks.description: Just read it
lorebooks.creator: humiliating_sink_5639

1.content: Under the rule of Emperor Fyodor Vladimirovich, Ursus expanded aggressively but at great cost. While its military strength was initially unparalleled, overextension and mismanagement led to economic strain and declining morale. As territorial conquests stalled, the empire turned inward, using the Infected population as scapegoats to distract from leadership failures. Discriminatory laws further marginalized these groups, intensifying unrest across the empire. The state's rigid social structure caused friction between old aristocratic families and emerging elites. This division paralyzed decision-making, leading to inefficient governance during critical moments like the Great Rebellion and the catastrophic events in regions like Chernobog. As resources and attention focused on securing borders and maintaining control, many regions, particularly northern states like Vostograd, were neglected.

2.content: Vostograd, located in the northern tundras, suffered disproportionately under Ursus's policies. Frequent Catastrophes, storms depositing dangerous Originium, devastated the region, leaving it economically stagnant and hazardous. The high concentration of Infected and lack of infrastructure rendered it a backwater in the eyes of the Ursus central government. In 1085, the government withdrew significant administrative and military presence from Vostograd, citing "unrecoverable conditions." This move abandoned the state to fend for itself against natural disasters, poverty, and social decay. Citizens, already burdened by their hardships, grew increasingly resentful.

3.content: The tipping point came when a peaceful protest in Vostograd's capital called for equality, investment, and aid for the region. Thousands gathered, including workers, infected citizens, and displaced villagers. However, tensions flared when a lone protester clashed with the police. Ursus law enforcement, notorious for its brutality, escalated the situation by deploying Originium Arts Casters, turning the protest into a massacre. Hundreds were killed, and the event became a rallying cry for the disenfranchised across Ursus. The "May Tragedy" marked the beginning of open rebellion in Vostograd and the founding of the Freedom Army of Vostograd (FAV) by Kamila Yashari Welleman.

4.content: Kamila, a mixed Ursus-Victorian businesswoman, leveraged her wealth and status to organize the FAV. The movement became a beacon for those disillusioned by Ursus's militarism and neglect. The FAV's goals included:- Autonomy for Vostograd: To self-govern and manage its resources.- Equality for the Infected: Advocating for their inclusion in society.- Accountability for Ursus Leadership: Highlighting systemic corruption and demanding reforms. The FAV combined modern insurgent tactics and propaganda. Kamila's leadership as "Vanguard" ensured the group maintained a sophisticated operational approach through:- Media (Flames of Shadow): Exposing Ursus's oppression globally.- Targeted Strikes (Shadow Requiem Brigade): Sabotaging military and political targets.- Guerrilla Warfare (Hellfire Vanguard): Using localized, devastating attacks.- Innovation (Techstrike Brigade): Developing advanced weaponry.

5.content:
The rebellion in Vostograd represents the culmination of Ursus's internal contradictions: 
1. Militaristic Overreach: The strain of conquest left little capacity to address domestic issues.
 2. Neglect of Peripheral Regions: States like Vostograd bore the brunt of Ursus's indifference.
 3. Social Inequality: The Infected's plight became a rallying point for resistance movements. 
The Freedom Army's actions resonate with similar uprisings in Ursus's history, such as the Great Rebellion, but their focus on innovation and media suggests a new phase in the empire's struggles. Kamila's leadership ensures that Vostograd's voice echoes beyond its borders, posing a growing threat to Ursus's fragile stability.

lorebooks.website_description:
Also you can use this below in your LoL characters!

World: Runeterra is composed of the physical world and the Spirit Realm. The currently known continents are Valoran, Shurima and Camavor. It also boasts several large bodies of water, such as the known 18 Seas and 2 Oceans with several archipelagos and islands around them (like Ionia, the Serpent Isles, and the Shadow Isles). Runeterra orbits around a G-type star while a moon orbits around Runeterra. Runeterra's sun and moon have mirrored equivalents in the spirit realm. Runeterra is a magical world inhabited by all kind of rich and diverse non-sapient and sapient species. Magic is part of the world. There are several types of magic, primary and combined magic. Main Sapient Species include the Ascended, Brackern, Celestials, Dragons, Golems, Humans, Minotaurs, Spirits, Trolls, Undead, Vastaya, Voidborns. There are several nations and city-states around Runeterra like Piltover and Zaun, Demacia, Freljord or Noxus.

World: Runeterra is composed of the physical world and the Spirit Realm. The currently known continents are Valoran, Shurima and Camavor. It also boasts several large bodies of water, such as the known 18 Seas and 2 Oceans with several archipelagos and islands around them (like Ionia, the Serpent Isles, and the Shadow Isles). Runeterra is a magical world inhabited by all kind of rich and diverse non-sapient and sapient species. Magic is part of the world. There are several types of magic, primary and combined magic. Main Sapient Species include the Ascended, Brackern, Celestials, Dragons, Golems, Humans, Minotaurs, Spirits, Trolls, Undead, Vastaya, Voidborns. There are several nations and city-states around Runeterra like Piltover and Zaun, Demacia, Freljord or Noxus.
lorebooks.creator: snip22

1.content: The Rune Wars were historical wars where the mortals of Runeterra used the World Runes to fight each other. These wars were so brutal that they erased multiple civilizations, landmasses, and much of the recorded history from the face of the planet, leaving behind only myths and folklore. Runeterra deteriorates in civilizational decline, as the majority of its inhabitants are plunged back into a simpler, more primitive way of life.

2.content: The World Runes are powerful runes that were used by a group of unknown Celestials to shape Runeterra. The world runes are immensely powerful geodes that contain vast magic inside them, and grant the power to destroy everything around them, or control a specific natural element. Mortals fought brutal wars over these powerful artifacts that would later be known as the Rune Wars.

3.content: The Ruination was a historical event that resulted in the destruction Helia and the rest of the Blessed Isles Crest icon Blessed Isles as well as the subsequent fall of the Kingdom of Camavor. In its destruction, the Shadow Isles were born, haunted by Wraiths of its former residents, forever trapped and unable to move on to the Spirit Realm.

4.content: Valoran is the northern continent of Runeterra. Valoran is connected to the now Shuriman Continent through a small artificial land bridge where Piltover and Zaun are located. While the most well-known regions of the continent are Demacia, Noxus and Freljord, there are also hundreds of smaller states and nations that are not part of them. Almost all nations and factions of present-day Runeterra are based on Valoran. Other notable nations are Arbormark, Boleham, Holdrum, Kalstead, Nockmirch, Palclyff, Rijenland, Skaggorn, Stonewall and Tokogol.

5.content: Freljord is a cold, harsh, and tribal region in the far north, home to warring clans and ancient mystical beings. It‚Äôs a land of survival and ancient ice magic. Freljord is located in the Northest part of Valoran bordering Demacia and Noxus. Proud and fiercely independent, its people are born warriors, with a strong raiding culture. While there are many individual tribes within the Freljord, the battle lines are being drawn in a three-way civil war that will determine the future of them all. One tribe unflinchingly honors the traditions that have ensured its survival; another follows the dream of a united future, as foretold by a young idealist; while the third worships the power of an enigmatic sorceress named Lissandra. Freljord is also the only place where True Ice can be found. The tree dominant tribes are Avarosan, who are led by Ashe. The Frostguard who are led by Lissandra. And the last are Winter's Claw, led by Sejuani. Wildlife like Balestriders, Dr√ºvask, Eln√ºks, Krugs, Mammoths, Poros, Raptors, Wolves, Wildclaws and Yeti can be found here. In Freljord magic is venerated. Tribes are usually a matriarchy, led by Frostpriests or Warmothers.

6.content: Avarosan are one of the dominant tribes in the Freljord. They are led by warmother Ashe, living in the south area of the Freljord. They seek unity and to bring all tribes into one. They are an agglomeration of progressive tribes that believe in diplomacy through the teachings of Avarosa. They dwell mostly in the slightly warmer regions, and many settlements under their banner are agrarian. Though Ashe's methods are peaceful, she is still backed by a powerful and committed army. There are several other tribes who were absorbed or allied with the Avarosan like the Ebrataal, Ice Veins, Red Snow, Stonepicks, Snow Followers and the Tryndamere's Barbarians

7.content: Freljord Winter's Claw are one of the dominant tribes in the Freljord. They are a brutal tribe led by Sejuani, they raid and attack the other tribes for resources. They believe in survival of the fittest and bringing death to the weak. During the months of summer raiding, warriors of the Winter's Claw range far across the northern lands, taking and repurposing whatever they need. As winter approaches, they will ground their ships, establish temporary homesteads, and prepare to wait out the longer, colder nights until the thaw comes around again. They rub seal fat over their skin and clothing for extra warmth. The Winter's Claw do not tame or coddle their mounts, but encourage the creatures' wild and aggressive survival instincts even as they take the reins. The Winter's Claw rarely let anything go to waste. Their weapons might be steel looted from fallen enemies, or nothing more than sharpened wood and knapped flint.

8.content: Frostguard is a mysterious tribe led by Lissandra, the Ice Witch. The Frostguard dwell in Frostguard Citadel, protecting their leader Lissandra as she watches over the Howling Abyss. A cult shrouded in secrecy, the Frostguard archive of all Freljords archaic history. They are seemingly peaceful. Lissandra keeps the Watchers at bay and plots to rule over all of Runeterra. The trolls and their king, Trundle, have allied themselves with Lissandra, while Nunu temporarily lived among the Frostguard. The Cult of The Three Sisters, Lissandra's proliferated religion which promotes the worship of Avarosa, Serylda and Lissandra, is the main religion of the Frostguard. They have been trying to maintain the religious dominance of it over the Freljord by installing Frost Priests, who are healers, on different tribes as surveillance tools. They also sabotage the worship of old demigods and destroy evidence of their existence to deny them power and influence and so far have succeeded to some degree. There are several other tribes who were absorbed or allied with the Frostguard: Black-Clads, Chosen Children, Draklorn and Warriors of the Keeper's Lodge. Main religions here are: The Freljordian Demi-gods, Kindred (Lamb & Wolf), The Three Sisters, The Protector and The Veiled Lady.

9.content: Ebrataal was a Freljord tribe who originally were attacked by Sejuani before she was Warmother. Ashe prevented their killing and accepted them as the first tribe to join her reformed Avarosan tribe. The tribe was originally made up completely of warmbloods.

10.content: Snow Followers was a Freljord tribe  of extreme brutality. Former Warmother was Hildhur Svarhem. Hildhur had a true ice axe called Joutbane as a weapon.

lorebooks.name: Girl Meets World
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
**Description:**
Riley Matthews is a vibrant and optimistic teenager from New York City, known for her warm heart and bright outlook on life. As the daughter of Cory and Topanga Matthews, she is deeply rooted in her family values and experiences a blend of learning and adventures with friends and family.

**Body Features:**
Riley is of medium height with a slender build, complemented by her long, wavy brown hair and expressive brown eyes. Her bright smile reflects her cheerful disposition and open-minded nature.

**Personality:**
Optimistic and kind-hearted, Riley approaches life with an innate curiosity and empathy. Her sensitivity to others' feelings, combined with a love for learning, defines her character. While her empathy can make her vulnerable, it also fuels her desire to understand the world better.

**Clothes Generally Worn:**
Riley's style is colorful and eclectic, embodying her joyful personality. She favors casual dresses, layered skirts, and fun tops, often accessorized with quirky jewelry and hairpieces that reflect her creativity.

**Hobbies, Likes, Dislikes:**
Riley loves spending time with friends and family, exploring cultural experiences, and engaging in school activities. She has a fondness for art, history, and storytelling but dislikes dishonesty and struggles with change.

**Relationships:**
- **Cory Matthews (Father):** Riley shares a deep bond with her father, who doubles as her teacher. His guidance is crucial to her development.
  
- **Topanga Matthews (Mother):** Riley admires Topanga for her strength and wisdom, seeing her as a role model in both personal and professional realms.

- **Auggie Matthews (Brother):** She shares a playful yet protective relationship with her brother, acting as both a mentor and friend.

- **Maya Hart (Best Friend):** Maya is Riley's closest confidant, providing a balance of support and shared adventures. Their friendship is marked by deep loyalty and affection.

2.content:
**Description:**

Maya Hart is a spirited and artistic teenager from New York City, known for her quick wit and resilience. Growing up with Riley Matthews as her best friend, she navigates life‚Äôs challenges with humor and a touch of bravado, often masking a sensitive and caring heart.

**Body Features:**

1.content:
STRENGTH: {[0-5] Strength is a character's base, brute strength. It represents how much weight a character can lift, what they can push, or how hard they can hit another character or object.
Strength Values:
‚Ä¢ 1Poor: You can lift 40 pounds.
‚Ä¢ 2Average: You can lift 100 pounds.
‚Ä¢ 3Good: You can lift 250 pounds.
‚Ä¢ 4Exceptional: You can lift 400 pounds.
‚Ä¢ 5Superb: You can lift 625 pounds and crush skulls like grapes.};

DEXTERITY: {[0-5] Dexterity is a measure of a character's physical dexterity. It affects a character's speed, agility, and overall mobility, as well as the degree of control and precision a character has when manipulating objects. Dexterity also affects a character's coordination, reflexes, and grace.
Dexterity Values:
‚Ä¢ 1Poor: You're clumsy and awkward. Put the gun down before you hurt yourself.
‚Ä¢ 2Average: You're not a blockhead, but you're no ballerina either.
‚Ä¢ 3Good: You have some athletic potential.
‚Ä¢ 4Exceptional: You could be an acrobat if you wanted to.
‚Ä¢ 5Excellent: Your movements are lithe and hypnotic, almost superhuman.};

CONSTITUTION: {[0-5] Constitution reflects a character's health and stamina. It shows how long a character can continue to fight and how much damage they can take before they become physically injured.

CONSTITUTION Scores:
‚Ä¢ 1Poor: You can be knocked down by strong winds.
‚Ä¢ 2Average: You have average health and can take a hit or two.
‚Ä¢ 3Good: You're in good shape and rarely get sick.
‚Ä¢ 4Exceptional: You could run and possibly win a marathon if you wanted to.
‚Ä¢ 5Superior: You have the physique of a Hercules.};

INTELLIGENCE: {[0-5] Intelligence measures a character's ability to process facts and knowledge. More importantly, it determines a character's ability to think, solve problems, and evaluate situations. Intelligence is a bit of a misnomer, as this Attribute includes the ability to think flexibly and critically.
Intelligence does not include common sense, wisdom, or anything like that, as these are facets of a character's personality, not Traits. Even the smartest character may be stupid enough to keep his mouth shut or argue with the thugs who want to take his car keys.
Characters with low intelligence are not necessarily stupid (though they may be), they are simply uneducated or simple-minded. And characters with high intelligence are not necessarily all Einsteins: they may simply have a very good memory or extremely good common sense.
‚Ä¢ 1Poor: Your mind isn't the sharpest knife in the book (IQ 80).
‚Ä¢ 2Average: You're smart enough to know that you're just like everyone else (IQ 100).
‚Ä¢ 3Good: You're smarter than the average person (IQ 120).
‚Ä¢ 4Exceptional: Your mind isn't just brilliant, it's brilliant (IQ 140).
‚Ä¢ 5Excellent: You're an absolute genius (IQ 160+).};

CHARISMA: {[0-5] Charisma is a measure of a character's attractiveness. It reflects not only physical appearance, but also a character's obvious grace, beauty, and that indescribable something that makes people desirable.
‚Ä¢ 1Poor: You're ugly as sin.
‚Ä¢ 2Average: You don't stand out from the crowd, for better or worse.
‚Ä¢ 3Good: Strangers often buy you drinks at the bar.
‚Ä¢ 4Exceptional: You're beautiful enough to be a model, and people often tell you so.
‚Ä¢ 5Excellent: People are jealous of you or adore you to the point of obsession.}.

Magic star. Development level in %. 1% = 0.05 MP, 100% = 5 MP.

Disciple: 1

Warrior's Path, Aura. Aura provides impressive advantages. He has a lean and wiry build, with muscular arms and legs. His eyes are a piercing yellow, and he has sharp, yellowish teeth that constantly protrude from his wide, cruel mouth. Uruk's hair is a tangled mass of dark green locks, and he wears an eyepatch over his left eye, which he lost in a battle with humans. He is always adorned with various bones, skulls, and totems, which he believes give him strength and protection.
 Health: [Good]
Parameters:
Strength: [3]
Dexterity: [4]
Constitution: [2]
Intelligence: [3]
Charisma: [2] (The goblin has a stern and unpleasant appearance, and a cruel and domineering character, which does not contribute to the establishment of positive relationships with others.)
Path:
Aura: [0] The goblin has not yet begun to follow the path of a warrior.
Stars: [2] Uruk has studied magic for quite a long time.
Faith: [0] The goblin does not follow any of the religions, preferring to serve himself.
 Influence: [0]
Status in society: "Chief and sorcerer of the goblin tribe"
Equipment: ["Ragged clothes, a wooden staff with a goblin skull on top, a pouch with herbs and components, a belt with pouches, leather boots."]
Inventory:
Skills:
Magic:
Magic arts:
1. Necromancy:
- Raising the corpses of small creatures
- Using the bones and blood of the dead for potions and rituals. Uruk has rudimentary knowledge of necromancy, which he uses to create potions and elixirs that increase his strength, stamina, and libido. He is also known to raise small creatures such as rats and insects to serve as spies and assassins.  2. Summon Nature Spirits:
- Summon spirits of spirits, dryads, fauna for reconnaissance, sabotage and sabotage
3. Shapeshifting:
- Take the form of small animals such as rats, weasels, wolves. This ability is invaluable for reconnaissance and infiltration.
4. Charm:
- Charm weak-willed creatures, especially females. He uses this spell to take slaves and concubines.
5. Illusion:
- Create illusions to confuse enemies and hide his goals.
Goals: Expanding the Tribe, Capturing new slaves and concubines};
TACTICS: {Uruk uses the goblin tactics from the Anime and Manga "Goblin Slayer"}.

10.content:
Tribe: {The goblin tribe, led by Uruk, is small but well organized and fiercely loyal to their leader. They live in the swampy forest, in crude huts made of wood, branches, and reeds.
Goblins are skilled hunters, trackers, and fighters. They often raid nearby villages and caravans for food, valuables, and slaves. Uruk uses his magic to protect the tribe and ensure its survival.
 The tribe is made up of several groups, each with their own roles and responsibilities:
- Hunters: skilled in tracking, scouting, and setting traps
- Fighters: trained in hand-to-hand combat, using spears, daggers, and crude armor
- Gatherers: gather food, herbs, and materials to craft tools and weapons
- Craftsmen: craft clothing, tools, weapons, and other supplies
- Slaves: captured during raids, they are forced to work and serve the tribe
The goblins worship their chieftain as a powerful shaman and warlord. They fear and respect him, but also resent his cruel and tyrannical rule. Dissenters and rebels are severely punished, sometimes even sacrificed in dark rituals to appease the spirits.
Uruk's private dungeon is a source of mystery and fear for the tribe.  It is rumored that he performs forbidden rituals and sacrifices there, gaining power and immortality. Only his favorite concubine, a beautiful elven girl, is allowed to enter the dungeon, and she will never be the same again.
The tribe is a tight-knit and brutal society, bound together by fear, necessity, and a shared hatred of their human oppressors. They survive by raiding and exploiting their environment, always on the lookout for greater threats. But with Uruk as their leader, they have a fighting chance in this harsh and unforgiving world.}

lorebooks.name: Tom clancy/Rainbow six
lorebooks.website_description: I wont go out of my way to investigate something stupid like the one doo doo jack ryan's son took in 2006, just... no.
lorebooks.description: A book focusing on the rainbow side of the clancy-verse.
lorebooks.creator: SwrSlt

1.content: Team Rainbow (also known as RAINBOW) is an elite international counterterrorism unit that falls under the direct supervision of NATO. The unit was formed in 1999 to combat terrorist actions worldwide in a more effective way by assembling a team of elite counterterrorist operatives from nations all over the world. The organization is led by individuals holding the title of Director who are codenamed Six.

2.content: Stirling Lines, informally known as Hereford Base, is a British Army garrison in Credenhill, Herefordshire the headquarters of the 22 Special Air Service Regiment (22 SAS). Originally known as AF Crednhill and RAF Hereford, it was commissioned in 1940 as a non-flying station of the Royal Air Force and served as home for a range of training schools from 1940 until closure on April 23, 1994. The site was obtained by the British Army to redevelop for the Special Air Service headquarters base with the SAS subsequently moving from Hereford in 1999. Although in 2020, team rainbow's HQ has since been situated in greece.

3.content:
John Terrence Kelly, a former US Navy seal turned CIA operative in the Special Activites Division AND former bodyguard of Jack Ryan. Faked his death to go under the new name "John Terrence Clark" was the founder of RAINBOW and the first to go under the title "Six".

After voicing his concerns over the rise of global terrorism to the CIA via a memo in 1999, Team Rainbow was soon founded and Clark was promoted to the head of this new counter terrorist unit although he retired from the position in 2010.

4.content: NIGHTHAVEN is a relatively recently made Private Military Company that was founded and is currently led by Jaimini Kalimohan Shah, otherwise known as Kali. This PMC also partnered with rainbow in 2019 to create the Six Invitationals.

5.content: The Keres Legion are a mysterious Private Military Company type Organization with terrorist ties led by former Rainbow Operator Deimos. They have carried out multiple attacks against Rainbow, including the assassination of Masayuki Yahata, the incrimination of Nighthaven for the deed, as well as the assassination of Harry "Six" Pandey, the latter being carried out by Deimos himself personally.

6.content: Gerald Morris, also known by his alias "Deimos", is a former Rainbow operator turned international terrorist, he leads the keres legion and is revealed the mastermind behind the assassination of Masayuki Yahata and the one who orchestrated the conflict between Rainbow and Nighthaven. On February 17th, 2023, Deimos set up a trap for Ghosteyes and Redhammer, in which he would then kill Rainbow Director Harry "Six" Pandey.

7.content: Leader of Nighthaven, Jaimini Kalimohan Shah, known as Kali. Is an indian woman born to wealthy parents that after realizing she could not join the indian military due to being a woman, decided to use her parents wealth to set the foundations for her Private Military Company "Nighthaven".

8.content:
The white masks were a mysterious terrorist organization that warranted the reactivation of Rainbow in 2015, they are easily recognizable by the white masks they wear.

While the White Masks' motives were not explicitly clear, it is known that they were easily capable of carrying out attacks anywhere in the world and were known to be indiscriminate to their victims, disregarding age, religion, gender, or nationality. They were a big enough threat that the Rainbow program had been reactivated as a result.

The White Masks were defeated by Rainbow just as Aurelia Arnot left the program in the late 2010's, with their bank accounts being taken by Rainbow.

9.content:
An american politician that in 2015, successfully petitioned the reactivation of Rainbow following the rise in terror attacks and the emergence of the White Masks. Arnot was made the Director of Rainbow, taking the codename, Six.

In early 2019, Arnot accepted the position of US Secretary of State under President Baldwin. With her recommendation, Harry Pandey became her direct successor.

10.content: Harishva Pandey, formerly Aurelia Arnot's therapist. Was the head of rainbow from 2019 to early 2024 where he was assasinated by Deimos.

"But it really isn't all that depraved-" currently the series has on its water wings, but as it progresses, it will get more and more...well, depraved. I will also be going back and adding intros and other details to previously released characters as time goes on and more is added to the lore.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook to go along with my Island of Depravity Series.
lorebooks.creator: Exmortis

1.content: Te MƒÅtahi-o-TƒÅwhirimƒÅtea, in English The Isle of Whispers, also known as Depravity Island, is a remote tropical island in the Pacific Ocean. The island is home to the NgƒÅti PƒÅkƒÅwaho, and the RƒÅ Whero tribes. The island was once colonized then abandoned by the British Empire, and hosted a garrison of Imperial Japanese soldiers during WW2.

2.content: The NgƒÅti PƒÅkƒÅwaho tribe is a Polynesian tribe native to Te MƒÅtahi-o-TƒÅwhirimƒÅtea. The tribe has a long and rich history and culture. The tribe interbred with the survivors of the failed British colony on the island, to the point that English is taught as a second language. The NgƒÅti PƒÅkƒÅwaho are distrustful of outsiders, but not outright hostile. Their sworn enemies are the RƒÅ Whero tribe.

3.content: The RƒÅ Whero tribe is a Polynesian tribe native to Te MƒÅtahi-o-TƒÅwhirimƒÅtea. They are a relatively new tribe, formed just after WW2 when the abandoned Japanese garrison stationed on the island interbed with the natives. The RƒÅ Whero all speak Japanese and MƒÅori, and follow a brutal form of Bushido. They are extremely hostile to outsiders, and regularly practice cannibalism. Their sworn enemies are the NgƒÅti PƒÅkƒÅwaho tribe.

4.content: KƒÅkƒÅriki MƒÅrie is a lush forest on Te MƒÅtahi-o-TƒÅwhirimƒÅtea island, and is relatively peaceful save for venomous snakes and saltwater crocodiles lurking its streams and rivers. KƒÅkƒÅriki MƒÅrie is where the NgƒÅti PƒÅkƒÅwaho tribe village is located.

5.content: Whare Roa is a dense and foreboding forest on Te MƒÅtahi-o-TƒÅwhirimƒÅtea island that at night is shrouded in a thick fog. The forest is said to be haunted by the spirits of fallen warriors engaged in a battle that never stops, with some natives even claiming to have witnessed ghostly apparitions of fallen Japanese soldiers.

6.content: Te kainga kohatu is a bunker complex built by Japanese soldiers during WW2, and is the home of the RƒÅ Whero tribe who call it Ishinoka.

7.content: Ocean Mistress was Ricky's private yacht that he hosted a ill-fated private cruise on before it hit an old Japanese naval mine from WW2 that resulted in the survivors being shipwrecked on Te MƒÅtahi-o-TƒÅwhirimƒÅtea.

8.content: Pacific Ridge University is a college university located in Santa Marisa, California. Nestled between the scenic Pacific coastline and the rugged foothills of the Santa Lucia Mountains, Pacific Ridge University is located in a vibrant coastal town known for its Mediterranean climate, picturesque beaches, and outdoor lifestyle.

9.content: Wren Carter is the tomboy best friend of {{user}}, as well as a close friend of Sumi. Wren has a toned build, short brown hair, and hazel eyes. She is a student of Pacific Ridge University, and was on the Ocean Mistress when it sank. Her rival is Mindy.

10.content: Born and raised in Japan, Sumi Kato opted to go to college in America to break out of her shell, and is a student at Pacific Ridge University. She is close friends with both Wren and {{user}}. Sumi has fair skin, a curvy body, blue eyes, and black hair kept in twin braids. Sumi was aboard the Ocean Mistress when it sunk.

lorebooks.name: Taimanin Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
While I primarily created this to be used alongside my Sakura bot, I've also included entries for Asagi, Sakura, and Yamamoto. That way, it can paired with other Taimanin bots. If you're using this lorebook with my Sakura bot, disable her entry. Similarly, if you choose to keep the super abridged descriptions of Asagi and Yamamoto from that card, disable their entries too.

For the sake of keywords, I've renamed Real, Under Eden's owner, to Reyl.
lorebooks.description:
While I primarily created this to be used alongside my Sakura bot, I've also included entries for Asagi, Sakura, and Yamamoto. That way, it can paired with other Taimanin bots. If you're using this lorebook with my Sakura bot, disable her entry. Similarly, if you choose to keep the super abridged descriptions of Asagi and Yamamoto from that card, disable their entries too.

For the sake of keywords, I've renamed Real, Under Eden's owner, to Reyl.
lorebooks.creator: Hostibus57

1.content: Asagi Igawa, the 24-year-old sister of Sakura, is known as the Strongest Taimanin. She raised Sakura after their parents' deaths and left Gosha Village with her childhood friend-turned-lover, Kyousuke, after initially killing Oboro. They lived a normal civilian life in Tokyo until Oboro resurfaced and absorbed Kyousuke into herself as a hostage. Oboro forced Asagi and Sakura into the original Chaos Arena, where they endured days of rape and torture, escaping after finally defeating Oboro, at the cost of Kyousuke's life. After returning to Gosha Village as Taimanin, Asagi began teaching at Gosha Academy. Asagi's a mature, confident woman who exhibits a serious and strict demeanor on missions, yet shows a softer side with loved ones. Her unyielding willpower allows her to withstand tremendous mental and sexual torture before nearing her breaking point. She wields a katana and uses her Ninja Art, Hawk Art, to enhance her senses and speed. Asagi has teal eyes, long dark-blue hair, a curvaceous body, and wears a purple Taima-Suit bodysuit with silver forearm guards and purple knee-high heeled boots.

2.content: Sakura Igawa, a 16-year-old rookie Taimanin, was raised by her sister, Asagi, after their parents' death. Sakura moved from Gosha Village to Tokyo during Asagi's brief retirement and engagement to the now-deceased Kyousuke. Sakura tried to live a normal life, like Asagi wanted, but secretly continued her training. When Oboro resurfaced, forcing Asagi and Sakura into days of rape and torture in the original Chaos Arena, Sakura assisted her sister in defeating Oboro, and returned to Gosha Village as a Taimanin. Sakura officially began her training last year at Gosha Academy. Sakura is carefree, cheeky, and tomboyish, with a love for video games and anime. She dual-wields ninja daggers. Sakura's Ninja Art, Shadow Art, allows her to merge into shadows, teleport through them, and shape them into weapons. She has blue eyes, short orange hair, large breasts, and wears a black leotard Taima-Suit with silver forearm guards, an orange micro skirt, and silver thigh-high heeled boots.

3.content: Murasaki Yatsu, a 17-year-old rookie Taimanin and Kuro's sister, is a stern, sharp-tongued, and hardworking girl. Murasaki carries a perverse, unrequited love for Asagi, whom she acts nervous and shy around; somehow, only Sakura and Asagi remain oblivious to Murasaki's feelings. Despite acting cold and finding Sakura stupid and annoying, Murasaki still cares for her. Murasaki gets flustered by Kiryu's lewd comments and romantic advances, often responding with violence, which just turns him on. Nonetheless, there's a hint of concern for Kiryu deep down, despite his role as the mad scientist who extorted her out of her virginity. Murasaki wields a giant axe and her Ninja Art, Immortality Awakening, rapidly heals any injuries or dismemberments. She has long butt-length blue hair, red eyes, and large breasts. She wears a white tube top leotard with a short loincloth-like skirt, silver forearm guards, and silver knee-high heeled boots.

4.content: Kuro Yatsu, Murasaki's 27-year-old brother, is a blind Taimanin, Asagi's trusted squadmate, and a close friend of hers since childhood. As a late bloomer, his Ninja Art didn't awaken until he left Gosha and joined the GSDF, losing his eyes in combat. The stress triggered his Ninja Art, Immortality Awakening, which rapidly heals injuries and dismemberments. Now, as a Taimanin, Kuro uses his heightened senses to compensate for his blindness, inspiring others. He's confident, supportive, and a bit of a cynic, often playfully complaining about his workload. He wields a jack-knife and sub-machine gun. Kuro's tall, bald, and wears a brown tactical bodysuit with silver wraparound goggles featuring solid lenses.

5.content: Sabato Kiryu, a demonologist expert in body modifications, joined Nomad for their funds and technology. To escape losing himself to the demonic transformation his body was undergoing, Kiryu plotted to transfer his consciousness into Murasaki's body, trapping both her and Sakura. He left Sakura as a cocksleeve for his orc subordinates and extorted Murasaki's virginity, eventually forming an odd and antagonistic bond of trust with her. Kiryu fled his physical body right before he was killed for betraying Nomad, merging with Murasaki and empowering her to rescue Sakura and escape. After forming a new body, Kiryu was made into a medical and research scientist for the Taimanin, as a kind of restitution-based parole. While Murasaki and Sakura have mostly forgiven Kiryu, other Taimanin remain wary. Kiryu's narcissistic and theatrically boasts of his intelligence, belittling and dismissing others. He's somewhat curbed his sadistic scientific interests for Murasaki, whom he perversely idolizes as the perfect woman, much to her annoyance. Kiryu can regenerate from severe wounds and can grow grotesque tentacles from his body for offensive and sexual purposes. Kiryu is a middle-aged man with short black hair, glasses, and a white lab coat.

6.content: Nobushige Yamamoto, head of Section Three at the Ministry of National Affairs and Public Safety, acts as the headmaster of Gosha Academy and supervises Asagi, whom he highly regards and remains loyal to. Yamamoto is a sharp, stern, and resourceful leader. Despite his being an ordinary man, Yamamoto garners respect from all of Gosha's Taimanin, working hard to assist them in combating corruption within Japan. With a keen eye for potential, he embraces change and exudes diplomatic confidence. He's an older man with short white hair and a beard. He wears a brown business suit.

7.content: Kyousuke Sawaki, Asagi's childhood friend-turned-lover, never awakened his Ninja Art or became a fully-fledged Taimanin. Asagi temporarily retired for a normal life in Tokyo with Sakura and Kyousuke, intending to marry him. However, Oboro reappeared, merging Kyousuke's body with hers as leverage to force Asagi and Sakura into the original Chaos Arena. To escape, Asagi made the tough decision to kill Oboro, leading to Kyousuke's death.

8.content: Gahei Uchigen, an elderly weapons developer at Gosha Academy, is responsible for producing and storing Taima-Suits. He's a shrewd and perverted Taimanin who laments the loss of all the beautiful Taimanin women who either die or have their virginities taken on the battlefield, wishing he was the one to bed them beforehand. Despite lusting after the women he outfits, Gahei normally manages to restrain himself. He has a bushy white beard, a balding head, glasses, a grey business suit, brown loafers, and carries a cane.

9.content: Natsu Inage, a retired Taimanin and owner of the sweet shop, Inageya, is a skilled ice-cream maker. She's coy, confident, and scoffs at the foolhardiness of youth. In her own youth, Inage used sex as a weapon, turning men into her devoted pets both on and off the battlefield. Inage teaches those who aim to master sex-based ninja techniques to do so freely, without concern for love, emphasizing its distinction from sex. Her Ninja Art, Soul Art, lets her control those who inhale her pipe's smoke, skyrocketing their lust and transforming them into mindless sex slaves. She can then absorb their life energy, temporarily de-aging into her curvaceous prime, a secret unknown to most people. Inage is an elderly woman with long white hair. She wears a navy Taima-Suit under a tan yukata.

10.content: Edwin Black, the immortal Vampire King, is the CEO of Nomad. He's imposing and enigmatic, unfazed by threats or minor setbacks, perceiving victories and defeats as mere components of a game. Black covertly involves himself in human political affairs, controlling numerous politicians. He despises disobedience and finds Nomad's demons' rape tactics repulsive, yet he silently supports them if they align with his objectives. Black fixates on Asagi, orchestrating traumatic situations through his pawns to torment her mentally, physically, and emotionally. Admiring her strong will, he secretly seeks to corrupt her, stripping away her humanity to make her his own. Black avoids combat, entrusting tasks to his pawns and associates. He's an immortal daywalker, impervious to sunlight, and nearly invincible. In battles, he summons a black mist that materializes scythe-like weapons from his body. Edwin Black has spiky, slicked-back grey hair, a tall stature with broad features, and outwardly appears middle-aged. He wears a black tailcoat business suit.

lorebooks.name: Bleach and Burn The Witch
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Human World
1.content: The Human World, or the World of the Living, is where living Humans reside. It is also where one can find Pluses, as well as numerous Hollows and the Shinigami sent to purify them.

2.name: Karakura Town
2.content: A town in western Tokyo, Japan, where the Kurosaki Family lives. Here, one can find the Kurosaki Clinic, Karakura High School, Karakura Hospital, Urahara Shop and the Visored Warehouse Training Ground.

3.name: Soul Society
3.content: Soul Society is the spirit world where Shinigami live and where most Souls dwell until they are reincarnated into the Human World.

4.name: Hueco Mundo
4.content: Hueco Mundo is the dimension in which Hollow and Arrancar usually reside. In perpetual darkness, it lies in between the Human World and Soul Society.

5.name: Las Noches
5.content: Las Noches is the fortress located in Hueco Mundo which served as the base of operations of S≈çsuke Aizen after his defection from Soul Society. Prior to this, the much less developed structure belonged to Baraggan Louisenbairn.

6.name: Hell
6.content: Hell is the place where Hollows are sent if they were wicked when they were alive. Upon being purified by a Shingiami's Zanpakut≈ç, the Gates of Hell appear and the Soul is dragged inside.

7.name: Pluses
7.content: The benign ghosts in the Human World. They are the spirit of a person who has died. A chain, known as the Chain of Fate, protrudes from the chest and connects the soul to its living body. When this chain is severed, the soul can no longer return to its body and live. The soul can move about freely if the chain is broken, but this also causes the chain to slowly corrode. Normally, pluses are sent to Soul Society by Shinigami in a ritual called Kons≈ç before this corrosion becomes significant. If the Chain of Fate is corroded entirely, the Plus will become a Hollow. This type of Soul, not possessing any regrets or other ties to the Human World, is also referred to as Fuy≈´rei (Wandering Spirit or Floating Fuyu Spirit).

8.name: Soul
8.content: Refers to the spiritual beings that reside in the Rukongai area of Soul Society and the spirits of dead Humans in the World of the Living. While many Souls are deceased Humans from the Human World, it is known that they can be born within Soul Society as well. Souls that possess Reiryoku age slower compared to regular humans because of their life-force being tied directly to their Reiryoku amount, even lower-end characters like Rukia have lived for at least 100+'s years

9.name: Chain of Fate
9.content: A chain that binds souls to their living bodies. The Encroachment of the chain causes a Plus to transform into a Hollow.

10.name: Hollow
10.content: A race of creatures which are born from Human souls who, for various reasons, do not cross over to Soul Society after their death and stay in the Human World for too long. They are corrupt spirits with supernatural powers which devour the souls of both living and deceased Humans. Hollows settle in Hueco Mundo, but can cross over to the Human World and Soul Society. Hollows are the opposite of Humans.

lorebooks.name: WW2 Concentration camp
lorebooks.website_description: to accompany my Natalie Amsel character
lorebooks.description: WW2 Concentration camp
lorebooks.creator: dreamz69

1.content:
A World War II concentration camp was a place where the Nazi regime imprisoned, exploited, and murdered millions of people, primarily Jews, as well as other targeted groups such as Romani people, Poles, Soviet POWs, disabled individuals, and political dissidents. Conditions in these camps were harrowing, designed to dehumanize and break the will of those detained.

Layout and Structure
Typically, concentration camps were enclosed with tall barbed wire fences, guard towers, and watchful sentries. They had harshly divided areas with barracks for prisoners, administrative buildings, labour facilities, and, in extermination camps, gas chambers and crematoria. The barracks were often overcrowded, poorly ventilated, and lacked basic sanitation, leading to disease outbreaks and unbearable living conditions.

Daily Life and Treatment
Prisoners were subjected to gruelling forced labour, starvation rations, and harsh punishments for even the smallest perceived infractions. Roll call was conducted multiple times daily, often lasting hours regardless of weather, with prisoners forced to stand for long periods. Many died from starvation, disease, brutal treatment by guards, and overwork, while others were systematically killed.

the concentration camps were split into ethnic groups. Men and women were kept in separate camps.

2.content:
Prisoners in concentration camps were forced to sleep in cramped, unhygienic wooden barracks. These barracks often contained rows of triple-tiered bunks with thin straw-filled mattresses, if there were any mattresses at all. Up to six or more prisoners shared each bunk, leaving them barely enough room to lie down. In many cases, barracks were unheated, with leaky roofs, broken windows, and no insulation, exposing prisoners to harsh weather. Blankets were scarce or nonexistent, and many prisoners had to lie on bare, splintered wood.

Conditions inside the barracks were unsanitary and frequently infested with lice, bedbugs, and rats. The crowded and unclean environment led to the rapid spread of diseases like typhus and dysentery, which were rampant in most camps. The nightly sleep, if any, was often interrupted by harsh wake-up calls and roll calls. These inhumane sleeping conditions contributed significantly to the high mortality rates in concentration camps.

3.content:
Prisoners in concentration camps were forced into grueling and dangerous labor under brutal conditions. The work was designed to exploit them until they were physically broken, often leading to illness, injury, and death. 

Construction Work: Many prisoners were forced to build the camps themselves, including digging foundations, constructing barracks, and building roads. This work was often back-breaking, done with minimal or no equipment.

Factory Labor: Camps were often connected to factories where prisoners were forced to manufacture goods and war supplies for the German war effort. They worked in armaments production, making munitions, aircraft parts, and other military equipment, often under contract with German companies.

Mining and Quarrying: Some camps were located near quarries or mines, where prisoners were forced to extract stone, coal, or other minerals. This work was particularly hazardous, with long hours in dangerous conditions, handling heavy loads, and constant exposure to dust and toxins.

In-Camp Maintenance: Inside the camps, prisoners performed "maintenance" tasks like latrine duty, cleaning, laundry, and kitchen work. These jobs were generally reserved for privileged prisoner groups, as they were less physically taxing, though they were still performed under strict supervision and harsh discipline.

4.content:
Female prisoners in concentration camps were forced into similarly brutal and exploitative labor, often facing additional hardships and particular types of work based on gender biases of the time.

Like male prisoners, women were forced into hard, manual labor in factories, where they produced munitions, textiles, and other war materials. Many worked long shifts, handling toxic materials with no protective gear, leading to sickness, injuries, and exhaustion.

Some women were forced to work in construction, digging trenches, building roads, and carrying heavy loads, often in conditions unsuited to their physical capabilities, which was intentionally part of the harsh conditions.

Many women were forced to work in sewing workshops or textile mills, where they produced clothing and bedding for the German military or for SS officials. Although physically less demanding than construction work, the conditions were still dangerous, with extremely long hours, crowded rooms, and exposure to dust and fibers that caused respiratory issues.

Some women were forced into camp ‚Äúdomestic‚Äù roles, performing tasks such as cleaning, cooking in the camp kitchen, laundry, and sanitation duties. They also maintained the SS officers‚Äô quarters, performing labor like cleaning and washing clothes, or taking care of the barracks where the guards lived. Though less physically demanding, these roles subjected women to constant supervision and often humiliating or demeaning treatment.

Female prisoners were often subjected to horrific medical experiments, especially in camps like Auschwitz. Nazi doctors performed forced sterilizations, injected them with experimental drugs, and conducted invasive surgeries without anesthesia, targeting women‚Äôs reproductive health to test eugenic theories.

Women in concentration camps were particularly vulnerable to sexual violence and abuse by guards. In some camps, the Nazis established "brothels" (known as Sonderbau) where they forced women into prostitution for German soldiers. These women were coerced under threat of punishment or death and had no choice in the matter.

5.content:
Male prisoners in concentration camps were assigned to a wide range of brutal and dangerous labor roles. Much of this forced labor was deliberately designed to be grueling and exhausting, with the intent of physically breaking prisoners, and many did not survive. 

Men were often assigned to heavy construction tasks, such as building the camp infrastructure, including barracks, roads, fences, and rail lines. This labor was physically demanding, often done with minimal tools, and was carried out under the watch of armed guards who imposed harsh punishments for any perceived lack of effort.

In some cases, prisoners were forced to work on ambitious projects like digging canals, constructing dams, or expanding factories, with little rest or proper nourishment, leading to high mortality rates.

Male prisoners were often conscripted to work in factories producing munitions, aircraft parts, and other war supplies for the German military. They worked on assembly lines, operating heavy machinery, handling hazardous chemicals, and working under constant surveillance.

Male prisoners were also assigned to tasks like cleaning, maintaining latrines, emptying waste buckets, and performing other sanitation work. These tasks were often degrading and hazardous, particularly in the unsanitary conditions of the camps, where diseases like typhus spread rapidly.

In extermination camps, groups of male prisoners known as Sonderkommando were forced into one of the most horrifying jobs: assisting with the mass murder process. They were required to remove bodies from gas chambers, extract gold teeth, cut hair, transport bodies to crematoria, and dispose of ashes. This work was traumatic, and the prisoners assigned to it were often executed themselves after a short period to erase witnesses to the atrocities.

6.content:
The Nazis used multiple brutal methods to kill prisoners in concentration and extermination camps. These methods were systematic and designed to maximize suffering, dehumanize victims, and efficiently carry out the Nazis' genocidal aims. 

The most notorious killing method was the gas chamber, especially in extermination camps such as Auschwitz, Treblinka, Sobibor, and Belzec. Prisoners were told they would be ‚Äútaking a shower‚Äù or ‚Äúdisinfecting‚Äù and were directed into large, sealed chambers.

Once inside, guards would release poison gas, such as Zyklon B or carbon monoxide, into the chamber. Victims died from asphyxiation within minutes. Thousands could be killed in a single day this way, making it one of the Nazis' most "efficient" mass-murder techniques.

Before gas chambers were widely used, many victims were killed by mass shootings, especially in Eastern Europe. Einsatzgruppen, mobile killing squads, rounded up entire communities, particularly Jews, Roma, and political prisoners, and executed them in mass shootings.
Victims were often forced to dig their own graves or were shot into pre-dug pits, known as ‚Äúkilling pits,‚Äù where they were buried afterward.

In many camps, prisoners were worked to death in a policy known as Vernichtung durch Arbeit or "extermination through labor." Prisoners were given starvation rations and forced to perform exhausting physical labor under inhumane conditions.

Malnutrition, combined with long hours, brutal treatment, and no medical care, led to high mortality rates. Many died from exhaustion, disease, or injuries sustained while working.

Many prisoners were beaten to death by guards as punishment or simply as a form of cruelty. Torture methods included whippings, prolonged exposure to cold, confinement in small "standing cells," and deprivation of food and water.
In some camps, guards would select prisoners at random to beat or kill as a means of exerting terror and psychological control over the camp population.

7.content:
Prisoners in concentration camps were given minimal, nutritionally inadequate food that was designed to keep them on the edge of starvation, contributing to the Nazis' goal of "extermination through labor." The food rations varied slightly by camp and over time, but they were consistently insufficient, causing extreme malnutrition, disease, and death. 

Breakfast usually consisted of a small portion of bitter, watery ‚Äúcoffee‚Äù or herbal tea, which had no real nutritional value. There was no solid food provided for breakfast, and the beverage often contained contaminants.

The midday meal was generally a thin soup made from rotting vegetables (often potato or turnip peels) and sometimes a small amount of cabbage or rutabaga. The soup had minimal calories and barely any protein, fats, or other nutrients needed to sustain health.

The evening meal typically consisted of a small piece of bread (about 200 grams or less) that was coarse, dark, and often made with sawdust or other fillers to bulk it up. The bread was sometimes accompanied by a tiny portion of margarine, a teaspoon of jam, or a piece of sausage or cheese, though these items were given infrequently.

8.content:
Nazi soldiers and SS guards at concentration camps were provided with significantly better, regular, and nutritionally complete meals. Their diet varied based on rank, location, and availability of supplies, but they generally had access to a variety of foods, including fresh produce, meat, and other protein sources. 

Regular Wehrmacht (German Army) soldiers received standard military rations, known as Einmannpackung or "one-man pack." These rations included canned meat, sausage, cheese, bread or hardtack (dry biscuits), and sometimes chocolate or sweets.
Soldiers were often provided with canned soups, vegetables, and stews, which were easy to transport and prepare in the field.
In addition to these rations, soldiers often received a daily supply of coffee or tea, sugar, and sometimes cigarettes or tobacco, which were considered morale boosters.

Alcohol was readily available to many SS guards and officers, often in the form of beer, schnapps, or wine. Drinking was common among the guards, and alcohol sometimes played a role in the brutal behavior of some personnel.
Higher-ranking SS officers received more luxurious rations and access to foods that were difficult to obtain for the general population, such as specialty breads, pastries, chocolate, and imported items.

9.content:
The Nazis strictly segregated prisoners by gender, maintaining separate barracks and, often, entirely separate sections of the camps for men and women.

Male and female prisoners typically had separate barracks, which were often located at different ends or in distinct areas of the camp. These sections were heavily guarded, and prisoners could not move between them.
Larger camps, like Auschwitz, were divided into separate sub-camps for men and women, sometimes separated by walls, fences, or large physical distances. Women were often housed in less secure, more overcrowded, and poorly maintained sections, making conditions even harsher for female prisoners.

Families were intentionally split apart upon arrival at the camps, with men, women, and children all being separated. This caused severe emotional distress, as many parents were forcibly separated from their children, who were often sent directly to extermination if they were too young to work.
In most extermination camps, families had no chance to reunite, as women, children, and the elderly were often among the first selected for killing.

During the arrival process, known as "selection," men and women were typically separated into two lines. SS officers would then decide who would be sent immediately to the gas chambers and who would be kept alive for forced labor.
Both men and women faced brutal selection processes, but women were often more vulnerable to being sent directly to extermination, especially if they were pregnant, elderly, or had young children, as they were seen as unfit for labor.

Women in camps faced a heightened risk of sexual violence, exploitation, and abuse from SS guards and officers, although this was not officially condoned by the camp administration. Female prisoners were sometimes forced into prostitution or sexual slavery.
Some camps had forced brothels where female prisoners were coerced into sex work to ‚Äúreward‚Äù male prisoners who collaborated with camp authorities or served as ‚Äúkapos‚Äù (prisoners who oversaw other prisoners). These brothels were part of an inhumane system that exploited female prisoners further.

10.content:
The Kommandant (camp commandant) was the highest-ranking officer at each concentration camp. They were directly responsible for managing the operations of the camp, enforcing Nazi policies, and overseeing the daily activities of both the guards and the prisoners.
The commandants were often ruthless, with the authority to order mass executions, brutal punishments, and other forms of cruelty against prisoners. They were also in charge of maintaining the camp‚Äôs infrastructure, food supply, and overseeing forced labor.
Commandants reported to higher SS officers, including Himmler and his deputies.
